story:
Imagine a world where you can choose who you want to be and what you can learn.


Imagine a world where your physical growth is matched by your mental growth.


Imagine a world where you can learn as you play.


With Nativo Digital you can do just that. 


Bridging the gap between the Southern hemisphere and our increasingly technological world - one student at a time.

Less than 4% of the tech industry originates from Hispanic roots. Bouncing in between jobs and school and finally finding her passion in technology education, founder of World Tech Makers, Ilana Milkes, was inspired to raise that number. Out of her desire to empower people that want to learn and her drive to provide newer perspectives to our industrial world, WTM was born.
Our company brought to Latin America its first ever onsite coding bootcamps. Scraping money together through pitch competitions and small investments, we've been able to expand our idea into a multinational company. Starting in Colombia, these programming courses set the stage for a Latin American developmental revolution. In just 12 weeks, anyone from advanced engineers to elementary students can develop the skills to be leaders in technology development and entrepreneurship.

Now we want to expand, and we need your help to do it.

We want to broaden our reach even further. Hoping to bring our multilingual programming courses online, WTM just launched its very own gamified system, Nativo Digital.

Unfortunately, we don't have any funding left for Nativo, and with only the backbone of the program currently produced and available online, we need as much help from the global community as possible to complete the game.

As is commonly understood today, without vertical expansion, without creating something new, and without innovation, our currently dynamic world will become stagnant. Here at World Tech Makers, we are working in order to prevent just that. 

With your help, we can create the next generation of revolution igniters.


   


So what do we have so far?

Nativo is still in its beginning stages of being created. While the website is launched and the BETA is under development, we haven't been able to create the actual gamified platform on which our students can learn. We have been able to outline our program: an online programming course in which you can create your own avatar that grows alongside your technological knowledge to help you keep track of your own progress and work through coding challenges. We've created the characters, animations, and curricula necessary for Nativo too. However, putting this all together is the most difficult and costly part of the entire process, and that's where you come in. 

The ultimate goal of this project is to have animated programming courses available in four languages - English, French, Spanish, and Portuguese. We want all our students to have the same learning experience and come out of the course feeling comfortable enough to code, regardless of the challenge. The cost of creating this gamified experience for all our students in one language, let alone four, is quickly adding up. In order to expand the reach of technology education across the globe, we need your help and that of the entire international community.

     

What We Need & What You Get

We need $100,000 to complete our task. While that definitely is a large sum of money (I mean, look at all those zeros), without this money we won't be able to:

  • Develop Nativo's already standing website (www.nativo.digital)
  • Pay for the software required to create, animate, and gamify Nativo
  • Create a high-quality learning experience for all our students
  • Fund programming courses available in the six most important languages of the future - Javascript, HTML, CSS, Java, Python, and Ruby on Rails 
  • Make the program as accessible as possible through low-cost monthly subscriptions and availability on several other operational platforms including iOS and Android
  • Compensate all the hardworking, sleep-deprived, and deeply passionate team members of Nativo & WTM
  • Give back to all our supporters via our super awesome perks (because without all of you none of this would be possible)

The Future

The first time WTM launched its onsite bootcamps, our success was almost unprecedented. Throughout the process we learned that our drive and hard work in conjunction with our passion to spread technology education paved the way for a rewarding road ahead. Most importantly, however, we learned that without the support of our surrounding communities and all of you, our goals would have never become a reality.
To thank all of you and to continue our mission for years to come, we want to make Nativo as accessible as possible. In the near future, once Nativo is fully funded and developed, we want to partner with non-profits that work with children all across the world in impoverished and developing regions to truly give them the access to the technology education they deserve.

                    


Before then, however we need to make sure this project is successful and easy to use. As a relatively new startup with an extreme passion and widespread mission, we can often underestimate how difficult it actually is to accomplish the task at hand. So we'll be honest with you - yes, it will take us more than just a few weeks after we're fully funded to produce Nativo, and yes, there will be mess-ups to fix the first time around. But after a few go-arounds, we're sure that we will reach our goals. And that too, together with you and your support.

So all that we ask in the meantime is that you support us, trust us, and bear with us because there's nothing more that we want than to strengthen the next generation of innovators and entrepreneurs. So believe us, the entire working, sleep-deprived, and borderline insane team here at WTM, when we say that yes, it may take time, but we will ignite a technological Renaissance across the world, and we will help children around the globe create the future. 

Don't Be Shy!

If you can't contribute or want to help out even more, don't be afraid to spread the word via Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram. Share the links yourself or use our super simple Indiegogo tools instead! You can also visit our share page for inspiration on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, and email messages you can share with the world!
And on behalf of the entire WTM team, I truly thank you from the bottom of my heart for supporting us and our mission and making our dreams and those of children across the world come true.

story:
Short Summary 

hi, well all of you know about the story of Earthquake which have lost thousands of life in Nepal. so we as an non-profit org called "Natural resources defense council"also doing our best on collecting and supplying relief materials in various villages of Nepal.till now we are continuing our food supply and tarpaulins etc but monsoon is falling soon so there it is very important to build temporary shelters and rebuild school . Therefore we would like to request you to support our campaign. 

we are planning to build shelters for villagers and rebuild schools as much as we can, we have already build few demo cottages in place called"Dhading"with the help of our foreign volunteers from Germany and France. we have mobilized local people who can work on rebuilding there homes or school using the local materials and we buy them some of the materials they need like tin plates so it is easy and cheaper to rebuild.

 DOING such a program we are feeling great to be part of them it is because of your support.Although govt and many NGOs are  working hard to rebuild in time is has been closer to monsoon . so it is important to run our progect as quicker as we can . therefore we would like to request you thankyou .

story:
Summary

 Hi everyone. My name is Clint Wu I'm twelve and an experienced lego builder. I am trying to create my dream of making a lego city ( using a variety of lego parts and modules with my original design )  of about 9 square meters and break a record for youngest lego builder to build something on this scale. After this, I strive to exhibit my creation in as many of occasion as possible. The primary locations are art and charitable events.

 My parents think that my project is a good idea and are willing to fund up to 3225 USD. However according to my detail budget the money that my parents are funding is not sufficient, So that's where I need your help in funding my project.

 After my project is complete, all spare change, if any, and exhibition revenues will go to IMC Sunday School, which is a charitable service in Hong Kong that helps less fortunate children learn english and exposure to different career. I've decided that I want to make others' dreams come true.

 I hope you take this time to think about contributing. If you decide to contribute you will always have a place in my heart and my life for making me and hundreds of others' dreams become a reality. Thank You.

Resources I Need & What You'll Get

I'm trying to raise enough money for myself to buy all the sets I need in order to create my masterpiece. After I raise the money, it will take approximately 1 -2 months to finish off my project.

  • I will need approximately 7000 USD to be able to complete my work of art. The money will be used to buy lego sets, tables and other spare parts. If I do make over my fund or have change to spare, all that money will go to charity and making other children's dream come true.
  • You'll get loads of perks including e-mails, personalised video thanks and first sneak peak images of the city.

The Impact

The goal of this is to try to make my dream and other less fortunate kids dream come  true.

  • My project will firstly make my dream come true, because of making my dream come true thus other's too, and last of all I really do believe that other children and unprivileged people should get a chance for their dream to come true. That's why i'm donating all the spare cash and 90% of exhibition incomes I get from this funding to charities and IMC Sunday School.
  • Eventually I will donate my city to the most favourable option for the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you are unable to fund my project. There are plenty of ways to help out if you can't fund it.

  • Share my campaign with your friends, family and everyone you know.
  • Use social media and spread the news. e.g Facebook, twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, wechat, line, e.t.c.

And that's all there is to my indiegogo campaign. THANKS!

story:
Shelter is a right, not a privelege

I am helping Boston's On the Rise to raise funds to help furnish "Miss J's" new apartment.  Miss J has recently begun to overcome the enormity of homelessness.  She has worked with On the Rise's day program to prepare her for a life and an apartment.  I hope that you, my trusted friends and family, will consider donating a few (or many) dollars to help this woman with the basic needs of an apartment.  Miss J is working hard to pay her bills, but to move in, she needs every basic we may take for granted.  I am not looking for used items here, as it is important for Miss J to feel ownership of her new items, rather than caretaking for someone else's goods. 

What she needs

Remember moving into your college dorm, and starting with a blank slate?  Use that as your imagination jumping off point.  Here is a list of the few items she truly needs, and one item she wishes for and their approximate prices.  The money will be pooled here, and I will purchase the items according to her wishes and deliver them to her new home:

  • Cooking pot/pan set $125
  • Bakeware $75
  • Cooking utensils $75
  • Toaster $55
  • Coffee Maker $50
  • 4 place silverware $75
  • 2 bed pillows $25
  • Alarm clock $15
  • 1 Queen comforter $75
  • 1 Queen sheet set $35
  • 1 Queen sized blanket $55
  • 1 bath mat $15
  • 4 sets of towels $80
  • Broom $15
  • Mop $15
  • Cleaning products $25
  • Toilet Paper $15
  • Laundry detergent $15
  • Dish soap $5
  • & her wish: a very small flat screen tv (flat so it takes up less room in her apartment, and a television because she lives alone without company).  $250

Safety, Community & Advocacy

for Homeless Women

Each year, On The Rise helps and average of 40 women secure housing of their own.  Housing brings new challenges and new responsibilities for women.  With support from our community, we help each woman get settled in her new apartment by collecting housewares she needs to make her place feel like home.

About "Miss J"

Miss J is almost 60 years old.  She has grown children who live in the Boston area, but due to their own financial circumstances they have not been able to support her
She says financial struggles, lack of resources, illness, not having a spouse, and death of a parent have played a role in how she became homeless. Miss J has called shelters home in recent years and connected to On The Rise through another woman who used their services.

“Every day is anxiety filled when you are homeless – I worry about not getting into a shelter at night (shelters reach capacity and not everyone can stay indoors) feeling lost, scared, anxious and unsafe, and often times I was hungry until I came to On The Rise. Here they gave me things from clothing to compassion and always welcomed me in and helped me address the day-to-day. " She says that On The Rise is a place that doesn’t judge you despite your situation. “Sometimes it’s like society thinks homeless people aren’t fit to be in the real world, like we should be scorned because we don’t have a home.” Living on the streets can lead to depression and anxiety, to trauma and mental illness and Joan feels housed people don’t always know the realities of what homeless people go through day to day to simply survive.

Now that she has a place of her own, Miss J hopes to decorate it in bright “Spring-type” colors like blue, yellow, green, pink, and lavender. She plans to stay connected to the positive people and groups who have lifted her up during these tumultuous years. “On The Rise is a blessing in disguise. I am grateful for the opportunity to come here.”

Although she will start a new chapter in life, Miss J will continue to remain a part of the community as new challenges arise and goals are achieved. Thanks to generous people like you, drives like these allow women to settle in quickly. The retention rate for housed women in the past 5 years is 90% due largely in part by your involvement in helping women make their house a home! 2015 is the 20th Birthday for On The Rise and they are heading up a capacity building campaign so that they can work with housed women in an even more profound way. Thank you for all you can do to help me, On the Rise, but most importantly "Miss J."

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you don't have the dollars, but you got a gift of one of the items above and haven't been able to use it.  I am happy to accept a donation of one of the items above.  You may mail it to me directly.  Email dustinrennellsdesign@gmail.com for more information.

Please help.

story:
Brazilian Day Philadelphia 2015 

You Are Invited! Free Family Fun! 

Brazilian Day Philadelphia 2015 is the much awaited annual celebration of Brazil’s rich culture. Though only in its second year in Philadelphia, our festival boasts an empowering mission to bring the best of Brazil to Philadelphia, build community, and celebrate diversity.

Mark your calendar!

Date: Sunday, September 20, 2015
Time: 1PM -7PM
Location: Great Plaza, Penn’s Landing

Who We Are

Project Capoeira, Inc. is the proud organizer of Brazilian Day Philadelphia. As a 501(c)(3) non-profit educational organization, our mission is to foster intercultural understanding and a sense of community through arts education and social outreach. We devote ourselves to develop and share the art of Capoeira, an Afro-Brazilian art form that combines elements of martial arts, games, music, and dance. 

How You Can Make a Difference


Brazilian Day is one of our innovative social outreach projects to create an environment that builds and strengthens the Brazilian community in the region. The festival also aims to promote understanding, respect, and appreciation for the Brazilian culture and community. This year, Brazilian Day will take center stage with the backdrop of the Pope’s historical visit to Philadelphia a week later. We are thrilled to have the opportunity to help solidify Philadelphia as an international destination for tourism and business.

No Money, No Mission! This project is our most challenging and costly undertaking. Would you help us raise the much needed funds to make Brazilian Day 2015 another success?

Your donation will help pay for event expenses, which include:

  • Performer fees 
  • City permits and fees
  • Special event insurance
  • Emergency Medical Services
  • Instrument and equipment rentals
  • Media and marketing materials and related fees
  • Performer transportation and lodging 
All donations are tax-deductible. And your donation may be eligible for your employer's matching gift program.


Closing

Every dollar counts! Your generous donations enable us to develop innovative projects, such as Brazilian Day, to serve our community. Please consider donating your time as a volunteer for the event if you are unable to donate money, and make some noise about this fundraising campaign. We appreciate your support and thank you in advance for your generosity. We hope to see you, your family and friends on Brazilian Day! 

Sincerely, 

Adenilson Dos Santos (Mestre Doutor)
Chief Executive Director
Project Capoeira, Inc., 1213 Race Street, Ground Floor, Philadelphia, PA 19107
215-601-9117, 215-317-1392


P.S. If you'd like to make a  donation by check, please make the check payable to "Project Capoeira" and mail to the address above.

donations are tax-deductible. And your donation may be eligible for your
employer's matching gift program.
 
Closing


Every dollar counts! Your generous donations enable us to develop
innovative projects, such as Brazilian Day, to serve our community. Please consider donating your time as a volunteer for the event if you are unable to donate money, and make some noise about this fundraising
campaign. We appreciate your support and thank you in advance for your generosity. We
hope to see you, your family and friends on Brazilian Day! 
Sincerely, 

Adenilson Dos Santos (Mestre Doutor)
Chief Executive Director
Project Capoeira, Inc., 1213 Race Street, Ground Floor, Philadelphia, PA 19107
215-601-9117, 215-317-1392




P.S.
If you'd like to make a  donation by check, please make the check payable
to "Project Capoeira" and mail to the address above.

story:
I am currently a second year fashion student at Manchester metropolitan university.
I have recently been emailed with the opportunity to move to China In April 2016, for a three month fashion internship with Kashion. 
Kashion, is a company which designs for womenswear labels such as asos and All saints. 
whilst in China my week will be as followed:
3 days in Unviersity
2 days shadowing the design team in the company

(the weekend) exploring the amazing place that is china!!!!!

My hard working aesthetic has paid off however I need your support in getting me there :) 

I adore my course to the extent where I prioritise it above any other costs. I am working had to save the money myself however your support would mean a lot and i have always said if i get far in this industry i will never forget those who have helped me

Those who know me personally, will know how ecstatic i am for this. I strive for success and the opportunities this China internship has brought past students is unbelievable.

You will be contributing to my dream, thankyou. If you need any more information before donating please contact me lmmurgatroyd@yahoo.co.uk

thankyou again

 Lisa Murgatroyd

story:
What is the Parole Preparation Project?

In New York State, 10,000 people are serving life sentences in state prisons.  Approximately 3,000 are eligible to return home, but have repeatedly been denied release by the Board of Parole. 

These parole-eligible individuals are disproportionately men of color from New York City who have served their minimum sentences, exhausted available programming, and done exceptional work to demonstrate their suitability for release.  They are artists, educators, and mentors.  The majority are over age 50, with many entering their 60s and 70s. Isolated from their families and communities, our elders seek to return to the community after serving decades in prison -- some as many as 30 to 40 years behind the walls.

We want them home!  

The Parole Preparation Project is an all-volunteer collaboration with people serving life sentences in New York State prisons to support them as they prepare for upcoming Parole Board interviews. 

Since July 2014, the Project has trained over 100 volunteers to work alongside 50 parole applicants to develop written advocacy materials and prepare for Parole Board interviews. In the past year, the Board has granted parole to 10 of the 24 Project collaborators who have had interviews -- a Project-related release rate of 41%!

What We Need

Our goal is to raise at least $6,000 through community support to help sustain the Project:

  • $2,500 will help cover travel costs to prisons across New York State
  • $1,000 will defray the costs of mailing parole applicants' advocacy materials
  • $1,000 will be used to compensate parole experts -- those who have appeared before the Parole Board and been released -- who share their expertise with the Project as trainers, speakers, and Project advisors
  • $1,000 will go toward funding interns, and
  • $500 will help underwrite the costs of volunteer trainings and materials.

Why Do We Need It?

These spending priorities are what make the Parole Preparation Project possible:

  • Prison visits are the foundation of the Project.  Visits are where human bonds are formed that deepen people's commitments to ending mass incarceration. 
  • Sending large packages back and forth is quite costly. People in prison who have paying jobs earn exceptionally low wages, and many Project volunteers are students or work in the non-profit sector.
  • The Project aims to amplify the voices and experiences of currently and formerly incarcerated people, who provide direction and leadership for our work.
  • As an all-volunteer effort, we rely on student interns to help sustain and grow the Project.
  • Volunteers are the ones who put the Project into practice, in collaboration with parole applicants.  Without volunteers, the Project would not exist!

Our Progress

We had an incredibly moving, inspiring, and humbling event on November 19, 2015, in NYC, where we welcomed home six of the nine people who have been released after collaborating with Parole Prep Project volunteers this year.  
  • We raised $2,000 at the event that is not reflected in our Indiegogo total -- so we're closer to our $6,000 goal than it appears!

Spread the Word!

Even if you can't contribute now, you can support the Parole Preparation Project by:

  • Inviting others to contribute to our fundraising campaign, and/or
  • Becoming a volunteer!

story:
Powerfull Cinema / El Poder del Cine

Without a doubt, cinema is an artistic expression of social changes, which helps to tear down ideological barriers, which gives light to individually unique human beings from all corners of the globe, with their hopes and struggles, and which directly or indirectly touches the emotional core of the public.
With the assistance of the cinematic arts, the festival of LGBT cinema, El Lugar Sin Límites, presents new alternatives of entertainment and information. It opens space for debate and reflection where different viewpoints are expressed about rights and self-determination. In our 13 years, we have served as witnesses to the way in which cinema, through the stories that it tells, has helped to unite people, to forgive others and forgive ourselves, to demand rights, to inspire new challenges to tear down the barriers that separate society; ultimately, creating a space without limits where each person can be whoever he or she desires, while always respecting each other.
Aware of the fact that culture occupies a strategic position in the search for solutions to social problems, the festival appears at the end of the year 2002, in commemoration of November 27th, 1997, the date on which the Constitutional Court of Ecuador declared unconstitutional Article 516 of the Penal Code, in which homosexuality was considered a crime. This date marked an end to constant human rights violations and the persecution of LGBT Ecuadorians.
The festival simultaneously takes place in five Ecuadorian cities, counting on a diverse acceptance of non-commercial LGBT cinema (feature length films, documentaries, art house short films), that tell life stories with a social message. However, the festival is not merely a projection of movies. Rather, it is one of the most diverse and important confluences of the Ecuadorian LGBT community and every dollar that you contribute will help us to organize activities like:
·  The bestowing of the Max Awards to the greatest cinematographic works

  • The publication of the Max Magazine, an informative, non-profit medium, whose fundamental purpose is to provide positive information surrounding LGBT individuals
  • Performance Art Exposition, whose objective is to foster the conversation about the realities of LGBTI individuals from different points of life
  • Shows featuring national LGBT artists
  • Film forums with LGBT rights activists, with the films providing the general guidelines of the discussion
  • Presentations in the presence of directors and actors, who speak with the public and provide interviews to the media and who share their experiences and points of view with the world.

All of these activities help to eliminate the prejudices and taboos that society holds regarding LGBTI individuals, and they foster respect through the understanding of the rights of others. Through this, the festival becomes the most inclusive, diverse, and participatory activity, favoring exceptional and safe spaces for the attendants.

With your support, you will help us ensure that this space thrives and continues to grow.

----------

Sin lugar a dudas el cine es una expresión artística de cambio social, que ayuda a derribar fronteras ideológicas, que presenta desde distintos rincones del planeta seres de carne y hueso, con sus esperanzas y luchas, que directa o indirectamente tocan a los asistentes en su dimensión emocional.

Con la ayuda del séptimo arte, el festival de cine LGBT El Lugar Sin Límites, presenta nuevas alternativas de entretenimiento e información, abre espacios de debate y reflexión donde se exponen diferentes puntos de vista sobre el derecho a la autodeterminación.   En estos 13 años hemos sido testigos de cómo el cine a través de las historias que cuenta, ha ayudado a unir personas, a perdonar y perdonarnos, a reclamar derechos, a inspirar nuevos retos, a derribar las barreras que separan a la sociedad; en definitiva a crear un lugar sin límites, donde cada persona puede ser lo que desea siempre respetando a los demás.

Consientes que la cultura ocupa un lugar estratégico en la búsqueda de soluciones a los problemas sociales, el festival surge a finales del año 2002, en conmemoración del 27 de noviembre de 1997, fecha en la cual el Tribunal Constitucional del Ecuador, declaró inconstitucional el artículo 516 del Código Penal (de ese entonces), en el que se consideraba al homosexual como delincuente, ésta fecha puso fin a violaciones constantes de derechos y persecución de personas LGBT.

El festival se realiza simultáneamente en cinco ciudades ecuatorianas, cuenta con una variada acogida de cine no comercial LGBT (largometrajes ficción, documentales, cortometrajes, videoarte), que cuentan historias de vida con mensaje social.  Pero el festival, no es sólo proyección de películas, es uno de los encuentros artísticos culturales más variados e importantes de la comunidad LGBT ecuatoriana, y cada  dólar  que puedas  aportar  ayudará  a financiar actividades como:  

  • Entrega de Premios Max a los mejores trabajos cinematográficos,
  • Publicación de la Revista Max, medio informativo sin fines de lucro, cuyo propósito fundamental es brindar información positiva en torno a las personas LGBT.
  • Exposición Artística En Carne Viva, cuyo objetivo es poner en discusión la realidad de personas LGBT desde diferentes puntos de vista.
  • Espectáculos con artistas LGBT nacionales.
  • Cine foros, con activistas de derechos LGBTI, siendo la película la que da los lineamientos generales de la discusión.
  • Proyecciones en presencia de directores, actores-actrices, quienes dialogan con el público y conceden entrevistas a medios de comunicación, quienes comparten sus experiencias y formas de ver al mundo.

Todas estas actividades contribuyen a eliminar preconceptos y tabúes que la sociedad tiene sobre las personas LGBTIs, ayudan fomentar el respeto a través de la comprensión de las razones del otro, haciendo de este festival una actividad más inclusiva, diversa y participativa, favoreciendo con espacios de calidad y seguros para los asistentes.

Con tu apoyo ayudarás a que este lugar se mantenga y siga creciendo.

What we need / Lo que necesitamos 

We need your monetary assistance to finance part of the logistics of the lgbti film festival "El Lugar Sin Limites" . Our goal is to raise $ 4,000. Every dollar helps us a lot.

---

Necesitamos tu ayuda monetaria para financiar parte de la logística del festival de cine lgbti  "El Lugar Sin Limites".  Nuestra meta es recaudar $4000. Cada dólar nos ayuda un montón.

The Impact / El impacto

Through the activities organized at the International Film Festival "El Lugar Sin Límites",, we want to vanish the social impositions that oppress us. We want to celebrate our differences and let other people know that being gay, lesbian, bisexual, intersex or queer is not a punishment, nor is it an inferior state of existence. Instead, it is simply the wonderful possibility of loving how and whom we want to love. And it is also the possibility of being exactly who we want to be. 

---

Queremos a  través de las  actividades  organizadas en el Festival  Internacional  de cine lgbti  "El Lugar Sin Límites".  borrar las imposiciones sociales que nos oprimen, celebrar nuestras diferencias y dar a conocer  que el ser  lesbiana,  gay,  transexual, bisexual, intersex, no es una maldición, ni un estado inferior del ser humano, sino, la maravillosa posibilidad de querer a quien queremos querer y ser quien queremos ser.

Other ways in which you can help / Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

If you cannot help us with money, you can help us by posting this page on facebook, twitter, anywhere on the internet or outside of it. You can help  us by  talking about our  campaign with  your  family,  your  friends, your enemies,  your neighbor,  and everybody else. And of course,  you can  help  us by  showing up to  the events  and bringing people with you.

---

Si no puedes  ayudarnos con dinero,puedes ayudarnos posteando esta página en Facebook, en  twitter,  en  cualquier lugar  del  mundo  virtual o  en  el mundo  real, contándole  a tu familia, a  tus  amigos, a  tus enemigos,  a la vecina y a  todos  los demás.  Y por supuesto  asistiendo a  los eventos del   festival de cine El Lugar Sin Límites. Vale mencionar que Indiegogo es una prestigiosa plataforma mundial para recaudar fondos. Donar dinero es seguro, y no te cobran ningún gasto adicional por la transferencia.

story:
Imagine a toy that helps children to learn how to think positively and meditate at an early age!  Help the next generation focus on positive things, and provide them with tools to reduce stress and maintain their wellbeing!

"I think this is a wonderful idea for young, fresh minds. The sooner a young child learns to be positive the brighter the future looks. Meditation is something I feel everyone should experience and the thought of introducing this to a young child is absolutely wonderful. Thank you for thinking of this loving idea." - Kathy Lockyer

Inspiration

The inspiration for the idea of Abey the Dolphin came on Family Day this year when I received a Facebook message from Hermine Zossougbo, a mother of two from South Africa.  

Hermine wrote, "Like you, I want nothing more than to enlighten.  On my journey, I came to learn the value of self love, which is the value I want to share I have an idea of making a smart electronic doll for girls to teach and help know that love start with oneself I see."

Hermine had already spent her savings working with a company to develop the idea, but she was not happy with what they had come up with.   Hermine asked me to help her.  From that spark, the concept of Abraham Bear (now Abey the Dolphin) evolved.    


About Me

My name is Janine Newhook.  I worked as an Engineer for 12 years developing opto-mechanical devices, medical robotics, and space robotics.  I am also an Artist, Graphic Designer, Energy Worker, and Blogger.  

I am now a Mother of two wonderful boys and I have seen the impact of positive thinking on my children.  I would like to make a difference by helping to teach other children how to be positive and meditate with an interactive, educational toy.


Product

Abey the Dolphin is a cuddly, super soft toy concept with push button features, on the fins, tail, and tummy, which connects to a computer to be personalized with the child’s likes, and preferences.  Abey the Dolphin is intended for 3 year olds and up.  

          


Features include:

  • Guided meditations to quiet the mind and relax, followed by five minutes of music.  Meditations include deep breathing, relaxing body parts from head to toes, breathing in "calm" and out "peace", flying over the Earth, floating on a calm river...
  • Happy music options (dance party!), or, bed-time music options
  • Questions to encourage positive thinking 
  • The heart lights up and flickers like water when pressed


What is Needed

At this time, the intent is to raise some initial funds to perform a prior art search and explore options including licensing to a corporation, sourcing potential manufacturers, and possibly working with partners/investors.  Further, I plan to contact toy manufacturers to estimate the development cost of Abraham Bear to determine how much investment is required.  

There has already been some interest from investors.  Once I have a better understanding of the costs and interested parties, I will put together an investors information package.   Please contact me if you would like an investors information package when it is available.  

If I meet my crowd funding goal, and Abey the Dolphin becomes a product, any excess funds contributed over the goal will be used to donate Abraham Bears to children in need.

If this is a toy you would purchase for your child or grandchild, and you feel inspired by my vision, your support would be greatly appreciated!


The Impact

Meditation and positivity has been shown in numerous studies to help people, including children, to significantly improve their well being, self esteem, and ability to cope with stress.


"Studies show that in the minutes right after meditating, we experience feelings of calm and contentment, as well as heightened awareness and empathy. And, research even shows that regular meditation can permanently rewire the brain to raise levels of happiness."

From: http://higherperspective.com/2015/01/happy.html...

Harvard Unveils MRI Study Proving Meditation Literally Rebuilds The Brain’s Gray Matter In 8 Weeks

A study, conducted by researchers at the University of Massachusetts Medical School, taught mindfulness to a group of people with clinical levels of anxiety and found that 90% experienced significant reductions in anxiety - and depression too. [1]

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think this is a great idea, please share this campaign to help me demonstrate that this is a product people would like and will purchase: 

  1. Share the IndieGoGo page on Facebook & Twitter:

    http://igg.me/at/abeythedolphin

  2. "Like" and share the Abraham Bear page on Facebook:

    https://www.facebook.com/abeythedolphin

  3. Follow Abraham Bear on Twitter and retweet:

    http://twitter.com/abeythedolphin

 Thank you!


Visit abeythedolphin.weebly.com!

[1]  Kabat-Zinn, J., Massion, A. O., Kristeller, J., Peterson, L. G., Fletcher, K., Pbert, L., Lenderking, W. & Santorelli, S. (1992). Effectiveness of a meditation-based stress reduction program in the treatment of anxiety disorders. American Journal of Psychiatry. 149. 936-943.
story_txt:
Imagine a toy that helps children to learn how to think positively and meditate at an early age!  Help the next generation focus on positive things, and provide them with tools to reduce stress and maintain their wellbeing!"I think this is a wonderful idea for young, fresh minds. The sooner a young child learns to be positive the brighter the future looks. Meditation is something I feel everyone should experience and the thought of introducing this to a young child is absolutely wonderful. Thank you for thinking of this loving idea." - Kathy Lockyer
Inspiration


The inspiration for the idea of Abey the Dolphin came on Family Day this year when I received a Facebook message from Hermine Zossougbo, a mother of two from South Africa.  
Hermine wrote, "Like you, I want nothing more than to enlighten.  On my journey, I came to learn the value of self love, which is the value I want to share I have an idea of making a smart electronic doll for girls to teach and help know that love start with oneself I see."Hermine had already spent her savings working with a company to develop the idea, but she was not happy with what they had come up with.   Hermine asked me to help her.  From that spark, the concept of Abraham Bear (now Abey the Dolphin) evolved.    



About Me


My name is Janine Newhook.  I worked as an Engineer for 12 years developing opto-mechanical devices, medical robotics, and space robotics.  I am also an Artist, Graphic Designer, Energy Worker, and Blogger.  
I am now a Mother of two wonderful boys and I have seen the impact of positive thinking on my children.  I would like to make a difference by helping to teach other children how to be positive and meditate with an interactive, educational toy.

Product
Abey the Dolphin is a cuddly, super soft toy concept with push button features, on the fins, tail, and tummy, which connects to a computer to be personalized with the child’s likes, and preferences.  Abey the Dolphin is intended for 3 year olds and up.  
          




Features include:






Guided meditations to quiet the mind and relax, followed by five minutes of music.  Meditations include deep breathing, relaxing body parts from head to toes, breathing in "calm" and out "peace", flying over the Earth, floating on a calm river...


Happy music options (dance party!), or, bed-time music options


Questions to encourage positive thinking 


The heart lights up and flickers like water when pressed







What is Needed
At this time, the intent is to raise some initial funds to perform a prior art search and explore options including licensing to a corporation, sourcing potential manufacturers, and possibly working with partners/investors.  Further, I plan to contact toy manufacturers to estimate the development cost of Abraham Bear to determine how much investment is required.  

There has already been some interest from investors.  Once I have a better understanding of the costs and interested parties, I will put together an investors information package.   Please contact me if you would like an investors information package when it is available.  

If I meet my crowd funding goal, and Abey the Dolphin becomes a product, any excess funds contributed over the goal will be used to donate Abraham Bears to children in need.
If this is a toy you would purchase for your child or grandchild, and you feel inspired by my vision, your support would be greatly appreciated!

The Impact

 Meditation and positivity has been shown in numerous studies to help people, including children, to significantly improve their well being, self esteem, and ability to cope with stress.

"Studies show that in the minutes right after meditating, we experience feelings of calm and contentment, as well as heightened awareness and empathy. And, research even shows that regular meditation can permanently rewire the brain to raise levels of happiness."
From: http://higherperspective.com/2015/01/happy.html...
Harvard Unveils MRI Study Proving Meditation Literally Rebuilds The Brain’s Gray Matter In 8 Weeks
A study, conducted by researchers at the University of Massachusetts Medical School, taught mindfulness to a group of people with clinical levels of anxiety and found that 90% experienced significant reductions in anxiety - and depression too. [1]
    
Other Ways You Can Help


 If you think this is a great idea, please share this campaign to help me demonstrate that this is a product people would like and will purchase: 




Share the IndieGoGo page on Facebook & Twitter: 
http://igg.me/at/abeythedolphin


"Like" and share the Abraham Bear page on Facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/abeythedolphin



Follow Abraham Bear on Twitter and retweet: 
http://twitter.com/abeythedolphin

 Thank you!







Visit abeythedolphin.weebly.com!


[1]  Kabat-Zinn, J., Massion, A. O., Kristeller, J., Peterson, L. G., Fletcher, K., Pbert, L., Lenderking, W. & Santorelli, S. (1992). Effectiveness of a meditation-based stress reduction program in the treatment of anxiety disorders. American Journal of Psychiatry. 149. 936-943.

story:
Reach High And Touch The Stars is in its second year as a very successful program focused on teaching English and promoting critical thinking and  an attitude of overcoming challenges and attaining success for school age children ages 9 to 12 years old.

Learning to speak and write English is one thing Armenians who are looking to have a better life is very important.  This program has shown that positive and focused teaching method can make a difference.  teaching children English in the public schools and therefore a great many children  are tutored in English.  

This is good for children whose parents can afford it, however there are many parents who cannot afford to pay for these private lessons.  

For this reason Heghine Sheikha' Children’s Advocacy Non-Governmental Օrganizatiօn is seeking your help to provide FREE tutoring classes in English writing and speaking skills to children. 

In addition to teaching English, the project will help increase the self-confidence and outlook of children in Armenia.  This will happen as they learn and understand the personal story of NGO President Heghine Movsesyan. 

Heghine has severe physical handicaps but has made her life into a true success story. 

She is a role model on how to become more positive and more successful, qualities that are severely lacking throughout Armenia.

Heghine makes her living and helps to support her family by working at the Vanadzor Emergency Call Center as well as by teaching private English lessons. 

She is donating her teaching skills and her home as a classroom.  

We are asking you to help raise the funds needed to provide transportation for the students who do not live close by, to provide healthy snacks and school supplies such as notebooks and pens.

The program will run for 10 months meeting twice a week in two small groups, one group of six and another group of seven children. 

The total budget is $1,600 this includes $200 for school supplies, $800 for snacks and $600 for transportation.    

Certainly not a lot of money for a program with the potential to change the lives of these children and to help develop a new model of Armenian personal giving and self confidence in a country that can use a lot more of both qualities. 


Please help us..and if not you, please forward this email to others who might be interested.  


Thank you


Steven M. Greenberg

story:
WHAT IS MARCH AGAINST MONSANTO? March Against Monsanto NYC is part of a global call to action aimed at informing the public of the long term, sustainable plans to stop Monsanto's corrupt activities and damage to life on our planet. Currently, marches will occur on six continents, in 52 countries, with events in over 400 cities. In the US, solidarity marches are slated to occur in 47 states. Tami Monroe Canal, founder of March Against Monsanto (MAM), and a member of March Against Monsanto NYC (MAMNYC) was inspired to start the movement to protect her two daughters. “Monsanto’s predatory business and corporate agricultural practices threaten their generation’s health, fertility and longevity. MAM and

MAMNYC support a sustainable food production system. We must act now to stop GMOs and harmful pesticides.” Within the last three years March Against Monsanto NYC organizing group consists of passionate individuals from various backgrounds collectively united in the quest to (re)gain control of our food system to ensure the safety of that food system for now and for the future through non-violent demonstrations in New York City.

FUTURE GOALS:

Hold monthly lecture series, discussion groups and screening.

Community gardening in NYC that is GMO free.

Maintaining physical and collective visibility through non-violent demonstrations and direct actions.

THIS CAMPAIGN is our way of asking the community for their financial assistance to help maintain this active visibility and space for this global direct action. We believe that if we have enough people to consent to the funding of such space, we can further sustain such spaces without the corporate non-profit sponsorship. We believe that such grassroots spaces should always be funded by the people who care to maintain the growth and progress of such social movements.

HOW WAS IT FUNDED BEFORE? As part of our sacrifice to keep the movement alive everyone in the March Against Monsanto NYC planning group collectively donated not only their time but money to keep the last three #MAM events in place.

WHAT IS THE FUNDING FOR?

On May 23, 2015, thousands will once more march from Dag Hammarskjold Plaza to either Union Square or Tompkins Square Park to demonstrate our collective list of grievances against Monsanto in a non-violent and interactive gathering. The MAMNYC event will also feature a dynamic panel of guest speakers who will discuss Monsanto’s dominance over our food supply and present plans of action for undoing Monsanto's work here and around the world. We are also providing Educational space "MAMNYC FREE SCHOOL" focusing on providing lecture series, and educational programming around food justice.

We believe in sourcing and/or borrowing (material) we need to use during the duration of this event before simply resorting to unnecessary expenditures. If you’re interested in donating materials to help us out feel free to send an email to maminnyc@gmail.com. However there are some things that require to be paid and cannot be allocated through our traditional way of sourcing material or allocated through our communal way to sources ---- such as the following:

Rental fee for Sound System: $1000

Outreach materials (eg posters, flyers, buttons, etc) $800

Rental Fee and deposit for indoor space for freeschool: $300

Art budget $500 (banners, sign making material, puppets, etc)

Peace keeper safety vests for the march $60

MAM buttons for giveaways $300.00

Various NYC permit and parade fees $75.00

Whistles for march: $30.00

Maintenance and upkeep of the March Against Monsanto NYC website $240.00 (annual)

All the funding raised from the campaign will go towards financing the May 23 event, at which we plan to provide accessible materials the community can use to further engage and educate their local communities concerning about the role of corporations like Monsanto within our current system today.

CONCLUSION: March Against Monsanto NYC has truly been the space where we exercise the strength, will and power of the people. Through your strength and your courage, your sheer intent to be visible on what is right and to change the dynamics of how we look at our current food system today, we are able to collectively evolve our outlook on life forcing certain distructive behaviors and processes to change for the betterment of society. This movement would not have existed without your enduring support, and collective consent to the continuous need to stop corporations like Monsanto from placing profit over people. We are the movement and We are the change.

story:
Short Summary

Most companies have too small profits. Though, there are dozens of practical means to improve profits.

Normal business books are too long and boring and they provide no easy profit tools for entrepreneurs.  The books for students are too long and too scientific.

We want to share the Best Profit Tools in an easy way.

  • Our Lectures are short and colourful.
  • Our Audits deal with the most important questions.
  • Our Tools are Easy-to-Use. 


We, Erkki and Olli, have helped thousands of successful entrepreneurs improve their business during 25 years´period. We have strong background both from academic world and "real" worklife.


                              


https://fi.linkedin.com/pub/erkki-j-anttila/5/365/a25

https://fi.linkedin.com/pub/olli-lecklin/2/58/4a2

We also have written popular easy-to-use books for entrepreneurs in Finland.

See our philosophy at YouTube: We uploaded 88 videos to You Tube, in Finnish. 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UChySZMrPk7Vd4qEfe8oVaNQ/videos

See our philosophy at SlideShare: We also uploaded 65 presentations to SlideShare, in Finnish:

http://www.slideshare.net/LionSteps/presentations

We have learned a lot during our 25 years´ career and we want to share this experience with all entrepreneurs. This will be done via hard-cover books and e-books. And the Audits and the Tools can be uploaded from our website in September 2015.

Our Proft Lectures are very short and colourful, and our Profit Tools are unique and Easy-to-Use. We believe that they will help any entrepreneur. 

You will find practical tools for understanding and implementing issues as:

  • Active sales procedure
  • Most profitable customers
  • Fixed costs and variable costs
  • Empowering leadership style
  • Improving efficiency
  • Lean production
  • etc.

We also suggest, that You donate Profit Tools -Books to libraries, so students can read these all over the world.


What We Need and What You Get

We are collecting 30.000  dollars - or more - for this first book. The money is needed for:

  • Assistant´s salary
  • Translation and proofreading
  • Printing
  • Delivery

  • Our perks are books for yourself or donated books to libraries all over the world.
  • You can donate up to 1000 books, a 30.000 dollar perk!


The Impact

Normal business books are too long and boring and they provide no easy tools for entrepreneurs.  The students don´t have practical textbooks.

The impact of our Profit Lectures and Profit Tools will be remarkable in any company. We have hundreds of testimonies from entrepreneurs - from 10 countries. 

Students learn the Best Profit Tools much easier, faster and practical than before, when they get these books from libraries.



Please Share this Campaign!


Thank You!


Erkki & Olli

story:
Bricks, Share collaborative bricks of architecture

Bricks is an online app to reuse easily visual bricks of architecture projects & collaborate with your team and the community.

Hi everybody!

We are Sébastien and Alexis, the founders of Bricks.

We are based in Paris, France, and we want to revolutionize the way we design architecture projects! Thanks to your help we can drive architecture practice collaborative, following the path of web developers and many other professionals!

Sébastien Lucas

Alexis Lemoine Iribarne

Bricks is a web app for architects to collect & organize your visual inspirations easily and collaborate with other architects.

With bricks you can share and reuse elements of projects.

Bricks allows you :

  • to design faster starting from a project brick
  • concentrate on the originality of your project
  • share your experience with the community

The origin of the project

Sébastien Lucas talksabout the origin of the project

What is the problem you have faced ?

“As an architect in Paris, I have always been looking for ways to improve collaboration and productivity.

But in the company where I had the opportunity to work, I was feeling that people were losing too much time doing what others had already done, without any collaborative tool to share our experience on the projects we were working on.

Which elements you would have liked to share ?

"Architects often get inspirations from a lot of projects, whether they have been designed by themselves or by other architects, or even from the traditional building culture.

That does not mean they are copying other architecture, but generally we prefer a starter to design faster, to communicate more easily with our team and the client, and to facilitate the imagination.

Indeed a realisation with stunning photos is much more convincing than a sketch !”

The architect office of Norman Foster

Do you know good example of successful collaboration in other domains ?

“I am also the founder of Archiref, a collaborative platform for architects, that helps architecture professionals to find and share visual inspirations for their projects.

When developing Archiref and Bricks, I have used lots of awesome open source software bricks, that worldwide developers have built thanks to online collaboration.

Developers often work on open source projects for their pleasure and share them on platforms like github. But they are also rewarded by a sincere recognition from the community.

I often wondered why architects and creative professionals are less familiar with collaboration than developers.

I felt that it was not a fatality and could be changed if new apps or platforms allowed collaborative design to become a reality.”

Github is the collaborative platform of worldwide developers

So what is your proposal to improve collaboration among architects?

“So I have imagined Bricks, a web app that allows you to share design ideas and inspirations easily and could play an equivalent role for architects than github is currently playing for developers.”

Bricks is designed to make it easy for you to organize and share your visual inspirations and design new projects starting from reusable Bricks of project shared by the community!“

What is Bricks for?

Bricks is a web app to collect, organize and reuse visual elements of projects and collaborate with your team and the community.

Bricks allow you to identify reusable elements of projects on images you can pick everywhere on the web, from your hard drive, from online services like google drive or from your own projects…

What is a Brick?

A brick is a reusable element of a project like a stair, a roof type, a facade…

Anything you can split to reuse in a future project. Practically a brick is an annotated image of the element you want to reuse. The image is where the inspiration starts, but you can put on a brick all the information you need to be able to reuse this element and describe how to do it.

On a brick :

  • you can discuss with your team
  • attach related files like 3D model, pdf catalogues
  • see in which project it has been used
  • see who favorited it or has used it on a project
  • identify which products the project uses

If you create an account and connect to Bricks, you would see the current screen when you click on a brick

A list of bricks

A single brick

This is the simple Brick as we have set up the most important elements first, so that you can use Bricks as soon as possible

You can then fill :

  • a title
  • an image
  • a comment feed (using DISQUS service)
  • a description

We plan to enhance what a brick is, thanks to the present crowdfunding !

So here is a sketch of what we want a brick to be:

A mockup of what a brick will be in the next version

What do you think about it? Please tell us what you feel is lacking, or not so useful… You can really help us!

Collect inspirations from everywhere

Bricks allows you to collect inspirations images easily :

  • from your hard drive
  • from the web page
  • from web services like Facebook, Instagram, Google Drive, Dropbox…

Thanks to your help, we want to build an integrated image library, that will allow you to search in one place in lots of stunning architecture sources, like architecture platforms (architizer, archilovers, archiref, dezeen…), tumblr blogs, flickr groups, pinterest…

This will allow you to find inspirations more rapidly and add them in a click to your bricks online library.

Which sources you would like us to integrate in this library ? We are open to your suggestions ! Use the comment section to give us your opinion.

Organize your inspirations efficiently

The problem with inspiration, is not to have some, there are plenty of it ! Too much actually to look at all. But how to organize them to find them later, in a truly efficient way ?

The problem with Pinterest for example, is that for architects and creative professionals like us, it doesn’t have the project level ! I can collect stairs all the day, but which stair I would like to use in which project, this is important ! Isn’t it ?

In Bricks, you can work with your inspirations on a project per project basis.

In a project, you can organize your images on layers. Layers can help you to group all the elements you need to work on during the project life, for example stairs, roofs…

Layers are global, so you will find them in your shared library. And you will be able to get inspired from others projects developed by your team.

You can even define bricks relationships, that is for example a step in a stair, or a window in a facade. To do that, you have just to select the sub-element or sub-brick you want to get directly on the image. The relationship is saved, so you can navigate in the projects elements from one brick to another.

You can define sub element inside an image and we store bricks relationship to be able to display you the hierarchy of elements

Workflow & Benefits

While working on your project, you are building a collaborative bricks library you can share easily with who you want.

Bricks helps you to design faster, to concentrate on the originality of your project, and to contribute to a shared knowledge base on which to start new projects.

At the same time when you are working on a specific project, you will also have access to a personal images library, where you can find all the images you have used in your projects and filter them by tags, usage…

This allows you to have a bird’s eye view of the work of all your team and reuse past inspirations in new projects.

You can set your projects sharing the same way as in google drive :

  • private
  • shared to a specific group of people
  • public and index by search engines

If you share your "bricks of projects” publicly, you will allow people to build new design on past ideas, which has always been the way creative people have been working.

What we will do thanks to your support

You could help us greatly, explaining us your specific needs. We need to understand how you are currently organizing your inspirations for your architecture and creatives work.

To develop Bricks more rapidly we need at least 10 000 US$ to give us the opportunity to work full time on the project for 2-3 months and have some exterior helps of web developers.

We want to improve the online version with the following awesome features :

  • Team collaboration : Make possible to create team, give permissions access on a project per project basis.
  • Integrated bricks library : We want to aggregate awesome architecture images from different sources to be able to find everything in the same place, and add inspirations images easily to your bricks library
  • Improved bricks organisation : Brick are annotated image that can have tags, layers, projects, sub-bricks, similar bricks… The data structure of a brick needs to be improved to allow organizing your inspirations in a powerful yet easy way
  • Improved Search and tagging The current search is quite simple and working, but we can do much better to make you find the bricks you need when you are on your projects

Bricks is using latest javascript technologies namely Angular.js and Node.js.

We want to design a fast and simple User Interface that allows you to concentrate on your projects and rapidly pick inspirations as you used to do on your desk with physical books and magazines.

Bricks is available for free, as long as you share your inspirations with the community. Paid plans will enable private use with your team.

To Thank you we have a big christmas list ! Collectors Bricks goodies, huge discounts to Bricks plans, sponsorship and more…

We will offer you awesome perks to thank you for having backed the Bricks project at this important phase.

From t-shirts, to discounted subscription to Bricks app, ending to a private tour in Paris with bricks team. Everybody puts his brick to make the big wall of architecture collaboration.

  • Join the club: Goodies to thanks you for you support like a tee shirt… and your name and link to your site on the big wall of Bricks builder !

  • Use Bricks: Earn subscriptions for future Bricks paid plans at an incredible discount price ! The sooner you get on board, the cheaper it would be for you. But really the more important is the feedback you can give us. Your opinions and ideas how to build a better Bricks application is incredibly precious for us.

  • Co-Build: You helped us settle bricks architecture. We can meet and discuss to draw the future of architecture !

Let us change architecture together

We need your support to change the way architects design projects by leveraging collaboration and share culture.

Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.

Share the crowdfunding campain at go.openbricks.io And talk about Bricks and its collaborative project.

Follow @bricks_app or tweet about the campain. Share on Facebook

Thanks all for your interest in Bricks project.

If lot of architects start to collaborate, architecture can become really collaborative. We can start to design faster, and concentrate on our own originality to go further in our art while reinforcing the community !

The Architects community at latest Future Architecture Night we have organized in May 2015 in Paris
story_txt:
Bricks, Share collaborative bricks of architecture

Bricks is an online app to reuse easily visual bricks of architecture projects & collaborate with your team and the community.

Hi everybody!
We are Sébastien and Alexis, the founders of Bricks.
We are based in Paris, France, and we want to revolutionize the way we design architecture projects! Thanks to your help we can drive architecture practice collaborative, following the path of web developers and many other professionals!

Sébastien Lucas
  
Alexis Lemoine Iribarne
  

Bricks is a web app for architects to collect & organize your visual inspirations easily and collaborate with other architects.
With bricks you can share and reuse elements of projects.
Bricks allows you :

to design faster starting from a project brick
concentrate on the originality of your project
share your experience with the community


The origin of the project
Sébastien Lucas talksabout the origin of the project

What is the problem you have faced ?
“As an architect in Paris, I have always been looking for ways to improve collaboration and productivity.
But in the company where I had the opportunity to work, I was feeling that people were losing too much time doing what others had already done, without any collaborative tool to share our experience on the projects we were working on.

Which elements you would have liked to share ?
"Architects often get inspirations from a lot of projects, whether they have been designed by themselves or by other architects, or even from the traditional building culture.
That does not mean they are copying other architecture, but generally we prefer a starter to design faster, to communicate more easily with our team and the client, and to facilitate the imagination.
Indeed a realisation with stunning photos is much more convincing than a sketch !”

The architect office of Norman Foster
  

Do you know good example of successful collaboration in other domains ?
“I am also the founder of Archiref, a collaborative platform for architects, that helps architecture professionals to find and share visual inspirations for their projects.
When developing Archiref and Bricks, I have used lots of awesome open source software bricks, that worldwide developers have built thanks to online collaboration.
Developers often work on open source projects for their pleasure and share them on platforms like github. But they are also rewarded by a sincere recognition from the community.
I often wondered why architects and creative professionals are less familiar with collaboration than developers.
I felt that it was not a fatality and could be changed if new apps or platforms allowed collaborative design to become a reality.”

Github is the collaborative platform of worldwide developers
  

So what is your proposal to improve collaboration among architects?
“So I have imagined Bricks, a web app that allows you to share design ideas and inspirations easily and could play an equivalent role for architects than github is currently playing for developers.”
Bricks is designed to make it easy for you to organize and share your visual inspirations and design new projects starting from reusable Bricks of project shared by the community!“
What is Bricks for?

Bricks is a web app to collect, organize and reuse visual elements of projects and collaborate with your team and the community.
Bricks allow you to identify reusable elements of projects on images you can pick everywhere on the web, from your hard drive, from online services like google drive or from your own projects…
What is a Brick?

A brick is a reusable element of a project like a stair, a roof type, a facade…
Anything you can split to reuse in a future project. Practically a brick is an annotated image of the element you want to reuse. The image is where the inspiration starts, but you can put on a brick all the information you need to be able to reuse this element and describe how to do it.
On a brick :

you can discuss with your team
attach related files like 3D model, pdf catalogues
see in which project it has been used
see who favorited it or has used it on a project 
identify which products the project uses

If you create an account and connect to Bricks, you would see the current screen when you click on a brick

A list of bricks
  
A single brick
  

This is the simple Brick as we have set up the most important elements first, so that you can use Bricks as soon as possible
You can then fill :

a title 
an image 
a comment feed (using DISQUS service)
a description

We plan to enhance what a brick is, thanks to the present crowdfunding !
So here is a sketch of what we want a brick to be:

A mockup of what a brick will be in the next version
  

What do you think about it? 
Please tell us what you feel is lacking, or not so useful… 
You can really help us!
Collect inspirations from everywhere
Bricks allows you to collect inspirations images easily :

from your hard drive
from the web page 
from web services like Facebook, Instagram, Google Drive, Dropbox…


Thanks to your help, we want to build an integrated image library, that will allow you to search in one place in lots of stunning architecture sources, like architecture platforms (architizer, archilovers, archiref, dezeen…), tumblr blogs, flickr groups, pinterest…
This will allow you to find inspirations more rapidly and add them in a click to your bricks online library.
Which sources you would like us to integrate in this library ? 
We are open to your suggestions ! Use the comment section to give us your opinion.
Organize your inspirations efficiently
The problem with inspiration, is not to have some, there are plenty of it ! Too much actually to look at all. But how to organize them to find them later, in a truly efficient way ?
The problem with Pinterest for example, is that for architects and creative professionals like us, it doesn’t have the project level ! I can collect stairs all the day, but which stair I would like to use in which project, this is important ! Isn’t it ?

In Bricks, you can work with your inspirations on a project per project basis.
In a project, you can organize your images on layers. Layers can help you to group all the elements you need to work on during the project life, for example stairs, roofs…

Layers are global, so you will find them in your shared library. And you will be able to get inspired from others projects developed by your team.
You can even define bricks relationships, that is for example a step in a stair, or a window in a facade. To do that, you have just to select the sub-element or sub-brick you want to get directly on the image. The relationship is saved, so you can navigate in the projects elements from one brick to another.

You can define sub element inside an image and we store bricks relationship to be able to display you the hierarchy of elements


Workflow & Benefits

While working on your project, you are building a collaborative bricks library you can share easily with who you want.
Bricks helps you to design faster, to concentrate on the originality of your project, and to contribute to a shared knowledge base on which to start new projects.
At the same time when you are working on a specific project, you will also have access to a personal images library, where you can find all the images you have used in your projects and filter them by tags, usage…
This allows you to have a bird’s eye view of the work of all your team and reuse past inspirations in new projects.
You can set your projects sharing the same way as in google drive :

private
shared to a specific group of people
public and index by search engines

If you share your "bricks of projects” publicly, you will allow people to build new design on past ideas, which has always been the way creative people have been working.

What we will do thanks to your support
You could  help us greatly, explaining us your specific needs. We need to understand how you are currently organizing your inspirations for your architecture and creatives work.
To develop Bricks more rapidly we need at least 10 000 US$ to give us the opportunity to work full time on the project for 2-3 months and have some exterior helps of web developers.
We want to improve the online version with the following awesome features :


Team collaboration : Make possible to create team, give permissions access on a project per project basis.

Integrated bricks library : We want to aggregate awesome architecture images from different sources to be able to find everything in the same place, and add inspirations images easily to your bricks library

Improved bricks organisation : Brick are annotated image that can have tags, layers, projects, sub-bricks, similar bricks… The data structure of a brick needs to be improved to allow organizing your inspirations in a powerful yet easy way

Improved Search and tagging The current search is quite simple and working, but we can do much better to make you find the bricks you need when you are on your projects

Bricks is using latest javascript technologies namely Angular.js and Node.js.
We want to design a fast and simple User Interface that allows you to concentrate on your projects and rapidly pick inspirations as you used to do on your desk with physical books and magazines.
Bricks is available for free, as long as you share your inspirations with the community. Paid plans will enable private use with your team.
To Thank you we have a big christmas list ! Collectors Bricks goodies, huge discounts to Bricks plans, sponsorship and more…


We will offer you awesome perks to thank you for having backed the Bricks project at this important phase.
From t-shirts, to discounted subscription to Bricks app, ending to a private tour in Paris with bricks team. Everybody puts his brick to make the big wall of architecture collaboration.

Join the club: Goodies to thanks you for you support like a tee shirt… and your name and link to your site on the big wall of Bricks builder !
Use Bricks: Earn subscriptions for future Bricks paid plans at an incredible discount price ! The sooner you get on board, the cheaper it would be for you. But really the more important is the feedback you can give us. Your opinions and ideas how to build a better Bricks application is incredibly precious for us.
Co-Build: You helped us settle bricks architecture. We can meet and discuss to draw the future of architecture !

Let us change architecture together
We need your support to change the way architects design projects by leveraging collaboration and share culture.
Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
Share the crowdfunding campain at go.openbricks.io 
And talk about Bricks and its collaborative project.
Follow @bricks_app or tweet about the campain.

Share on Facebook

Thanks all for your interest in Bricks project.
If lot of architects start to collaborate, architecture can become really collaborative. We can start to design faster, and concentrate on our own originality to go further in our art while reinforcing the community !

The Architects community at latest Future Architecture Night we have organized in May 2015 in Paris

story:
Politics is Money!

We see it every day. Whether it is a single "representative" or an agency. The peoples voices are based on the money contributed. The special interest donates the most, so their voice is loudest.:

  • We are a Political Action Committee who has the goal to reverse the trend of money in politics and give the people more of a voice by fighting corruption and supporting individual freedoms.
  • We need to start lobbying ASAP. We need to get our representatives in front of our "representatives" and tell them them that their constituents are the "special interest" they need to be paying attention to.
  • Funding is the only limit to what we are capable of. Lobbying, Educating, and initating legal action when necessary.

Support our projects and we all can be represented! 

We have a multitude of ways that funding would be utilized:

  • Education: Open the eyes and ears of your fellow man, let them see what you politicians are doing TO us and get more voices.
  • Legal Action: Whether it is Initiating a recall of a politician who works against instead of for the people. Or filing legal actions against individuals or agencies to get rights recognized.
  • Lobbying: Within the boundaries of what is legally allowed, we will make sure the peoples interests are heard by your representatives.
  • Administrative & Research: Keeping up the fight, and getting in front of issues early!

Be Heard!

Imagine if we once again had representation? Imagine if our representatives were actually public servants again!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money can be tight, but it doesn't end there:

  • Spread the word, We need people to know what we are doing. Single voices can be drowned, a chorus carries!
