••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••  FUNDACJA ISHA  ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••
Byc moze nadal zastanawiasz sie, czy pieniadze ida w parze z oswiecona duchowoscia. Sadhguru jest bardzo rzadko spotykanym rodzajem spelnionego jogina i mistyka. Jest osoba oswiecona i... "czlowiekiem swiata". Nie siedzi samotnie medytujac w jaskini, chociaz jest jednym z najwiekszych joginow na naszej planecie.Tak wiec, czasami mozna zobaczyc go jak pedzi na motocyklu :)Jak sam mówi "...bycie uduchowionym nie musi oznaczać bycia niepraktycznym...".Jednak...To zycie jest dla mnie wysilkiem, aby pomoc ludziom doswiadczyc boskosci i wyrazic ich wlasna boskosc. Tak bys zaznal blogosci, ktora plynie z kontaktu z boskoscia w tobie.” – Sadhguru“Istnieje tylko jeden biznes na swiecie i dotyczy on dobrostanu ludzi.” – SadhguruSadhguru w 1992 roku zalozyl Isha, fundacje non-profit. Jest to organizacja mocno zaangazowana w niesienie pomocy ludziom w biednych obszarach wiejskich w Indiach. Fundacja udziela pomocy medycznej i spolecznej - leczac ludzi, angazujac ich w rozne aktywnosci (np. formy rękodziela) i budujac lub adoptujac istniejace juz szkoly dla dzieci. Isha jest takze zaangazowana w rozne inne dzialania, np. Projekt GreenHands (PGH). Jest to inicjatywa srodowiskowa Fundacji, ktorej celem jest zwiekszenie pokrywy zielonej w stanie Tamil Nadu do 33%, wymaganych dla przywrocenia rownowagi srodowiska. W tym celu zostanie posadzonych 114 milionow drzew. Pobito juz rekord Guinessa - 17 pazdziernika 2006 posadzono najwieksza ilosc sadzonek drzew w ciagu jednego dnia (852 587 sadzonek) :)Sadghuru jest rowniez zaangazowany w kontakty z liderami ekonomicznymi, chcac poprzez nich zyskac wplyw na poprawe jakosci zycia wielu milionow ludzi, ktorych zycie w znacznej mierze jest zalezne od postawy tych liderow. Osobiscie bral udzial w wielu miedzynarodowych forach ekonomicznych, jak np. w Davos.Powyzej mozecie obejrzec jedna z rozmow z ekonomicznymi liderami, tutaj z Vinita Bali, hinduska businesswoman, Dyrektor Zarzadzajaca i CEO Britannia Industries Limited.Powyzej mozecie obejrzec rozmowe ze znana indyjska dziennikarka telewizyjna Barkha Dutt.Stworzone przez Isha programy nauki jogi maja ogromna sile oddzialywania, powodujac glebokie wewnetrzne przemiany. Podobnie jak inspirujace projekty sluzace spolecznosciom i srodowisku sa one doceniane na calym swiecie, co znajduje odbicie w przydzielonym Isha statusie doradcy przy Radzie Gospodarczej i Spolecznej ONZ.
Fundacja potrzebuje prawdziwych pieniedzy, zeby udzielac takiej pomocy!Duchowosc i siedzenie w jaskini nie wystarczaja same w sobie do osiagniecia takich celow.
Sadhguru oferuje poprzez Fundacje Isha wiele programow jogi, wywodzacych sie z rdzenia wiedzy starozytnej jogi. Sa to szczegolowo dopracowane programy o bardzo duzej sile oddzialywania, glownie praktyki krija jogi, dzialajace bezposrednio na procesy energetyczne w organizmie i na fizjologię calego organizmu. Przy tym praktyki te sa tak skonstruowane, ze wymagaja wzglednie malo czasu oraz sa latwe do nauczenia. Poza praktykami krija jogi, Isha oferuje rowniez programy uczace kluczowych asan jogi (karma joga). Jest to rdzen starozytnej jogi, w czystym przekazie Patanjali, a wiec.. pierwotna forma jogi, bardzo trudna do odnalezienie obecnie na swiecie. Programy te nie maja nalecialosci regionalnych i kulturowych gromadzących się przez tysiace lat, ktore zmienily oblicze i znaczenie jogi. Jest to sama esencja starozytnej wiedzy o budowie wszechswiata, o tym jak odkryc zrodlo stworzenia wewnatrz nas samych i osiągnąć stabilny dobrostan.Czy wiesz, ze przekaz starozytnej jogi znajduje swoje potwierdzenie w koncepcjach i odkryciach wspolczesnej nauki?Czy wiesz, ze w tradycji jogi Shiva nie oznacza hinduskiego boga? Shiva doslownie oznacza "to czego nie ma" i odnosi sie dokladnie to tego samego zjawiska, ktore wspolczesna fizyka nazywa ciemna materia i ciemna energia. Do zjawiska, ktore jest wieksza czescia wszechswiata i jest zrodlem tego istnienia, a ktore znamy z wlasnego doswiadczenia jako rzeczywistosc fizykalna. Do inteligencji, ktora wykracza daleko poza ludzki umysl, i ktora konstruuje caly wszechswiat.
••••••••••••••••••••••••  MOJA JOGA  •••••••••••••••••••••••••
Zobacz w zakładce "updates" krótki opis historii wokół tego zdjęcia (update nr 3).Jestem gleboko zaangazowany w praktyke jogi (prosze nie mylcie tego z wyginaniem ciala w roznych przedziwnych pozycjach), codziennie okolo 2 godziny przeznaczam na joge. Jednak musze przyznac, ze kiedy zaczynalem praktykowac, nie myslalem, jak wielu zmian doswiadcze zaledwie po 3 miesiacach najbardziej podstawowej praktyki krija jogi (Shambhavi Mahamudra, 21 minut na wykonanie). Bylo to dla mnie duzym zaskoczeniem.  Jednak to jest moje doswiadczenie i trudno mu zaprzeczac.  Sa dwa rodzaje bledu w poznawaniu swiata, a zadnego z nich nie chcialem popelnic: albo zbyt latwo cos uznajemy i budujemy fantazyjne przekonania, albo zbyt szybko odrzucamy to, co nie pasuje do naszego modelu swiata i nie mozemy poznac nic wiecej, niz pozwala nasz dotychczasowy system przekonan .Zmiany których doswiadczylem:1) przestalem sie przeziebiac (przedtem przeziebialem sie conajmniej raz w miesiacu, juz nawet zaczalem powaznie sie martwic, ze moj organizm najwyrazniej szwankuje)2) najtrudniejsze dla mnie emocje staly sie duzo mniej intensywne i krotsze; zmiana nastapila w takim stopniu, ze nie moglem w to uwierzyc - zycie stalo sie o wiele latwiejsze :)3) moj proces myslenia stal sie jeszcze jasniejszy (choc myslenie zawsze bylo moja mocna strona ;) )Zapragnalem wiecej. Czy znasz... takie pragnienie, zeby poszerzac swoje mozliwosci? :) Obecnie robie wiele praktyk ze starozytnej jogi. Jestem gotow, by dotrzec do pelni. Chcialbym przekroczyc obecny zakres percepcji rzeczywistosci. Oczywiscie, to nie oznacza, ze chcialbym stracic rozum, czy "odleciec" :) Po prostu chcialbym sam doswiadczyc kontaktu ze zrodlem stworzenia. Ta wyprawa w Himalaje z Sadhguru jest milowym krokiem w tym kierunku. Jestem o tym gleboko przekonany. Kontakt z mistrzem jest czyms trudnym do przecenienia. To jak GPS w nieznanym terenie - cos co mogloby trwac dlugie lata mozesz zrobic w miesiace.W calym systemie jogi wszystko jest oparte na namacalnym doswiadczeniu, a nie na poleganiu na czyichs przekonaniach. Dlatego jedynym sposobem poznania jest osobiste doswiadczenie, sprawdzenie na wlasnej skorze.
••••••••••••••••••••••••  SADHGURU  ••••••••••••••••••••••••
Slowo ‘Isha’ oznacza pierwotne zrodlo stworzenia nieposiadajace formy . Kto za tym wszystkim stoi? Zobaczcie:
Oswiecenie Sadhguru.
Popoludniem 23 wrzesnia 1982 roku mlody biznesmen usiadl w swoim ulubionym miejscu na wzgorzu Chamundi. Kiedy siedzial tam z otwartymi oczami, nagle osunal sie w stan, w ktorym nie mogl rozroznic pomiedzy soba i swoim otoczeniem. To bylo jak zdumiewajaca eksplozja. "To co bylo "mna" bylo wszedzie." Po niemal 4 godzinach, ktore odczuwal jak kilka minut, powrocil do zwyklego poczucia siebie. Odkryl, ze jest we lzach, a jego umysl racjonalisty zmagal sie, zeby znalezc jakies wyjasnienie tego, co się z nim dzialo – “Wewnatrz mnie cos dzialo sie. Nie wiedzialem co. Jedyne co wiedzialem, to ze trafilem na skarb i nie chce go utracic."ZOBACZCIE jak opisuje SWOJE DOSWIADCZENIE tutaj w google na Konferencji INK w 2009.Mozna powiedziec, ze Sadhguru nie ustepuje w swym doswiadczeniu i mozliwosciach Buddzie Gautama."Wszystko w istnieniu, kazda fizyczna forma, jest kwestia geometrii. To czy cos funkcjonuje z latwoscia czy nie, podstawowo zalezy od perfekcji geometrii. Caly system hata yogi polega na tym - popraw swoja geometrie w taki sposob, zeby to urzadzenie moglo funkcjonowac bez tarc wewnatrz siebie. Dopiero kiedy nie ma wewnetrznego tarcia przestajesz byc problemem. Jednak kiedy juz samo istnienie stanowi dla ciebie problem, gdzie jest miejsce na pytanie o zwiekszanie zakresu swiadomosci? W takiej sytuacji to nie moze sie ci przydarzyc. Dopiero kiedy wszystko funkcjonuje z latwoscia mozesz sie czegos podjac. Kiedy nie jestes juz problemem, mozesz zajac sie czymkolwiek zechcesz. Albo - mozesz zamknac oczy i siedziec - oba wybory sa dostepne."- Sadhguru


DOLACZ DO TEGO PRZEDSIEWZIECIA!

Obiecuje, ze podziele sie z ludzmi wszystkim, czego uda mi sie doswiadczyc, tak szczerze jak tylko bede umial.TO JEST NAPRAWDE PROJEKT TYPU WIN-WIN.

story:
Dear donators,

The recent and ongoing earthquake devastation in Nepal is saddening. Videos and pictures in the media are horrific. So far as the rescue operation unfolds 1300 + individuals has been identified as dead and the numbers are said to be rising Latest here. 

To help the victims restore and regain the physical and mental trauma, we have decided to raise the fund and transfer to Gothalo Nepal. The team ,which has done exceptional social contributions in the past can be trusted to channelize the funds to the actual victims. In continuation of their social engagements, the team  successfully raised funds globally last year and  provided necessities to flood victims in Far Western Nepal. To see the details of the previous social engagement of the group please click Here.

Like all of you, we are deeply concerned and sorrowed about the massive disaster, the earthquake has brought forth. Hence, we are seeking to bring people virtually together, create a fund and try help the actual victims via "Gothalo Nepal". 

 By donating you are helping someone and their families just like ours - it will mean a lot to them. 

What We Seek

Any possible amount from your pockets can help build a considerable amount. Our dedicated "Gothalo Nepal " team will  definitely reach out the needy and offer help in any means deemed suitable. 


No doubt, your contribution made by cutting your expenses will restore the life, if not help pacify the physical and emotional wounds of the disaster. It is  much more than the prayers offered in the temples, mosque and church. The raised fund , transfers and usage of the funds will be updated as we go further. 

The Impact 

Nepal has, for the past decades been struggling itself on the widespread issues of fundamental human conditions - malnutrition, clean water, sanitation, epidemics, child labor, illiteracy, human trafficking, extreme poverty, electricity, cooking gas and many more  - Poverty in Nepal . Therefore, to a poor country like Nepal,  Earthquake disaster means a  massive  problem to cope up with wherein the supply of economic, human , medical, food and water resources  is rare, if not very hard to manage.  

Straightforwardly, the fundraising is intended to establish an economic resource , so that it can be directed to the individuals and family who have , 1)  Lost their loved ones for ever  2) Been seriously injured and cant afford  3) Have faced severe economic loss  4)Deeply traumatized with the human and economic losses 

Your valuable contribution of any amount can help save a child, restore health, reassure the traumatized and pacify the wounds. Lets not make this longer - , lets be united , lets donate and lets offer help from our possible means. 

Many heart wrenching photos can be seen at by clicking  here  Earthquake in Nepal photos

Other Ways You Can Help

You all can donate at other places too the link of which are -

1) Red Cross - https://www.redcross.org/combined-donate?donationProdId=prod9150029&retrieveData=1&flow=oc1

2) Save the children  - https://secure.savethechildren.org/site/c.8rKLIXMGIpI4E/b.9274575/k.FD90/Nepal_Earthquake_Childrens_Relief_Fund/apps/ka/sd/donor.asp

People in Kathmandu can help by providing food, clothes, blankets, water, tents, sleeping bags , torchlights , shoes and many other things. Please come forward to help individuals, departments, organizations, volunteers, authorities and families in the rescue operations and rehabilitation efforts.

Thank you guys, 

Khagendra

story:
Short Summary

At Access Inglés, we are a group of people passionate about making a change in the socioeconomic inequality in Chile.  Our super secret weapon?  English Education.

We work with schools to improve their English foreign language programs using capacity building methodology. This approach focuses on community buy in and long term, sustainable change. We start with an in depth needs assessment of English programs to identify performance gaps, then provide schools with resources and training to close those gaps.

We use practical steps to reach practical goals, tailored to the priorities and reality of the educational institution in a detailed Plan for Improvement. Access Inglés facilitates this plan, working closely with the school community to connect them with specialists and native English speakers to guide the necessary changes. We look for scalable solutions to address the overall lack of quality and efficiency of English programs in schools in Chile, Latin America and the World.


The Issue

English fluency is a key factor for obtaining quality of life in Chile.  For example,  However, according to the Inter-American Development Bank only 2% of Chilean adults are fluent.  And this level of fluency is not equally distributed.  As you can see in the graphic below, students who have enough money to pay for the incredibly expensive private education have a much better chance at reaching fluency in English.  Not very fair.

The above information comes from standardized government issued tests realized in 2010 and 2012 by high school juniors.

Amidst widespread progress and internationalization, Chile still doesn’t have an effective system for teaching English in public schools.  This naturally causes the  great divide between the population that can pay to send their kids to private schools and those who cannot afford the expensive and exclusive private schools.

Furthermore, without a sufficient level of English, students suffer noticeable setbacks, not only in school, but in their future career opportunities.  An estimated 75% of Chileans have been passed up for jobs due to insufficient levels of English.  When English is the official language for 12 international domains including business and democracy, its no wonder that Intermediate English speakers earn 30% more than their non-English speaking peers.  English is a tool for success.


That's Where We Come In

Our founder, Ellen, arrived in Chile specifically to combat the inequality in English opportunities for students from low-income and high income families.  After months of conversation and observation, Ellen developed a highly successful system for improving English programs working in 8 subsidized schools in Santiago.  

The resulting manual and assessment model was presented in May 2013 at the World Learning's Social Innovation Summit.  There it was choosen to receive funding that allowed Ellen to successfully implement the program in these 8 schools.  The results were astounding.  Students improved up to 15% in English test scores in just one year.  Furthermore, over 85% of professors and academic directors reported a significant positive improvement in their English programs.


What We Need & What You Get

We are now preparing to enter the public system with 5 pilot schools during the 2015 school year (March - June) and we need your help! 


We are looking for funding to get us off the ground as the NGO Access Inglés.  As of now, we all work for free and pay for everything out of our own pockets!  Resources are dwindling, but we want to keep going!  Here's where your $ goes.

Stipends & Fees

After-school teachers (2 classes)  1500.00

Public transportation stipends (10 volunteers)  1250.00

In-school needs assessment & general project coordination (5 schools)  2000.00

Legal processing and fees  750.00 

Office & School Supplies

Printer/copier/scanner:    100.00

Ink:  100.00

Laminator& laminating pouches:  150.00

Basic supplies (paper, envelopes etc):  200.00

Resource packs for 12 teachers:  750.00

Manual publication:  400.00 

Spreading the Word

Website domain (1 year):  20.00

Website hosting (1 year):  60.00

Website translation/proofreading:  300.00

Video shoot& editing:    1000.00

Business cards  100.00

Merchandise-campaign perks & gen. marketing  320.00 

You will get the satisfaction of knowing your contribution is creating a positive impact for years to come, not buying a band-aid.  You will be helping to solve a problem faced around the globe, starting in Santiago, Chile.  There are some pretty cool perks too.

A Recap: Why Chileans Need English.

(aka things that we native speakers often take for granted):

Economic

1. In Chile an estimated 75% of the working population has missed a job opportunity because they have a low level of English.

2. An intermediate level of English affords an average 30% increase in income.

Academic- 

1. Over 80% of the world’s academic journals are in English, and many of the most highly merited Universities teach their programs in English.  

2. Even within Chile, university students are expected to read the latest scientific studies and research.  Most of which are published in English. 

Communicative- 

1. Twelve international domains, including business, transportation and diplomacy, have designated English as their official language.

2. Over 1 billion people worldwide are currently learning English.  It is has truly become the preferred language for global communication making travel, studies and business much easier for anyone that speaks it.


Risks & Challenges

The success of our work is closely tied to the institutions that we work with and their posture towards change.  In addition, educational improvements become apparent over years rather than months.  The greatest risks therefore are related to funding the program for the amount of time needed to make significant impact.


Other Ways You Can Help

As a volunteer-run organization just getting started, any level of support can make a huge difference in our efforts to improve educational equality in Chile through English instruction. We are looking for funding as well as teaching resources, use of space, and gifts in kind from private donors as well as corporate sponsors.

Sharing this campaign is also a great help and is greatly appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

By contributing, you will be making a different and offering a priceless chance for 27 kids to have access to education for the coming year, while we are working on more sustainable ways to fund their expenses. Our plan of action is the following:

·  The priority is to cover the expenses mentioned above before the deadline

·  We will re-build and modernize our website, including the project, the children and feedback on the benefits of the campaign (so far this was a side initiative and it is not represented on the website)

·  We will try to develop a creative self-sustaining campaign and fund raise more professionally. We already have high-potential volunteers thanks to the UN

Needless to say, contributors will be added to an emailing list in order to be informed of our progress.

NO MONEY TO SPARE? YOU CAN STILL HELP

If you are not in a position to donate money at the moment, you can still make a difference and help us reach our goal. For instance, you could spread the word about our project. “Sharing is caring” also applies to social networks.

Also, we are still recruiting UN Online Volunteers. Take a look at the portal: https://www.onlinevolunteering.org/en/vol/opportunity/organization_view.html?id=7329.

ABOUT CHISTRE

Nelson Mandela once said, “Give a child love, laughter and peace, not AIDS”. CHISTRE, the Center for HIV/AIDS and STD Research is a non-profit organization, which is embracing this philosophy and offering valuable support to the local communities of Agwa, in the Imo state of Nigeria. The 350.000 inhabitants of Agwa have been struck by an ever-increasing HIV infection rate, which has been hard to fight. The strong religious beliefs and traditional lifestyle of the community in this rural part of Nigeria has made it a challenging battle to tackle the disease’s expansion.

ABOUT THE TEAM LEAD

Ambassador For Peace awarded Nduka Ozor created the organization in 2000, as a response to witnessing up to 35 of his hometown’s inhabitants die of HIV per month. The initial project was to create an extensive library opening a window into HIV/AIDS related information for rural communities in Agwa. Soon, we became UN accredited into the UN Online Volunteering program and the initiative became a success. The UN named online volunteer Yasemin Gunya one of the 2003 online volunteers of the year (https://www.onlinevolunteering.org/en/vol/stories/online_volunteers_of_2003.html#10) and we have been able to expand our action to develop multiple projects raising awareness on HIV/AIDS and STDs.

More information on our achievements to date can be found on the website: http://www.chistre.com

What your contribution means

By contributing, you will be making a different and offering a priceless chance for 27 kids to have access to education for the coming year, while we are working on more sustainable ways to fund their expenses. Our plan of action is the following:

·  The priority is to cover the expenses mentioned above before the deadline

·  We will re-build and modernize our website, including the project, the children and feedback on the benefits of the campaign (so far this was a side initiative and it is not represented on the website)

·  We will try to develop a creative self-sustaining campaign and fund raise more professionally. We already have high-potential volunteers thanks to the UN

Needless to say, contributors will be added to an emailing list in order to be informed of our progress.

The Challenge and Risks

It is a vicious cycle,if these children are not supported and they turn out to be nuisances,it will have a serious security effect on the community.We are therefore solving more than one problem of supporting the orphans,we are also raising the bar of living in peaceful community

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to donate money at the moment, you can still make a difference and help us reach our goal. For instance, you could spread the word about our project. “Sharing is caring” also applies to social networks.

Also, we are still recruiting UN Online Volunteers. Take a look at the portal: https://www.onlinevolunteering.org/en/vol/opportunity/organization_view.html?id=7329.

ABOUT CHISTRE
Nelson Mandela once said, “Give a child love, laughter and
peace, not AIDS”. CHISTRE, the Center for HIV/AIDS and STD Research is a
non-profit organization, which is embracing this philosophy and offering
valuable support to the local communities of Agwa, in the Imo state of Nigeria.
The 350.000 inhabitants of Agwa have been struck by an ever-increasing HIV
infection rate, which has been hard to fight. The strong religious beliefs and
traditional lifestyle of the community in this rural part of Nigeria has made
it a challenging battle to tackle the disease’s expansion.
ABOUT THE TEAM LEAD
Ambassador For Peace awarded Nduka Ozor created the
organization in 2000, as a response to witnessing up to 35 of his hometown’s
inhabitants die of HIV per month. The initial project was to create an
extensive library opening a window into HIV/AIDS related information for rural
communities in Agwa. Soon, we became UN accredited into the UN Online
Volunteering program and the initiative became a success. The UN named online
volunteer Yasemin Gunya one of the 2003 online volunteers of the year
(https://www.onlinevolunteering.org/en/vol/stories/online_volunteers_of_2003.html#10)
and we have been able to expand our action to develop multiple projects
raising awareness on HIV/AIDS and STDs.
More information on our achievements to date can be found on
the website: http://www.chistre.com

What your contribution means 
By contributing, you will be making a different and offering
a priceless chance for 27 kids to have access to education for the coming year,
while we are working on more sustainable ways to fund their expenses. Our plan
of action is the following:
· 
The priority is to cover the expenses mentioned
above before the deadline
· 
We will re-build and modernize our website,
including the project, the children and feedback on the benefits of the
campaign (so far this was a side initiative and it is not represented on the
website)
· 
We will try to develop a creative
self-sustaining campaign and fund raise more professionally. We already have
high-potential volunteers thanks to the UN
Needless to say, contributors will be added to an emailing
list in order to be informed of our progress.

 
   The Challenge and Risks It is a vicious cycle,if these children are not supported and they turn out to be nuisances,it will have a serious security effect on the community.We are therefore solving more than one problem of supporting the orphans,we are also raising the bar of living in peaceful community

    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you are not in a position to donate money at the moment,
you can still make a difference and help us reach our goal. For instance, you
could spread the word about our project. “Sharing is caring” also applies to
social networks.
Also, we are still recruiting UN Online Volunteers. Take a
look at the portal: https://www.onlinevolunteering.org/en/vol/opportunity/organization_view.html?id=7329.

story:
My Best Summary of the Last 5 Years of Hard Work

   

My name is Jason Lalli, I am a passionate agent for change who has been working in our communities as a poet, event organizer (Infuse - Open Mic & Phoenix Fesitival of the Arts), and motivational speaker since 2009. I strive to be the change I wish to see by building stronger communities for a better future. 

   I began the journey of positively stimulating a new conversation around bullying because I realized a major contrast in the world I grew up in and the one my son is growing up in. I looked back at a younger me knowing that if I had learned life-skills training like; how to communicate, self-/social-awareness, the difference between conflict and bullying, the power of my voice, positive coping skills, and so much more then it would have had a tremendous impact on my life.  I felt I truly had something that would make a major difference.  I have spoken hundreds of times to thousands of students and there is no greater reward than building their trust, empowering their abilities to use their voice by asking for help, and embracing every possibility to show them what support and community really feels like. 

   You as a contributor will be empowering youth with essential life tools to navigate not only bullying but conflict. Your financial contribution has the potential to literally help a child find a better future through empowerment, better decision making, self-awareness, and an understanding to the responsibility of choice. You will also be helping support and empower educators to feel more prepared in supporting our youth through the challenges of living in today's world as a teen. 

 

What I Have Done and Need:

    What I have done is create two very similar programs, both with a strong emphasis on socio-emotional learning, emotional intelligence, empowerment, life-skills training, and follow-through. A major keystone element is my book "Bullied: It begins with the 'i'". I have done a couple pilot-programs (with more scheduled) and the results of the pre-/post-assessments speak for themselves. Click this link to see them at http://www.bull-i-ed.com/data . I prefer to operate in complete transparency to validate the positivity of my results so they are available for anyone to see. 

  1. The first program schools receive a book, bookmarks, stickers, teen-lifeline card, and discussion-based worksheets for each student. This program provides fourteen separate teacher facilitated in-depth discussions amongst the students about bullying. 
  • Creating a comprehensive research-based teacher module through www.sanfordinspireprogram.org  will be most effective to prepare and help teachers facilitate these discussions safely.
  • Depending on how much money is raised I may be able to donate this aspect of the program in it's entirety as pilot-studies. 

   2.  The second, is more intensive as a 3.5 month program where an entire grade receives seven presentations. One introductory and six workshops. I return every other week to continue the conversation, meanwhile, the students are reading "Bullied: It begins with an 'i'" in my absence and implementing the the first program of book reading and discussion-based worksheet completion to keep the conversation present for the entire duration of the program.

  • Money is needed to train more passionate speakers to meet the demand of this program.  

 

Let's Break It Down:

  • Your $$ will fund the printing and shipping of books, bookmarks, stickers, discussion based worksheets, and other handouts for teachers and schools.  
  • Help in licensing and attorney fee's to create a non-profit to more effectively raise funds to provide this valuable program to more schools across the country. (This will cost me up to $10,000 to be on the safe side.)

By creating this non-profit I will also be helping fund suicide prevention education. Imagine if educators received best-practices and evidence based training on how to recognize the signs and connecting youth with proper resources who may be at-risk of suicide. I am trained in both "SafeTalk" and "A.S.I.S.T" training through livingworks. https://www.livingworks.net

  • I need to be able to be more efficient with larger schools and approximately $15,000-$30,000 is needed create a teacher module as a resource to help teachers facilitate discussions. This will be research-based accredited through Sanford Inspire Program (http://sanfordinspireprogram.org). I am creating the best, to provide the best!  As stated by Sanford Inspire Program, "We design resources to support teachers in working toward educational equity. That is, developing the knowledge, skills, and mindsets to support the academic and social success of each student." 
  • I need to be able to train others like me to be compassionate, relatable, and entertaining speakers. 
  • There are several other costs I am yet aware of that I am sure will not be cheap. For example: Logo Design work at a discounted price was $2,000. 

 

This $50,000 is a starting point to a movement. A movement in addressing a positive  more comprehensive conversation around bullying. No more one time presentations, our children DESERVE follow-through. I am asking for your help. I can't do it alone and I need to be more fiscally stable to keep empowering our youth. 

 

As I teach the kids: 

I am AWARE

I have a CHOICE

I am RESPONSIBLE

I am EMPOWERED

and SO ARE YOU! 

 

The Impact

I record data through pre- and post-assessments of students and teachers. I also share this data in complete transparency on my website. This can be viewed at http://www.bull-i-ed.com/data

  • Every child, parent, and educator a part of this program to any level is introduced to life-changing perspectives, lessons, and experiences. The results and testimonials provide this validation. Click here for Teacher Program Testimonies. Click here for Student Testimonies.
  • It has proven to stimulate a more positive and inclusive culture amongst the students. 
  • The more I am able to raise, the more efficient I can become, which means the more people we can provide this essential education to. 

I firmly believe everybody wants to be a better person and I want to help people achieve that goal. Our lives are hard enough and I want to help people learn how to be better decision-makers. Too many feel silenced and I want to help them find their voice. 

Will you help me do this?!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, BUT THAT DOENS'T MEAN YOU CAN'T HELP. Here are some ways you can help:

  • Post to your social media accounts and help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • There are easy to use Indiegogo share tools!
  • Send e-mails to those you know may have a similar passion or interest. 
  • Bring this campaign up in conversation.

story:
Engaging children through head, heart and hand.

How do we build the capacity for children to hold the complexities of the world? How do we build intercultural understanding? How do we teach children values, emotional and relational intelligence? How do we build their capacity to work collectively? 

For the third year, the Village Cultural School Academy is building on its capabilities to address the "How".  Through our culturally infused 6 week experiential bridge learning program, we engage children, ages 8 to 14, in the experience of developing a learning community.  We are seeking to raise $18,750 to fund our Village Cultural School Academy summer school program for 25 children.

CEI believes that quality, competent cultural education will enhance the self-confidence of children of color and the intercultural knowing of all children.  We also believe that accurate understanding of cultural heritage and how those dynamics influence our society will provide children with an enhanced level of appreciation for their own culture and an increased capacity to appreciate the cultural dynamics at play in our communities.  This learning offers promise for creating communities that have the ability to work collectively together to increase the overall level of humanity and social justice that is available as we move towards a more functional global community.

The funds raised will underwrite the school staff, food, supplies, support weekly field trips and the production of the end of summer Village Cross Over Celebration. 

  • Each $30 donation will sponsor a child for one day of experiential learning
  • $150 donation will sponsor a child for one week
  • $750 will pay for the entire summer experience for one child.
  • An $18,750 donation will sponsor a Village Cultural School Academy site for 25 Children.

The Impact

As members of the Village Cultural School, children learn how being authentic and bringing their gifts/talents to the village impact the quality of the village community. Villagers will work collaboratively towards mutually defined goals as they assume leadership roles in the village. The theme for this year's Cultural School is "The Power of Story".  Villagers will learn the about the power of voice, experiment with methods to bring their unique voice into the world, how to identify human values, and apply that learning to discern the values in story and music. As Villagers, children learn leadership as they:

  • Build a learning community; establish their community agreements and conflict mediation processes.  
  • Learn leadership as they assume roles and define their responsibilities.
  • Support weekly community food giveaway as they develop their own community service projects.
  • Learn science through the study of agriculture, their bodies as systems and begin to understand how food impacts their health and vitality.
  • Enhance their communication skills through journal writing and storytelling
  • Deepen their understanding human values through the study of music and story.

Staff and Volunteer Referrals / In Kind Donations

Also, we are seeking in-kind donations in the form of staff, volunteers, supplies, transportation and prepared meals."

  • Experienced middle school math teacher
  • Experienced middle school English teacher
  • Healthy food cook/chef

Your Donations at Work

Examples of ways your donations will be used in Village Cultural School Academy :

·  $10 donation will buy 10 journals for reflective writing.

·  $20 donation will buy ingredients for one cooking class.

·  $30 donation will sponsor one villager’s field trip.

·  $40 donation will sponsor art supplies for 25 children  

Share this with others who are passionate about education! Help us support communities in supporting children.

Find This Campaign On: Facebook Twitter Website

story:
F & B Service Training International (FBSTI) is a hospitality school specialized in high standard restaurant management training in the full respect of the Swiss education norms in this field.

www.fbsti.com

We provide a program unique in the world that allows participants to enter quickly, calmly and easily into the workforce and achieve a successful career.

We are thinking of all those young people who have been treated badly by life and cannot offer such training to then get a job in this growing industry.

we are thinking of all those young persons who have been left behind, or who lost everything due to elements such as caprice of mother nature like the recent earthquake in Nepal, due to political and economical crisis like the war in Ukraine, the different conflicts in Africa or the crisis situation in Greece.

But we are also thinking of all those young who got nothing but living just under our windows

EVERY YOUNG DESERVES THE CHANCE TO ACCESS PROFESSIONAL TRAINING AND GET THE SAME CHANCE TO WORK AND HAVE PLANS ABOUT THEIR FUTURES THAN ANY OTHER KIDS IN THIS WORLD.

Our program:

  • 1 month of intense English (if necessary)
  • 1 month of restaurant management course
  • 4 Globally accredited and recognized certificates
  • 4 to 12 months paid internship in the most prestigious restaurants in the world
  • Food and accommodation during the 2 months
  • visa and travel expenses provided.
  • Access to our contact list and assistance to find a permanent job.
  • full equipment provided (tablet, service equipments, uniform,....)
  • clothes and pocket money for them to not feel different or rejected by others


Positives Points:

- Giving them the possibility to quickly begin a professional career

- Small classes, individual attention, personal follow up of all of them to ensure good results for their examinations and a good start in their new life.

- Intensive and exciting classes in a pleasant and warm atmosphere. They will feel welcome and cared of

- Development of their professional ease, of their maturity and the confidence they will have in them.

- During the course, they will also receive information on jobs opportunities available around the world and the best way to access those jobs. FBSTI puts them in touch with professionals of the restaurant industry worldwide.

- We also give them tricks, various techniques and attitudes to adopt in order to rapidly access promotion in the restaurant industry and increase their daily income (tips).

We need your help to get those kids out of poverty and prepare them for a real future full of hope.

We need your help to get the kids who really deserved it to attend our course to make sure that street will not be their home anymore.

                                     


There is without any doubt an increasing unemployment and financial crisis situation all over the world for a large number of industries, but the new concept of leisure civilization makes the catering industry a unique growing business offering a large number of career opportunities for the future.

With a total value of more than 4 trillion Dollars, 1 out of 9 people will be recruited within the hospitality industry in the coming years, with more than 600 000 jobs opportunities globally. There has never been a better time to acquire the necessary skills to enter this dynamic and growing sector.

We have tailored and designed with our Swiss expertise and our French experience, the perfect training so that participants can confront this profession with great confidence and an optimistic vision of the future. The Swiss education in the hospitality industry and catering has shown over the years to be one of the finest and globally recognized in the field.

FBSTI has developed a unique concept to allow a large number of potential students to access and benefit from the Swiss education and reputation.

FBSTI is a highly qualified institute that provides a captivating training, very professional and accessible to everyone.

We firmly believe that everything rests on the principle that any theoretical knowledge must be complemented by practical experience. That is why we have, at FBSTI, bridged the gap between the theoretical needs of students and the practical reality of the hospitality and the restaurant industry. FBSTI program was adapted for the development of four fundamental themes:

• The knowledge: The development of theoretical competency in every field of the catering industry.

• The skill: The development of practical skills in all sectors of the service environment.

• Communication: build the capacity of each individual to communication effectively in order to aid the delivery of service quality, as well as to enhance public relations and customer care.

• Flexibility: to foresee and confront changes, to be open to a demanding and dynamic environment, to take ownership of issues arising as a result operating in a customer oriented role.

Because we have a large experience in the international market in this field, those young victims will enter the workforce with the knowledge and skills needed to develop a successful career.

At FBSTI we are thinking about all these young who want to quickly enter the working life but cannot offer the proper training for that. We also think about these young people who want to learn a job.

But we are too small to cover the cost of everything (traveling, course, exam and certificates, visa, equipment, food, accommodation, clothes, daily expenses, internship and job) this is the reason why we need your help.

we can send all the help we can to those kids that life has left behind or ignore. But will it be nice and bring a great feeling if we could give to some of them a life, a secure future !!!

Help us

to bring joy and serenity on the face of some kids in entering a new challenge which will lead them in a better future,

to bring tranquility on the face of their parents by getting their kids of the street, out of poverty, with a better tomorrow.

Thanks you so much already on behalf of all of them.

story:
Purpose
I am a native Nepali who is currently attending high school in Georgia. I am raising money to help the victims affected by the earthquake in Nepal. The first earthquake that struck Nepal was a magnitude of 7.9 on the Richter scale. So far there has been a recorded  8,000 deaths in the country, but many victims still have not been accounted for due to the lack of Nepal's bureaucracy to allocate there budget towards rescue and "clean-up" measures. Since the inefficiency and untrustworthiness of Nepal's government, my family and I are traveling to Nepal and personally giving the victims portions of the money and paying for the resources necessary to build and get them back on their feet. This is an efficient idea since we are bypassing Nepal's corrupt government and directly handing out the funds needed to hopefully bring back Nepal to the same or better state that it once was.
Goal
My goal is to earn as much as possible so that I, with you-all's help, am able to make a difference in the world we live in.
FAQ
How can I trust a high school student with my money?
I assure you that the money will be personally protected in a bank account and will only used to help out the victims of Nepal's earthquake. Yes, there are scammers in this world, but I assure that I will post pictures, in the link, below regarding the impact that we have made in Nepal using the money that has been donated.

story:
About Us: SCS Youth Ministry is a non-profit ministry under the care of St. Catherine of Siena Catholic Church in Reseda, CA. We meet on a weekly basis to evangelize, grow, and practice a whole new level of spirituality through adoration, talks, dynamic activities, and ministry work. If by any chance you happen to be interested in learning more about the Catholic Faith, please feel free to join us, we meet every Thursday and Friday evening from 7:15 to 9:00 pm at The Cave. We truly hope to see you there and we all look forward to meeting you!



Our Objective & Consequence: As Youth Minister, it's my utmost responsibility to provide our youth with methods in which they're able to not just learn about the living word of God, but to also live, experience, and practice it through communal work, special events, and even something as simple as social gatherings among family/friends. Therefore, SCS Youth Ministry is asking for your loving contribution to help bring about funds that'll provide the SCS youth with benefits that normally wouldn't be available without your help, such as: conferences, lectures, guest speakers, team clothing, a youth website, spiritual events/trips, and weekly beverages, food, and gifts. Please be very well aware that your contribution to our objective will allow every single SCS youth to personally connect, feel, and experience a sense of self-worth and unity among their peers and family. More importantly, however, you'll contribute to our youth's personal understanding of Jesus Christ and help develop their faith in Him as they'll not only witness firsthand what the gift of giving is capable of, but the additional resources from your contribution will provide them with a better opportunity to live Christ-Centered lives and become role models for our community. The living word of God is all about unity through loving help, it's about being there for each other, and SCS Youth Ministry truly needs your help and resources and we sincerely hope you're able to contribute in meeting our goal. If by any chance you’re not able to do so, please just spread the word about our cause, we’re trying to get as much exposure as possible so your word is of great benefit to us as well. May God bless you and we all here at SCS Youth Ministry thank you, in advance, for taking the time to read about what we’re trying to accomplish.

story:
Hello, my name is Darmetreis Kilgore. I grew up in a fatherless environment as a troubled youth. I was bullied as a child. One of the main reasons I was bullied was because I would have to wear some of my mother’s pants to school. She was unable to buy me my own pair of pants at the time. I went from being troubled to causing my opponents trouble on the basketball court. I played for Hall of Fame Coach, Gene Keady, at Purdue University; and later went on to participate in the Philadelphia 76er’s NBA free agent camp. 

“Finding Me” tells my story. This story will touch millions of people across the world. Our troubled youth need to know that others have experienced distinctively similar trials. My book, “Finding Me”, is a journey that takes place during the unsure times of adolescent years. I believe this book will transcend throughout the minds of troubled youth and help land them smoothly, right into adulthood. Throughout life we are searching for ourselves. “Finding Me” will elaborate on that searching and show how everything I have experienced in my life has finally come full circle.

With your contribution, my book “Finding Me” will give young men and women hope. It will encourage them to face adversity with the understanding that hardships help to shape who we are. It will also give them a clearer understanding that struggles can work in your favor if you let God do what He does best; His Will. 

I will need $1000 to publish, edit, and market my e-book. One of the unique perks that I have to offer is that if you register on our website, you will get the first 2 chapters of my book for free. If you are unable to give a donation, please at least get the word out. Help me make some noise about my campaign. A great resource to do so is the Indiegogo share tool. Thank you for your support and efforts! I am very excited to reveal my life changing story to the public.

story:
Who We Are and What We Do

Change and Be Changed is a small charity of African and North American passionate educators and community workers bridging Malawi, the “Warm Heart of Africa,” with North America, the “New World”. Change and Be Changed  is headed by Drs. Thomas and Elisabeth Hangartner, volunteers in Malawi since 2006, in collaboration with an international group of dedicated friends and well-wishers supporting education in Malawi. Change and Be Changed is a charity registered with the Ohio Secretary of State as a 501(c)(3) nonprofit corporation.

Northern Malawi is among the poorest regions of the Republic of Malawi in Central Africa  where many students are not able to attend school due to dire systemic poverty. 

Change and Be Changed wants to reach out to those who are stranded on the roadside of the secondary and university education system by funding scholarships for young Northern Malawians in existing high schools and colleges all over the country.

What We Need and How It Will Be Used

$2000 is our initial need to provide:

  • Full and partial sponsorships for indigent high school students

  • Full and partial scholarships for indigent college students

  • Scholarships for disabled students in residential high-school, college and vocational programs (includes textbooks, stationery, transportation and allowances for special equipment)

What We Expect from Our Students

  • To perform supervised community volunteer work, either through the government-sponsored Public Work program, church-based volunteer programs or verifiable individual volunteer outreach efforts

  • To commit to high academic and personal standards

  • To provide their school report cards and tuition receipts

Other Valuable Help

If you are not able to make a monetary contribution, please help spread the word by:
  • Promoting us on your Facebook page
  • Sharing our needs in an e-mail or a phone conversation
  • Talking to friends, relatives and acquaintences
  • Using the Indiegogo share tools

story:
Our Mission

Thank you for your interest in our Indiegogo campaign. We're Pinball EDU, a nonprofit focused on using pinball as a tool for education and therapy.  We believe pinball can be used to motivate, teach, and build critical developmental skills for children. Join us in support of our mission. 

Why Pinball?



Pinball is an excellent tool for skill development. It's based in play, the primary occupational role of a child and therefore intrinsically motivating. As a game, pinball engages the child in active play and creates a welcome distraction from the traditional demands of therapeutic exercise. It  provides significant opportunities to practice and improve gross and fine motor skills and coordinated movements, especially those involved in vision. And of course, it's an incredibly fun game that can be naturally incorporated into a social activity or a broader social skills program.

The Pinball Education Center

Your support and financial contribution will assist us with one of our main initiatives for 2015:  Opening our flagship location in the DC area. The Pinball Education Center will provide us with the space we need to begin many local and national projects as well as give us the opportunity to begin engaging the local community in data collection and research to validate the use of pinball for STEM education and therapeutic intervention.


STEM Hands-on Pinball Museum

The Pinball Education Center will support science, technology, engineering, and math education through its many educational programs. Our center will serve as a destination for field trips for DC, Maryland, and Virginia area schools, a hands-on family arcade and museum, and will pilot an after school program for local youth.


GiftsWe love pinball, especially its fascinating history and inspiring artwork. We wanted to share our passion for all things pinball with our sponsors as we truly value your involvement and support of our mission.  Each donation is greatly appreciated and we hope our gifts will serve as a small thank you from Pinball EDU as well as a proud reminder of your contribution. 

Silverball Photographs (12" x 12")

These custom-made prints are created using stereographic projections of 360 degree panoramas resulting in a silverball-esque image. Both  12" X 12" "Silverball" prints were created by Will S. and are mounted on foam board and ready to hang in your home or arcade.


Pinball EDU's 2015 Commemorative Roger Sharpe Watercolor T-shirt

Pinball EDU's 2015 Commemorative Roger Sharpe Watercolor T-Shirt. The front of this t-shirt displays a high quality digital print of "Pinball 1976", a watercolor painting by G. Byron. The Pinball EDU logo is on the back.

This shirt is available in the following sizes: S, M, L, XL, XXL, 3XL;  Women's XS, S, M, L, XL; Juniors S, M.


"i <3 pinball" Pinball EDU T-Shirt

This is a V-neck t-shirt  designed with "i <3 pinball" on the front and the Pinball EDU logo on the back. This shirt is available in the following sizes: S, M, L, XL, XXL, 3XL, & Women's XS, S, M, L, XL & Juniors S, M.



Desktop and Mobile Wallpaper

Photographic Silverball Art created by Will Saxton to use as desktop and mobile device wallpaper.


Meet The Artists

We've commissioned two professional artists to make unique pinball-related artwork. Here's a little bit about them.

Goodloe Byron

Goodloe Byron is an author, artist and musician from Frederick, Maryland. Byron's artistic career developed from drawing book covers for his own novels. From 2006-2010 he traveled throughout the United States handing out 40,000 copies of his first two books. He then went on to work for independent presses. Byron's first illustration for the New York based press, Soft Skull, was featured in the New York Times in 2010. Byron is well-known for his whimsical caricature-like sketch drawings of Frederick locals and bands as well as his self-portraits and countless paintings of his dog, Pugloe.

In a 2012 interview with the Frederick News-Post, Goodloe shared, "It's a challenge and reward to draw people and see them enjoy it. It's people that make life interesting." Find out more about the artist and see his work at http://goodloebyron.tumblr.com.



Will Saxton

 

Will Saxton is an artist, musician, music producer, and talented photographer from Maryland. Saxton founded the band Plaeground and currently performs with both Plaeground and Litz. His photographic art is created using stereographic projections of 360 degree panoramas resulting in a silverball-esque image.

Our Team

Joe P. Said - Founder

Joe P. Said is the Founder of Pinball EDU, an organization he’s been developing since early 2012. Joe is currently responsible for the vision, strategy and national fundraising efforts for Pinball EDU, as it expands across the country.

“I love pinball. I believe it has untapped potential and value as an educational and therapeutic tool. I want to share it with everyone.”

Joe brings over 15 years of experience making education accessible to people with disabilities. Joe was the founder of the assistive technology firm, gh llc., that was responsible for making the SAT and GRE accessible to people with disabilities. Joe’s academic background includes studies in electrical engineering and business management at Purdue University. Joe’s love of pinball married with his interests in education and pinball motivated him to create Pinball EDU.

Advisory Board

Cristin Gasson, OTR/L

Cristin introduced her son to pinball in 2012 by joining a local pinball league.

“I knew Ethan would love playing but I didn’t realize how much he would grow as an individual through playing. Pinball has provided him with an opportunity to develop social skills and friendships with other people who also love to play. This shared interest in pinball has motivated him to learn about the rules of pinball, improved his focus and communication skills.”

Cristin is a licensed certified pediatric Occupational Therapist who has worked with families and their children for over 15 years both privately through her own practice and publicly through State and County Early Intervention programs. She is also the parent of a young adult with Down Syndrome and has over 20 years experience as a skilled special needs education and inclusion advocate. Her experience and expertise includes working with children and adults with disabilities in schools, hospitals, outpatient centers, and home-based settings.

Kathy Gagno

Kathy remembers playing pinball back in the day when it was at the height of popularity. Her father lived in Southern California. While all her friends were sun-tanning on the beach in Santa Monica, she was in the arcade on the Pier, pale but happy. She was thrilled when her middle child, Robert, began to show an interest in pinball at an early age. At the time, he had a hard time staying still and concentrating, and pinball seemed to be one of the few activities he could do for a long period of time.

Robert was diagnosed with Autistic Disorder at about the age of 5, and Kathy began to notice that not only he liked pinball, but he seemed to be very good at it. Robert stopped playing for a few years, but took it up again in his late teens, and she credits a huge leap in his communication and social skills to pinball. Through pinball, her family, and especially Robert, have met so many nice people and have had many unique opportunities as a result of pinball-related travelling to tournaments and shows. Her professional background includes special education, and she currently practices as a certified school psychologist.

Steven Zahler

Steven, co-founder of Modern Pinball NYC, brings to Pinball EDU his deep passion for teaching the arts and sciences that are harnessed inside every pinball machine, and the desire to enrich the lives of students young and old, and those disabled and/or economically disadvantaged.

“Both Joe Said and I share a deep appreciation for pinball and the educational benefit it provides. To harness a gaming platform for use as an educational tool that can provide meaning as well as a fun conduit to learning the arts and sciences for this and future generations is something that brings meaning to and enriches our lives. I remember conversations from years back in which Joe and I spoke of reaching Autistic kids through pinball. Our philosophies are congruent in every respect and I am grateful to be a part of the very educationally generous and socially responsible vision of Pinball EDU.”

Modern Pinball NYC is registered with the NYC Department of Education (VEN# MOD823743) and hosts class trips to engage students about physics, art and sound as they relate to pinball machines.

Roger Sharpe 

Roger Sharpe is a pinball designer and author. He is the father of Zachary and Joshua Sharpe.

Roger was instrumental in the legalization of pinball in New York City in 1976 and has done licensing work for many of the major pinball companies.

Roger Sharpe  was considered one of the best pinball players in the world during the  1980s. His sons, Zach Sharpe and Josh Sharpe are currently #4 and #15 in the world, respectively.

story:
Short Summary

Hello there, for all those who don't know me, I'm Brittney DeLano. I am a junior at Johnson & Wales University in the Culinary Nutrition program. Part of my curriculium is to do an internship or a study abroad program that will help benefit my career goals in the future.  I was recently accepted to study abroad with my school in Singapore & Thailand. My biggest problem getting there is the flights. They are quite expensive and I can't afford them on my own. That is where you guys come in. 

Please help me fund my plane tickets to and from Singapore & Thailand!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal for this campaign is $2,000, with that I would like to purchase my tickets to  Singapore, Chiang Mai and then back to Providence, RI.  

If my goal is not reached, I will still use the funds I receive to pay for as much of my flights as possible. 

If my goal is exceeded, I will still pay for the plane tickets and anything left over will be used to further my education (i.e pay for textbooks).

As for perks:

What you get when you contribute: 

For a $10 contribution, you will recieve "Thank You Perk". This perk will consist of a hand written thank you letter from me to you. 

For a $20 contribution, you will receive the "Going Places Perk" . This perk will consist of two post cards from both Singapore & Thailand. They will be sent to you from those countries. 

For a $50 contribution, you will receive the "Fly Away Perk". This perk consists of a handpicked souvenir from both Singapore & Thailand.

For a $100 contribution, you will receive that "Culture Indulgence Perk". This perk will consist of all the perks. Meaning you will get a hand written thank you letter, two post cards, & two handpicked souvenirs.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with whomever you can. Every dollar will help me reach my goal!

story:
Short Summary:

My name is Arnold Bhebhe and I am a Lecturer in Creative Industries at Edinburgh Napier University, United Kingdom. I was born and bred at Inyathi, a mission station 45 miles north of the city of Bulawayo, Zimbabwe. My parents were school teachers there and were passionate about the educational development of the local community. We were a family of nine children and times were generally hard for black people in the then Rhodesia, yet my parents somehow had the strength and ability to 'adopt' some local young people who, just like us, they sent to school. Today,  those boys and girls are people of stature within the community as responsible and useful citizens of the world.

In the heart of the then Matabele Kingdom, the Inyathi Mission was founded in 1859 by a Scottish Missionary Robert Moffat, the father in-law of the celebrated Dr David Livingstone.  Inyathi became the first evangelical mission station in Zimbabwe to offer education to the native people of the country.  This Mission Station has barely transformed as an educational institution compared to other institutions that were founded later in other parts of Zimbabwe, a number of which offer tertiary education up to university level.   Because Inyathi only offers primary and secondary education the vast communities of Matabeleland North still remain underdeveloped.

The 1980s post independence dissident activity in Matabeleland meant that the government of Zimbabwe disinvested from the region and unleashed a crack army unit which massacred over 20 000 civilians, including my own brother and sister.  Most of the victims were bread winners,  professionals and experts in various fields including education, health, agriculture and trade. A lot more were displaced with some  seeking sanctuary in neighbouring countries where  many remain.

With the loss of these breadwinners, surviving children could not meaningfully pursue their education as they had to seek employment to fend for their siblings. The mass murders and exodus of teachers also meant that the schools lacked adequate professionals. For this reason, the government has over the years imported teaching staff many of whom neither speak the local language nor identify with the culture of the communities in the region. In many cases, these  teachers are deployed to teach at the crucial levels of Primary School where the mother tongue plays a central role in helping pupils grasp learning concepts. As a result, academic attainment has been generally low with a noticeable lack of enthusiasm and incentive in learning among youngsters. An alternative for them is to skip the border to seek employment abroad as they cannot make it at home.

WHY THE UNIVERSITY:         

This campaign is about establishing an independent University at Inyathi Mission in the region of Matabeleland North, Zimbabwe. Establishing this University in this underdeveloped region will:

1) Provide a university education for the young adults

2) Catalyse investment and development in the region.

3) Provide the region with the professionalism and expertise it so badly needs to develop.

4) Provide our children in the region with the incentive to learn, not only to better themselves but also invest the  knowledge they acquire in the upliftment of the region and beyond. 

5) Usher in a spirit of self empowerment and determination to achieve and attain their aspirations.

WHAT THE UNIVERSITY WILL OFFER:

1) Teaching Degrees (Primary and Secondary School).  It is intended that the University of Inyathi (UI) be the first to offer such degrees in Zimbabwe. These are necessary in ensuring that graduates meet the required international teaching standards. Currently Zimbabwe offers Diplomas in this field.

2) Nursing Degrees: It is also intended that this University be the first in Zimbabwe to offer such degrees in trend with international standards. Currently, Zimbabwe offers Diplomas in this field.

3) Computing

4) Agriculture

5) Tourism

6)  Linguistics

7) Journalism and Creative Industries

8) Engineering

WHAT HAS BEEN ACHIEVED:

1) The Inyathi Mission authorities have provided  200 hectares of land on which to develop this project.

2) The University Charter and Project Plan have been drawn up.

3) Commitees have been set up to address different aspects of the project: These include: Steering Committee, Education Committee, Legal Committee, Construction/Development  Committee, Finance Committee

WHAT HELP CAN YOU PROVIDE:

To kickstart the project, we appeal for any monetory donations, no matter how small, to contribute towards the target of USD 110 000. This money will address the following urgent needs:

1) Registration of the project: USD 30 000

2) Fencing off the allocated plot: USD 60 000

3) Sending Surveyors to study topography of the plot: USD 20 000

With the land established we can then start to build the campus buildings and train the lecturers and administrators and we will be looking for volunteers to help soon with this next phase.  We will then also be collecting books, desks and computers.

HOW YOUR DONATIONS WILL BE ACKNOWLEDGED:

1) For donations up to USD 60 a personalised thank you email shall be sent to you and we will keep you updated about the progress of Inyathi University.

2) For donations between USD 61 - USD 1000 a thank you e-mail and your name entered in a register to be perpetually maintained and kept  by the institution. This register will be open for inspection to all donors.  We will also offer a student excellence award in the name of your choice.

3) For  donations between USD 1001 and  USD 10000, a thank you email, your name entered in the register and the name of your choice carved on a foundation stone we intend to erect at the university site.  A student excellence award can also be offered, if desired.

4) For any donations over USD 10000 you will receive an acknowledgement email, your name entered into the register and name carved on the stone, and buildings, pathways or roads within the university will be named after you.

Friends, please help us achieve this most needed dream. Remember, as Mandela once put it: "Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world".

Please give the people of Matabeleland North, Zimbabwe, the chance to change their world and save the next generation.

I humbly thank-you for your support,

Arnold Bhebhe.

Thank you to Dean Walsh for the filming and video editing for this campaign.  Dean is available on deanwrites@hotmail.co.uk or @FelixFullhouse.  Dean's YouTube channel is FelixFullhouse.






Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
♫♬ The wheels on the bus go round and round... ♫♬

Hi I'm Susan and I was brainwashed from an early age by my parents to believe that everyone has the power to make a positive difference in the world. 
And I believed them. 
I'm  the founder of the Dream Big Montessori School in Tanzania, East Africa. I am also the proud and grateful mum of four magnificent children, thanks in large part to the influence of my kind, loving and spectacularly patient husband. 


Growing up in a small town on Northern Vancouver Island BC, I certainly never imagined that I would go to Africa, let alone build a school there, but in 2009, friends introduced me to this lake region of East Africa and I saw in person up close the harsh challenges many local Tanzanian children face, and I could not get some of these memories out of my mind...far too many children falling hard between the cracks...
- dusty children darting between congested cars, frantically turning gasoline caps, being yelled at and shooed away, hoping to suck a mouthful of gasoline through a tube to run away with, spit out and sell for a few coins to buy food 
- exhausted children, in the dark, in concrete doorways, trying to sleep on old pieces of dirty cardboard, piled together like puppies, dreaming to be comforted and protected
- exploited children,  far too young, hearing their personal stories of unthinkable abuse and abandonment, on their own, babies looking after babies, all around them adult intolerance, hostility and indifference
- wasted children, wandering in the streets, nothing to do, nowhere to go, no school to attend and no dreams or prospects for their future
Returning home, I found it impossible to put these memories out of my mind despite the passage of time. For them complacency is an invisible and lethal enemy, and we can and should do far better by them. I felt compelled to act - not out of guilt or pity, but out of care and compassion for these children, and that I could find some way to make that positive difference. 
Something had to be done...something tangible and empowering...something that could significantly raise the trajectory of these children's lives. The best answer had to be with access to quality education. In the words of Nelson Mandela, "education is the most powerful weapon we have to create positive change in the world".  
So we built them a school...and the children came.
What started as a big hairy terrifying goal, with the dedication and hard work and remarkable generosity of many many amazing supporters and volunteers from different parts of the world, has become a remarkable magical place of learning in the idyllic, picturesque jungle 16km from Mwanza city on the shores of Lake Victoria - just a short drive to the gates of the Serengeti National Safari Reserve.
I chose the school name 'Dream Big' to inspire students and adults alike, and the words "If you can dream it, you can do it!" are clear and prominent in large letters at the main entrance to the classrooms. We are a Montessori methodology school, introducing here the new idea of the rights of the child, the child as a natural learner, and promoting the concept of self-reliance and independence - "Help Me to Help Myself".


This is a remarkable grassroots initiative fuelled on goodwill, love and kindness - so in the spirit of our wonderful little school that has survived and thrived against all the odds - we reach out to the world to help now.
This is where you come in!
The goal of this campaign is to get an urgently needed used school bus and the Dream Big Montessori students need your support so get on the bus! 
Having a school bus will make a tremendous difference for these young students and their families, especially those who have to walk long distances just to get to school. Furthermore, having a bus will make school a possibility for more children as a lack of transportation is a deal breaker for some families. And without school, these children invariably end up trapped in a dead end life of manual labour and illiteracy, working as housegirls or field workers, selling trinkets on the roadsides or worse. Access to education is the key to break this cycle and a school bus will get them there. Donate now to get these kids on the road to education and opportunities! 

(And our bus will be exceptionally cool, the only one of its kind in the world, with a fabulous large scale decal collage of smiling faces all over it! Check out our uber cool perks for deets! You don't need to be a realtor to get your face on our bus. Even YOU can get your gorgeous mug (or your kid's or pet's) can be collaged with our student's faces to be part of our actual  bus decoration collage!!! - See Perks section for this and more fun and totally unique perks).

Donate now to help these kids back and forth to school, and get launched on this far better trajectory of life so they can dare to DREAM BIG!

What We Need & What You Get

We need a school bus!

We're so proud and thrilled to be beginning our third year of operation (Tanzanian school year runs from January - December)! Starting with our inaugural class of preschoolers in 2012/13 and adding a new class each year, we now have 3 classes of students from 3.5 to 7 years of age. As the students are promoted to the next grade, our intake is maxed out at 30 new wee ones annually, out of their minds excited to be able to go to school. 

When we first started out with one class of 30 students, we were able to make do with one small school bus on temporary loan to us (see pic below), but it is unfortunately no longer available. A victim of our own success, our Montessori school is so popular that we are faced with a transportation crisis for our now tripled school population. Some of these young children are left with no option but to walk up to 2 hours each direction every day to attend school and the rest struggle with badly, overcrowded hired cars - an expensive and unaffordable makeshift transportation solution. 

Our amazing Superhero nun and on-the-ground school managing director, Sister Denise Mattle (Franciscan nun hailing from Switzerland), works tirelessly to keep our school running smoothly but pleads for the urgent need for a bus to take these children back and forth to school. 

Sister Denise with her local contacts has sourced a good quality second hand bus - capacity: 35 students - for the bargain nun price of  $30, 000 CAD. 

Funds Needed - Breakdown: 

Used bus: $26, 500 CAD 

Insurance, Gas & Driver: $3, 500 CAD/year

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will continue to raise funds until we get a bus for these kids. Also please don't be shy to continue donating if we surpass our goal, as our excess funds will go toward paying for the insurance, maintenance, gas and driver for future years. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word of the School Bus Campaign! 

Share our campaign with your friends, family, on your website, your facebook page or even by old-fashioned word of mouth (still the best!). Remember, no amount is too small (donation levels start at $2)!

Every contribution you make will help bring these children one step closer to have decent transportation to and from school, making their education a reality!

We always welcome valuable input! If you have ideas about how to make our fabulous little school even better, please feel free to contact us at dreambigmontessori@gmail.com and don't forget to Follow and Like us on Facebook and Instagram! 

Putting a face

Take a peek at 5 beautiful reasons to donate - these students at the Dream Big Montessori School want to Get on The Bus...donate now and be part of an investment in a better tomorrow.

Thank you.
