story:
**En Español también, aqui*


We do not become healers.  We came as healers.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.


We do not become storytellers.  We came as carriers of the stories we and our ancestors actually lived.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.


We do not become artists.  We came as artists.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.


We do not become writers, dancers, musicians, helpers, peacemakers.  We came as such.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.


We do not learn to love in this sense.  We came as Love.  We are Love.  Some of us are still catching up to who we truly are.


- Dr. Clarissa Pinkola Estes "Simple Prayer for Remembering the Motherlode"


The School of James is a curriculum offering opportunities to catch up to who we truly are...and then create a world that reflects our true selves.  It is a space for healing and growth, where anyone can learn to use the tools and develop the skills to emerge from the pain of past traumas and learned limitations.  It is both a refuge and a training ground, a safe place for nurturing the Self, integrating your Shadow, and accessing your innate courage to Choose Life.  It is called the School of James because it is located on the Camino de Santiago, the Way of Saint James, and because it is a legacy of the life of my brother James.   


My story:


People call me Robyn.  In 2010, I witnessed my brother James, the person I loved more than any other, experience what psychologists call a "psychotic break" and mutilate himself with a knife.  Trauma shocked me out of the paralysis I was in - and on a quest to find my true path.


Healing became my passion, my focus.  Having little success with mainstream medicine, I turned to holistic alternatives.  Over the next five years, I studied many different modalities, working with acupuncture, massage, emotional freedom technique, shamanic practices, Reiki, yoga, and many more.  Eventually, I became a Reiki Master Teacher and began to teach others how to channel energy for healing.  I learned and taught healing techniques in the United States, Costa Rica, Morocco, Italy, and India before I came to the Camino.  It was here, while walking the Way, that I found the courage to being to realize my dream: sharing what I've learned with as many people as possible by building a school.


The School: 


It will start as a virtual school offering remembrance tools to pilgrims on the Camino.  Of course, the Camino is a metaphor for life - the offerings will benefit anyone walking any path.  That said, the initial offerings are designed with the pilgrimage in mind: to support the healing journey, to help integrate the lessons learned while walking, and to provide guidance for manifesting dreams and projects in the next phase of the journey.  As we grow, the curriculum will deepen and provide opportunities for in-person classes, workshops, residential retreats and other types of learning exchanges.  Ultimately, the School will offer a full curriculum of opportunities to develop the skills necessary to raise ourselves and our conscious children to live joyful lives of passion and purpose.


Now, I admit - I don't know what all this entails.  This is a huge undertaking...and a community effort.   I know what I can offer, based on what I've learned in my own healing journey and based on what makes my heart sing with joy.  But these things are only one contribution to the curriculum - and one individual's perspective does not a whole new world create.  This School, this life is a community effort; those whose hearts are stirred by these words, who feel called to contribute, will help co-create this project in every way.


So, if you're feeling it, read on...


What We Need & What You Get


In order to break things into smaller steps, accomplish things poco a poco, I've broken down the first part of the project into three initial phases and developed a generous budget for each phase.  The budget assumes that we'll pay for everything with monetary energy, rather than co-creating with the energies of trade and service.  Ideally, since life and the school are community efforts, people will give all types of creative energy, especially their ideas,their time, their art, their craft, their services...but it's also important to honor the reality of the monetary energy exchange.  We cannot give unless we also receive and vice versa; the cycle must be complete, the energy continually flowing, inputs fueling outputs feeding new inputs.  With this in mind, each of these initial phases is intended to feed and support the growth and development of the next phase.  The energy attracted by this campaign will develop the first two phases, forming a foundation upon which to build; the inflow of energy generated by these phases will feed the third phase and the on-going success and development of the School.


Acknowledging the progression of growth, whatever support is attracted by this campaign will water each phase in turn - the seeds of Phase One will be planted first and watered to grow Phases Two and Three (and Four, Five, Six...on and on and on...).


Phase One:  Creating Web Presence and Offering Healing and Support Materials

Timeline - now through June 2016


The website will serve as an access point for the initial offerings, the Support Kit and the Integration Kit, as well as a shared space for community connections and learning exchanges.  Initially, it will offered in two languages: English and Spanish.  This phase also includes the creation of the Camino Kits themselves, including the videos and written materials. 


The Kits are intended to facilitate the experience of walking the Way and the integration of the lessons learned after reaching Santiago; however, they are not Camino-specific and will be useful for anyone walking whatever path.  They are intended to offer skills and support for the life, the remembrance of the Self as a powerful source and force of love and joy.  


The Support Kit consists of a series of videos with meditations, yoga postures, and teachings about meeting one's needs, nurturing, boundaries, etc; it is accompanied by daily journal questions, daily nurturance exercises, and the "Co-Create!" coloring book of healing drawings designed to provide energetic support and facilitate creative expression.  The Integration Kit consists of materials presenting the skills of grounding, connection, expansion and manifestation.  


These Kits are based on my previous experiences on the Camino and the teaching I've done in other places; they will include the meditations, yoga asanas, and other healing techniques that I found integral to my healing process and those that others have expressed were of most value to them.  Perks of contributing to this campaign include receiving these Kits and the "Co-Create!" coloring book, along with the joy of being part of the movement :)


The website will also serve as a community space for pilgrims to connect with each other, via profiles and discussion boards, and share their stories, successes, lessons and challenges as they continue their Way after Santiago.  The vision for this space includes an ever-expanding discussion of project creation and development and sharing what does and doesn't work (learning exchanges) with the community, as well as skill connections and trade opportunities, so that all might benefit from the experiences of integration and implementation.  Eventually, this space could consist of multi-media offerings, encompassing the wide range of creative expression we offer as we grow.


Projected budget for Phase One: $4000 **Each of these costs can be mitigated by the donation of goods and services; such is preferred - the more hearts involved, the better!  This is a community project.**

Website construction and maintenance costs - $800

Hardware: laptop, camera, microphone - $2000

Software: delivery system, accounting system - $200 

Creative collaboration: photo/videography - $500

Translation costs: $500


Phase Two:  Sharing the Offering and Continuing Education

Timeline - April 2016 through October 2016


This phase includes sharing the School's initial offerings, in person and online, and expanding the offerings through training and learning exchanges.  It's important to share these skills with as many people as possible, with the intention that those who learn the skills will apply them in their lives and model them to others, creating constantly expanding ripples of change.  Planned visibility points include Facebook, Google, online Camino forums and in person connections.  My current intention is to walk (and possibly ride a colorful bike) on the Camino again, teaching the offerings in person along the Way (in the albergues, the bars, wherever it happens) and sharing the website with words and tangible reminders, such as drawings, stickers and "graffiti."  Using the principles of street art activism, we'll share the message in ways that do not deface any vista by using non-toxic, temporary and sustainable papers, inks and glues.


A major part of this phase is accumulating responses to the Kits and responding to and integrating the needs and suggestions offered.  And, as I continue teach the skills along the way, I'll record the feedback provided by pilgrims and use it to expand and refine the offerings of the Kits.  There will be a feedback component of the Kits, a request for input on the website, plus the information coming from my continuing correspondence with people whom I have met while walking and living on the Camino.


Another aspect of this phase is deepening my own skill set for offering and teaching healing tools by attending and completing a formal yoga teacher training.  Thus far, my practice and teaching of yoga and meditation have grown out of my own intensive personal study.  With a formal training, I will have the guidance to take this study even deeper, so as to be able to develop a greater intimacy with the techniques and a more comprehensive understanding of how and why they work.  I'll be able to design and offer more effective and expansive healing opportunities, which will help grow my offering to the School in Phase Three.  Additionally, obtaining an official certificate will enable me to obtain insurance and facilitate the practical aspects of offering courses, workshops and residential retreats.  My heart sings with the practice and teaching of kundalini yoga, in the lineage of Yogi Bhajan; more about kundalini yoga and the teacher training I have chosen can be discovered at these websites: www.3HO.org, www.cherdikala.eu .


Part of this training and developing new offerings includes holding practice courses and retreats,  in order to gain further experience and feedback.  These practicums will be open to those who participate in the campaign (another perk!) and anyone who wishes to give their heart energy to expand the School and what we can offer.  This is the phase in which new teachers and healing modalities are expressly sought, with the intention to build the School community and seed growth from common intention and diverse experience.  Experiments in material presented, ways of collaborating and new wholeness techniques are sought and encouraged.  We can create something amazing! 


Projected budget for Phase Two: $4500

Sharing: online advertising, tangible items (cards, stickers, etc), distribution along the Camino - $500

Kundalini yoga teacher training: $3000

Costs for practice workshops and retreats: $1000


Phase Three: Expansion and Offering of the School's Curriculum

Timeline - November 2016 through November 2017


This is the phase of applying the learning and connections from Phase Two so as to develop an expanded curriculum.  This is the phase of collaboration with new partners, of dreaming, of growth, and of creating tangible ways to offer skills for expansion.  My vision for my offering includes creating offering courses, workshops and trainings such as Energy Healing: Foundations and Techniques (an extension of what I already teach when people approach me for Reiki training), Dream Manifestation: Conscious Creation, Sexuality & Creativity: Empowerment, Tools for Allowing Grief, and Tools for Healing Sexual Wounding.  The intention is for others to develop and offer curricula on nutrition, holistic and traditional healing, plant medicine, permaculture and sustainable living techniques, energetic architecture, art therapy, dance, music, human design, tantra, storytelling, writing...the dream is BIG.  If you feel the call, COME!


This is also the phase of creating a formal foundational structure that can serve as an interface for official communication and licensing, ie addressing the "real world" concerns of taxes, insurance, visas and the like.  Currently, it is my idea to create an entity based on the model provided by the Alternate Roots organization in the United States, in which all members of the organization take responsibility.  Although I am familiar with their organization and admire the ways in which they operate, I lack experience in setting up an organization with legal standing and would very much appreciate advice and help in this regard.  If you have any expertise or advice, please help us.


As of this writing, and until the formal structure of the School is created, it is likely that I will bear individual responsibility for the taxes and any legal costs incurred from this campaign and during the first two phases.  With this reality in mind, I've included these projected costs (and anything unforeseen, as the unexpected is expected) in the budget.


Projected budget for Phase Three: $1500

Taxes, fees, organization costs, unexpected expenses - $1500


Projected budget for Phases One through Three: $10,000 **Each of these costs can be mitigated by the donation of goods and services - the more hearts involved, the better!  This is a community project.**

Timeline - now through November 2017


The Impact


People come from all over the world to walk the Camino de Santiago - over 200,000 people in 2014 (source: wikipedia).  It is a sacred road, 800 kilometers of asking questions and receiving answers.  Everyone comes with different questions, different quests, different needs...but, step by step, everyone discovers, uncovers something.  For many, including me, the message of the Camino is remember the joy of existence, the passion of daily living, and the love that surrounds you!  And we do - we put down our pain, our suffering, our stories, and we listen to the wisdom inside, the little voice telling us how to Serve the Whole, how to Live our Soul's Purpose.  And then we take what we've learned back to where we live, in resolution to share what we've learned with our friends, our families, our communities...the healing and inspiration we find on the Camino ripples outward, affecting everything and everyone we touch.  We become better versions of ourselves and we change the world by our expansion, through the collective consciousness and through our direct actions.  Thus, all benefit, and we begin to create something new.


This is a major access point for seekers, people searching for answers about how to live better lives, how to create better communities.  It's a road that attracts people looking for Love, to Give and Receive, to Choose Life.  So why not offer tools to the people who are taking action to change?  Why not share what we know about healing so that they can learn new skills and share them?  Why not?


A major theme of this road, of this life and of the School is learning how to nurture ourselves: how to raise ourselves and, in turn, give our children examples of lives lived through conscious creation.  But we cannot give our children what we do not have.  We cannot teach our children what we do not know.  And we cannot nurture those who are coming if we cannot nurture those who are already here.


Imagine if each one of us knew how to nurture ourselves and each other, creating communities of individuals dedicated to lovingly developing each other's infinite potential. Imagine that the goal of every thought, word and action was to nurture the inherent love and goodness within...and see it reflected without.  Imagine that every single relationship you have - with yourself, with other beings, with the Earth herself - was founded in this ideal of loving nurturing.  Imagine if we were all loving, dedicated parents to each other.  What would this world become?  How would it feel?  


Just imagine...8 billion people nurturing each other...


CHOOSE LIFE, DREAM BIG, and CALL A FRIEND - WE'RE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER!


Risks & Challenges


The ultimate and most basic risk is that we will build the School and no one will be interested in the opportunities that we have to offer.  Nothing could come of this project and we could fail completely in our objectives.  We risk this every time we make a decision, every single time we decide to do anything.  It's a reality of this dimensional experience.  So.  There's that.


We will face challenges, for certain, and some of them will knock us down, while others will provide the rocky terrain that guides our feet higher up the mountain.  But we will not fail because we understand the power of the law of attraction and know how to allow connection, communication and communion.  We will not fail to expand the Love flowing through us.


In this moment, these are the foreseen challenges and risks:


Although I often refer to "we" in expectation of the team that will develop around this project, and in inclusion of everyone sending energy to this campaign, at this stage, I am working mostly alone.  (Albeit with an excellent support system.)  Allowing a team to coalesce organically, as the project develops, creates several challenges: patience; attracting the group of bright souls who desire to co-create something wonderful; practicing and teaching how to work in a heterarchy rather than a hierarchy; and working collaboratively with our strengths and weaknesses when we find each other.


I don't know who will come to co-create the School; I do know that I will do the work to get it started, with whatever help appears, to build the foundations of Phases One and Two.  To launch these phases requires a lot of work, and it is the first time I've co-ordinated a project on this scale...but I plan to take it step by step, working with the principles of SMART project management, accountability deadlines, my community of support, and prioritizing self-care so that I can keep giving my best.  These things I know how to do, and I know how to ask for help when I need it.  Ask and ye shall receive.  Fortunately, I've worked with many people on their projects, ranging from expanding a large donativo wellness center to assisting the creation of a traveling artisan workshop to starting a vegetarian restaurant, and have learned much from their successes and challenges.  And I have mentors who can guide me.


Other challenges include the technological aspects of Phase One and the fact that I do not yet speak fluent Spanish.  I have not yet learned how to run or update a website and, while I have made many meditation videos and taught many classes, I lack experience in creating professional quality audio-visual offerings.  But I am seeking help in creating these videos and whomever designs and builds the website will also teach me how to keep it current.  And I have at least one translator ready and excited to be a part of this project, as I continue to develop my language skills.


Knowing my skills and strengths gives me confidence that I can spark the development of the School and, with help, face all risks and create solutions for all challenges along the way.  I am courageous, devoted, dedicated, creative, attentive to detail, and...persistent.  I've demonstrated and strengthened these qualities throughout the past decade: graduating summa cum laude from college and earning a law degree; walking away from this conventional path and the expectations of others to find my own way; keeping a cool head during violence; starting over after trauma; healing, step by step; training as an energy healer; giving up the familiar, packing a backpack, and setting off to learn and teach energy healing techniques on four continents...all in the name of Service.  In the past few years, I've used my skills in communication and connection to develop a healing practice, start a successful jewelry business, write a training manual for healing techniques, and develop and teach workshops and retreats.  And after my daily morning meditation and yoga, I channel energy and create throughout the day - my voice, my pen and my hands speak for themselves, tales of wonder and beauty.  


Please join me.  Together, with our strengths and skills, we can face any challenge.  Together, we can offer the tools of healing to the world.  Together, we can create a new reality.


Other Ways You Can Help


First and foremost, please remember this project in your thoughts and prayers - smile and send whatever blessing you can, whenever you think of us.  This will help us more than anything else, the accumulated and directed Love that will sustain us and attract the energies we need.  The power of prayer and consciously directed intention is unparalleled (if you're curious about the science, read more here).


Money is only one energy in this great spectrum on consciousness - we seek diverse frequencies for this project!  If you can give the energy of your time, your prayers, your love, your expertise, please do - we need you.


If you have any interest in building with us, we seek people who want to:


  1. design and build a website
  2. help us make videos
  3. share our offerings through social media and other outlets
  4. set up the formalities of organization
  5. provide translation services
  6. share knowledge, art and expertise - especially in the areas of nutrition, yoga, life coaching, EFT, dance, art, art therapy, music, plant medicine, human design, evolutionary astrology, conscious evolution, storytelling, writing, travel of all kinds, etc etc etc.  IF YOU FEEL SO MOTIVATED, BE IN TOUCH!


Know that we will honor your gifts and the necessary exchange of energy...this life is about win-win situations, in which everyone feels good.  And so more good stuff keeps rolling in.  Contact me with questions at freestylefrequency@gmail.com - please put "School of James" somewhere in the subject heading and remember to include all of your contact details.


And, please please please, activate your connections and share this posting through email, LinkedIn, Facebook, Google, your blog, your website, your Twitter...anything and everything.  Use the share tools below and please help us get the word out!
story_txt:
**En Español también, aqui*We do not become healers.  We came as healers.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.We do not become storytellers.  We came as carriers of the stories we and our ancestors actually lived.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.We do not become artists.  We came as artists.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.We do not become writers, dancers, musicians, helpers, peacemakers.  We came as such.  We are.  Some of us are still catching up to what we are.We do not learn to love in this sense.  We came as Love.  We are Love.  Some of us are still catching up to who we truly are.- Dr. Clarissa Pinkola Estes "Simple Prayer for Remembering the Motherlode"The School of James is a curriculum offering opportunities to catch up to who we truly are...and then create a world that reflects our true selves.  It is a space for healing and growth, where anyone can learn to use the tools and develop the skills to emerge from the pain of past traumas and learned limitations.  It is both a refuge and a training ground, a safe place for nurturing the Self, integrating your Shadow, and accessing your innate courage to Choose Life.  It is called the School of James because it is located on the Camino de Santiago, the Way of Saint James, and because it is a legacy of the life of my brother James.   My story:People call me Robyn.  In 2010, I witnessed my brother James, the person I loved more than any other, experience what psychologists call a "psychotic break" and mutilate himself with a knife.  Trauma shocked me out of the paralysis I was in - and on a quest to find my true path.Healing became my passion, my focus.  Having little success with mainstream medicine, I turned to holistic alternatives.  Over the next five years, I studied many different modalities, working with acupuncture, massage, emotional freedom technique, shamanic practices, Reiki, yoga, and many more.  Eventually, I became a Reiki Master Teacher and began to teach others how to channel energy for healing.  I learned and taught healing techniques in the United States, Costa Rica, Morocco, Italy, and India before I came to the Camino.  It was here, while walking the Way, that I found the courage to being to realize my dream: sharing what I've learned with as many people as possible by building a school.The School: It will start as a virtual school offering remembrance tools to pilgrims on the Camino.  Of course, the Camino is a metaphor for life - the offerings will benefit anyone walking any path.  That said, the initial offerings are designed with the pilgrimage in mind: to support the healing journey, to help integrate the lessons learned while walking, and to provide guidance for manifesting dreams and projects in the next phase of the journey.  As we grow, the curriculum will deepen and provide opportunities for in-person classes, workshops, residential retreats and other types of learning exchanges.  Ultimately, the School will offer a full curriculum of opportunities to develop the skills necessary to raise ourselves and our conscious children to live joyful lives of passion and purpose.Now, I admit - I don't know what all this entails.  This is a huge undertaking...and a community effort.   I know what I can offer, based on what I've learned in my own healing journey and based on what makes my heart sing with joy.  But these things are only one contribution to the curriculum - and one individual's perspective does not a whole new world create.  This School, this life is a community effort; those whose hearts are stirred by these words, who feel called to contribute, will help co-create this project in every way.So, if you're feeling it, read on...What We Need & What You GetIn order to break things into smaller steps, accomplish things poco a poco, I've broken down the first part of the project into three initial phases and developed a generous budget for each phase.  The budget assumes that we'll pay for everything with monetary energy, rather than co-creating with the energies of trade and service.  Ideally, since life and the school are community efforts, people will give all types of creative energy, especially their ideas,their time, their art, their craft, their services...but it's also important to honor the reality of the monetary energy exchange.  We cannot give unless we also receive and vice versa; the cycle must be complete, the energy continually flowing, inputs fueling outputs feeding new inputs.  With this in mind, each of these initial phases is intended to feed and support the growth and development of the next phase.  The energy attracted by this campaign will develop the first two phases, forming a foundation upon which to build; the inflow of energy generated by these phases will feed the third phase and the on-going success and development of the School.Acknowledging the progression of growth, whatever support is attracted by this campaign will water each phase in turn - the seeds of Phase One will be planted first and watered to grow Phases Two and Three (and Four, Five, Six...on and on and on...).Phase One:  Creating Web Presence and Offering Healing and Support MaterialsTimeline - now through June 2016The website will serve as an access point for the initial offerings, the Support Kit and the Integration Kit, as well as a shared space for community connections and learning exchanges.  Initially, it will offered in two languages: English and Spanish.  This phase also includes the creation of the Camino Kits themselves, including the videos and written materials. The Kits are intended to facilitate the experience of walking the Way and the integration of the lessons learned after reaching Santiago; however, they are not Camino-specific and will be useful for anyone walking whatever path.  They are intended to offer skills and support for the life, the remembrance of the Self as a powerful source and force of love and joy.  The Support Kit consists of a series of videos with meditations, yoga postures, and teachings about meeting one's needs, nurturing, boundaries, etc; it is accompanied by daily journal questions, daily nurturance exercises, and the "Co-Create!" coloring book of healing drawings designed to provide energetic support and facilitate creative expression.  The Integration Kit consists of materials presenting the skills of grounding, connection, expansion and manifestation.  These Kits are based on my previous experiences on the Camino and the teaching I've done in other places; they will include the meditations, yoga asanas, and other healing techniques that I found integral to my healing process and those that others have expressed were of most value to them.  Perks of contributing to this campaign include receiving these Kits and the "Co-Create!" coloring book, along with the joy of being part of the movement :)The website will also serve as a community space for pilgrims to connect with each other, via profiles and discussion boards, and share their stories, successes, lessons and challenges as they continue their Way after Santiago.  The vision for this space includes an ever-expanding discussion of project creation and development and sharing what does and doesn't work (learning exchanges) with the community, as well as skill connections and trade opportunities, so that all might benefit from the experiences of integration and implementation.  Eventually, this space could consist of multi-media offerings, encompassing the wide range of creative expression we offer as we grow.Projected budget for Phase One: $4000 **Each of these costs can be mitigated by the donation of goods and services; such is preferred - the more hearts involved, the better!  This is a community project.**Website construction and maintenance costs - $800Hardware: laptop, camera, microphone - $2000Software: delivery system, accounting system - $200 Creative collaboration: photo/videography - $500Translation costs: $500Phase Two:  Sharing the Offering and Continuing EducationTimeline - April 2016 through October 2016This phase includes sharing the School's initial offerings, in person and online, and expanding the offerings through training and learning exchanges.  It's important to share these skills with as many people as possible, with the intention that those who learn the skills will apply them in their lives and model them to others, creating constantly expanding ripples of change.  Planned visibility points include Facebook, Google, online Camino forums and in person connections.  My current intention is to walk (and possibly ride a colorful bike) on the Camino again, teaching the offerings in person along the Way (in the albergues, the bars, wherever it happens) and sharing the website with words and tangible reminders, such as drawings, stickers and "graffiti."  Using the principles of street art activism, we'll share the message in ways that do not deface any vista by using non-toxic, temporary and sustainable papers, inks and glues.A major part of this phase is accumulating responses to the Kits and responding to and integrating the needs and suggestions offered.  And, as I continue teach the skills along the way, I'll record the feedback provided by pilgrims and use it to expand and refine the offerings of the Kits.  There will be a feedback component of the Kits, a request for input on the website, plus the information coming from my continuing correspondence with people whom I have met while walking and living on the Camino.Another aspect of this phase is deepening my own skill set for offering and teaching healing tools by attending and completing a formal yoga teacher training.  Thus far, my practice and teaching of yoga and meditation have grown out of my own intensive personal study.  With a formal training, I will have the guidance to take this study even deeper, so as to be able to develop a greater intimacy with the techniques and a more comprehensive understanding of how and why they work.  I'll be able to design and offer more effective and expansive healing opportunities, which will help grow my offering to the School in Phase Three.  Additionally, obtaining an official certificate will enable me to obtain insurance and facilitate the practical aspects of offering courses, workshops and residential retreats.  My heart sings with the practice and teaching of kundalini yoga, in the lineage of Yogi Bhajan; more about kundalini yoga and the teacher training I have chosen can be discovered at these websites: www.3HO.org, www.cherdikala.eu .Part of this training and developing new offerings includes holding practice courses and retreats,  in order to gain further experience and feedback.  These practicums will be open to those who participate in the campaign (another perk!) and anyone who wishes to give their heart energy to expand the School and what we can offer.  This is the phase in which new teachers and healing modalities are expressly sought, with the intention to build the School community and seed growth from common intention and diverse experience.  Experiments in material presented, ways of collaborating and new wholeness techniques are sought and encouraged.  We can create something amazing! Projected budget for Phase Two: $4500Sharing: online advertising, tangible items (cards, stickers, etc), distribution along the Camino - $500Kundalini yoga teacher training: $3000Costs for practice workshops and retreats: $1000Phase Three: Expansion and Offering of the School's CurriculumTimeline - November 2016 through November 2017This is the phase of applying the learning and connections from Phase Two so as to develop an expanded curriculum.  This is the phase of collaboration with new partners, of dreaming, of growth, and of creating tangible ways to offer skills for expansion.  My vision for my offering includes creating offering courses, workshops and trainings such as Energy Healing: Foundations and Techniques (an extension of what I already teach when people approach me for Reiki training), Dream Manifestation: Conscious Creation, Sexuality & Creativity: Empowerment, Tools for Allowing Grief, and Tools for Healing Sexual Wounding.  The intention is for others to develop and offer curricula on nutrition, holistic and traditional healing, plant medicine, permaculture and sustainable living techniques, energetic architecture, art therapy, dance, music, human design, tantra, storytelling, writing...the dream is BIG.  If you feel the call, COME!This is also the phase of creating a formal foundational structure that can serve as an interface for official communication and licensing, ie addressing the "real world" concerns of taxes, insurance, visas and the like.  Currently, it is my idea to create an entity based on the model provided by the Alternate Roots organization in the United States, in which all members of the organization take responsibility.  Although I am familiar with their organization and admire the ways in which they operate, I lack experience in setting up an organization with legal standing and would very much appreciate advice and help in this regard.  If you have any expertise or advice, please help us.As of this writing, and until the formal structure of the School is created, it is likely that I will bear individual responsibility for the taxes and any legal costs incurred from this campaign and during the first two phases.  With this reality in mind, I've included these projected costs (and anything unforeseen, as the unexpected is expected) in the budget.Projected budget for Phase Three: $1500Taxes, fees, organization costs, unexpected expenses - $1500Projected budget for Phases One through Three: $10,000 **Each of these costs can be mitigated by the donation of goods and services - the more hearts involved, the better!  This is a community project.**Timeline - now through November 2017The ImpactPeople come from all over the world to walk the Camino de Santiago - over 200,000 people in 2014 (source: wikipedia).  It is a sacred road, 800 kilometers of asking questions and receiving answers.  Everyone comes with different questions, different quests, different needs...but, step by step, everyone discovers, uncovers something.  For many, including me, the message of the Camino is remember the joy of existence, the passion of daily living, and the love that surrounds you!  And we do - we put down our pain, our suffering, our stories, and we listen to the wisdom inside, the little voice telling us how to Serve the Whole, how to Live our Soul's Purpose.  And then we take what we've learned back to where we live, in resolution to share what we've learned with our friends, our families, our communities...the healing and inspiration we find on the Camino ripples outward, affecting everything and everyone we touch.  We become better versions of ourselves and we change the world by our expansion, through the collective consciousness and through our direct actions.  Thus, all benefit, and we begin to create something new.This is a major access point for seekers, people searching for answers about how to live better lives, how to create better communities.  It's a road that attracts people looking for Love, to Give and Receive, to Choose Life.  So why not offer tools to the people who are taking action to change?  Why not share what we know about healing so that they can learn new skills and share them?  Why not?A major theme of this road, of this life and of the School is learning how to nurture ourselves: how to raise ourselves and, in turn, give our children examples of lives lived through conscious creation.  But we cannot give our children what we do not have.  We cannot teach our children what we do not know.  And we cannot nurture those who are coming if we cannot nurture those who are already here.Imagine if each one of us knew how to nurture ourselves and each other, creating communities of individuals dedicated to lovingly developing each other's infinite potential. Imagine that the goal of every thought, word and action was to nurture the inherent love and goodness within...and see it reflected without.  Imagine that every single relationship you have - with yourself, with other beings, with the Earth herself - was founded in this ideal of loving nurturing.  Imagine if we were all loving, dedicated parents to each other.  What would this world become?  How would it feel?  Just imagine...8 billion people nurturing each other...CHOOSE LIFE, DREAM BIG, and CALL A FRIEND - WE'RE ALL IN THIS TOGETHER!Risks & ChallengesThe ultimate and most basic risk is that we will build the School and no one will be interested in the opportunities that we have to offer.  Nothing could come of this project and we could fail completely in our objectives.  We risk this every time we make a decision, every single time we decide to do anything.  It's a reality of this dimensional experience.  So.  There's that.We will face challenges, for certain, and some of them will knock us down, while others will provide the rocky terrain that guides our feet higher up the mountain.  But we will not fail because we understand the power of the law of attraction and know how to allow connection, communication and communion.  We will not fail to expand the Love flowing through us.In this moment, these are the foreseen challenges and risks:Although I often refer to "we" in expectation of the team that will develop around this project, and in inclusion of everyone sending energy to this campaign, at this stage, I am working mostly alone.  (Albeit with an excellent support system.)  Allowing a team to coalesce organically, as the project develops, creates several challenges: patience; attracting the group of bright souls who desire to co-create something wonderful; practicing and teaching how to work in a heterarchy rather than a hierarchy; and working collaboratively with our strengths and weaknesses when we find each other.I don't know who will come to co-create the School; I do know that I will do the work to get it started, with whatever help appears, to build the foundations of Phases One and Two.  To launch these phases requires a lot of work, and it is the first time I've co-ordinated a project on this scale...but I plan to take it step by step, working with the principles of SMART project management, accountability deadlines, my community of support, and prioritizing self-care so that I can keep giving my best.  These things I know how to do, and I know how to ask for help when I need it.  Ask and ye shall receive.  Fortunately, I've worked with many people on their projects, ranging from expanding a large donativo wellness center to assisting the creation of a traveling artisan workshop to starting a vegetarian restaurant, and have learned much from their successes and challenges.  And I have mentors who can guide me.Other challenges include the technological aspects of Phase One and the fact that I do not yet speak fluent Spanish.  I have not yet learned how to run or update a website and, while I have made many meditation videos and taught many classes, I lack experience in creating professional quality audio-visual offerings.  But I am seeking help in creating these videos and whomever designs and builds the website will also teach me how to keep it current.  And I have at least one translator ready and excited to be a part of this project, as I continue to develop my language skills.Knowing my skills and strengths gives me confidence that I can spark the development of the School and, with help, face all risks and create solutions for all challenges along the way.  I am courageous, devoted, dedicated, creative, attentive to detail, and...persistent.  I've demonstrated and strengthened these qualities throughout the past decade: graduating summa cum laude from college and earning a law degree; walking away from this conventional path and the expectations of others to find my own way; keeping a cool head during violence; starting over after trauma; healing, step by step; training as an energy healer; giving up the familiar, packing a backpack, and setting off to learn and teach energy healing techniques on four continents...all in the name of Service.  In the past few years, I've used my skills in communication and connection to develop a healing practice, start a successful jewelry business, write a training manual for healing techniques, and develop and teach workshops and retreats.  And after my daily morning meditation and yoga, I channel energy and create throughout the day - my voice, my pen and my hands speak for themselves, tales of wonder and beauty.  Please join me.  Together, with our strengths and skills, we can face any challenge.  Together, we can offer the tools of healing to the world.  Together, we can create a new reality.Other Ways You Can HelpFirst and foremost, please remember this project in your thoughts and prayers - smile and send whatever blessing you can, whenever you think of us.  This will help us more than anything else, the accumulated and directed Love that will sustain us and attract the energies we need.  The power of prayer and consciously directed intention is unparalleled (if you're curious about the science, read more here).Money is only one energy in this great spectrum on consciousness - we seek diverse frequencies for this project!  If you can give the energy of your time, your prayers, your love, your expertise, please do - we need you.If you have any interest in building with us, we seek people who want to:

design and build a website


help us make videos


share our offerings through social media and other outlets


set up the formalities of organization

provide translation services
share knowledge, art and expertise - especially in the areas of nutrition, yoga, life coaching, EFT, dance, art, art therapy, music, plant medicine, human design, evolutionary astrology, conscious evolution, storytelling, writing, travel of all kinds, etc etc etc.  IF YOU FEEL SO MOTIVATED, BE IN TOUCH!
Know that we will honor your gifts and the necessary exchange of energy...this life is about win-win situations, in which everyone feels good.  And so more good stuff keeps rolling in.  Contact me with questions at freestylefrequency@gmail.com - please put "School of James" somewhere in the subject heading and remember to include all of your contact details.And, please please please, activate your connections and share this posting through email, LinkedIn, Facebook, Google, your blog, your website, your Twitter...anything and everything.  Use the share tools below and please help us get the word out!

story:
By $ 1, 5, 10, 15 ..... you can support us,  step by step we can create wonderfull things!!! 


Summary

My name is Abraham Jarquin, I am 29 years old, and I am from Guatemala. My parents are from Nicaragua and were expelled to Guatemala in 80's because a civil war. During their initial years in Guatemala they struggled as immigrants trying to find jobs to support them and their only child. Eventually they passed very difficult and critical moments and established themselves with a good home, economy, and jobs.  With a better quality of life, they were able to pay for my elementary and high school education. Eventually I was able to get a scholarship for studies at the university and graduate from Agricultural Engineer School. Guatemala is located in Central America and is one of the poorest Countries with chronic malnutrition in the world and I envisioned using my degree to help people in Guatemala. 


 Over the past seven years I have been working for a Non-Government Organization (NGO) in different states within Guatemala. My outreach work involves development and training of individuals and social groups.  My outreach work focuses on food security, food safety, economic development, nutrition, and natural resource management.  As the result of my work people are given the opportunity to become self-sufficient by growing food for their families, to advance themselves with more education, and to become economically independent through business education and entrepreneurship. Almost 90% of the people I’ve helped are families with an average of 5-8 children, who live on less than $ 1 per day, and suffer from chronic malnutrition.  The past years with these different projects have been very rewarding to watch these people learn to help themselves, learn about different opportunities, and learn to work in the areas of ​​agriculture, planting crops and feeding themselves with quality nutrition.

As a result of watching people improve their quality of lives I have decided to start this campaign to finance a MBA. After graduating I will continue to support my community and various people I served. With this advanced education I can provide: more innovative concepts, advanced levels of trainings and workshops, advanced learning in business management, development, and marketing, new businesses development, investment planning, and others.

What I Need & Expected Outcomes

In order to study for an MBA at INCAE (Central American Institute of Business School funded by Harvard since 1956), funding of $60,000 is needed. The duration of this curriculum is one year and four months, attending full time, and living on the campus of INCAE. The university is located in Nicaragua and Costa Rica. I have chosen to study at the headquarters of Nicaragua because it is more affordable when compared to the headquarters of Costa Rica.

Upon completion of the MBA in Nicaragua, I can return to my country with many more tools and knowledge and continue to support educational outreach to all those low-income people so they can advance themselves in various agricultural projects, business administration, and business development. This will ultimately help them to implement what they learned and to generate different sources of income to economically benefit their families and communities.

I am sincerely asking you to support my dream and goal of achieving an MBA in Nicaragua.  Without it my vision to continue helping the many poor people Guatemala will be more challenging and require an extra struggle to advance the people and reduce the poverty that exists within Guatemala.

The Impact

This vision means a lot to me, personally and professionally, and as a collaborator with different organizations and companies serving the underserved in Guatemala. For several years I have been helping many people through NGO's and private institutions to develop training and trainings in different topics such as agriculture for people with limited resources who have chronic malnutrition. With this advanced degree I have a dream of improving my country by providing people with knowledge to apply new skills so they can improve themselves and help others. Financing of this project aims to finance entry into one of the top universities in Latin America and the knowledge gained would help hundreds of lives or more.

In the past two years I have been working directly with usaid, strengthening knowledge of people on topics such as establishment of vegetable production, honey, peanuts, fruits and rabbit production for human consumption and nourishment. These projects developed in the last two years have provided priceless knowledge to hundreds of people around of Guatemala, generating a great impact on our society, and helping to reduce the biggest problem our country: chronic malnutrition. After obtaining an MBA, I would continue to support more people with new ideas in development of new businesses, marketing of products produced by themselves, costs and profits of products or services.


Risks & Challenges

For about three years I had the dream of earning an MBA and continuing to help my country and its people. This is my first experience in the search for funding through an opportunity such as this website. I did not know such an opportunity to solicit funds existed and realize it may be a challenge.

While this endeavor is unique, nothing in life is easy and I must remain focused on long-term goals. That is why I ask you to support me in this life project that undoubtedly will change many families in this country, a country with many problems to solve and countless people who only can afford to give a smile to get some help as I have been offering for years.

Grain by grain as the beaches of the oceans, formed equally I ask you to collaborate with your donation to support this dream. Please help me with this project, this dream, to move my life forward. If for any reason you are not able to help, 

I just ask you to do me a favor by sharing this with your friends and family. I believe in this campaign to solicit and make this dream of mine a reality and to help many others desire to move forward and grow as a person. Thank you very much for your time and consideration, I hope to count on your support.


Thanks a Lot !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   :)

In order to study for an MBA at
INCAE (Central American Institute of Business School funded by Harvard since
1956), funding of $60,000 is needed. The duration of this curriculum is one
year and four months, attending full time, and living on the campus of INCAE.
The university is located in Nicaragua and Costa Rica. I have chosen to study
at the headquarters of Nicaragua because it is more affordable when compared to
the headquarters of Costa Rica.
Upon completion of the MBA in
Nicaragua, I can return to my country with many more tools and knowledge and
continue to support educational outreach to all those low-income people so they
can advance themselves in various agricultural projects, business
administration, and business development. This will ultimately help them to
implement what they learned and to generate different sources of income to
economically benefit their families and communities.
I am sincerely asking you to support
my dream and goal of achieving an MBA in Nicaragua.  Without it my vision to continue helping the many
poor people Guatemala will be more challenging and require an extra struggle to
advance the people and reduce the poverty that exists within Guatemala.
The Impact
This vision means a lot to me,
personally and professionally, and as a collaborator with different
organizations and companies serving the underserved in Guatemala. For several
years I have been helping many people through NGO's and private institutions to
develop training and trainings in different topics such as agriculture for
people with limited resources who have chronic malnutrition. With this advanced
degree I have a dream of improving my country by providing people with
knowledge to apply new skills so they can improve themselves and help others. Financing
of this project aims to finance entry into one of the top universities in Latin
America and the knowledge gained would help hundreds of lives or more.
In the past two years I have been
working directly with usaid, strengthening knowledge of people on topics such
as establishment of vegetable production, honey, peanuts, fruits and rabbit
production for human consumption and nourishment. These projects developed in
the last two years have provided priceless knowledge to hundreds of people
around of Guatemala, generating a great impact on our society, and helping to
reduce the biggest problem our country: chronic malnutrition. After obtaining
an MBA, I would continue to support more people with new ideas in development
of new businesses, marketing of products produced by themselves, costs and
profits of products or services. 
Risks & Challenges
For about three years I had the
dream of earning an MBA and continuing to help my country and its people. This
is my first experience in the search for funding through an opportunity such as
this website. I did not know such an opportunity to solicit funds existed and
realize it may be a challenge.
While this endeavor is unique,
nothing in life is easy and I must remain focused on long-term goals. That is
why I ask you to support me in this life project that undoubtedly will change
many families in this country, a country with many problems to solve and
countless people who only can afford to give a smile to get some help as I have
been offering for years.
Grain by grain as the beaches of
the oceans, formed equally I ask you to collaborate with your donation to
support this dream. Please help me with this project, this dream, to move my
life forward. If for any reason you are not able to help, I just ask you to do
me a favor by sharing this with your friends and family. I believe in this
campaign to solicit and make this dream of mine a reality and to help many
others desire to move forward and grow as a person. Thank you very much for
your time and consideration, I hope to count on your support.Thanks a Lot !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   :)

story:
Hello everybody,

I'm Robert - 29 years old and a teacher. I've been involved in education for about 7 years now and love every minute of it, since quitting my job as a sales and marketing executive in London to teach English I have had some really amazing times and met some equally amazing people.

In 2011 my back-packing gap year turned into a career move and I have decided to dedicate my life to teaching English. In 2015 I moved from China (where I met my wonderful wife) back to Europe - to Madrid, Spain to continue teaching.

Last week I got an email from a friend of a friend who is moving back to the USA and is selling their small English school in a small town that's part of Madrid. Knowing my love of teaching (and experience in sales/marketing) they asked me if I was interested. I said I was, as long as I could raise the funds. As glamourous as teaching is, it doesn't pay that much!

After confirming the purchase price with them this evening I turn to Indiegogo with the hope that you can support this dream and make it a reality.

I would really appreciate whatever you can pledge, be it  €5 or €5,000 or anything in between!

All those that donate will get their names and photograph (if they wish) put on a special "dedication" wall in the school to show my appreciation and let the students know who helped them continue their education.

Once we are up and running by the summer, anybody who has donated to the school would be able to come and visit us and meet the kids, you could even lead a class or give a talk!

Again, thank you for reading and please hit the pledge button with whatever you can afford!

story:
Sinfonietta Strings of Greater Nashua


Greetings, my name is Nancy Goodwin, the lead teacher for Sinfonietta Strings. I have been teaching violin for over 25 years and performing violin professionally for 30. I am pleased to present the Sinfonietta Strings Program of Greater Nashua here in New Hampshire.   This is a United Way program that teaches violin and viola weekly to students in the Nashua public schools and offers an after school string ensemble to all string students in the Greater Nashua area. Besides teaching music Sinfonietta Strings provides an emotional and creative outlet to kids and a positive social setting.

This program complements existing school band programs and enhances the regular classroom program, teaching children to focus while learning how to read music and play an instrument.  We offer group lessons in three of the twelve elementary schools in Nashua.  Once a week, 45 students take 30 minute lessons on violin or viola in groups of 3 students each.  After school the string ensemble for older and more advanced players currently enrolls 35 students from the Greater Nashua area. Students learn music and they learn how to work as a team.

40% of Sinfonietta Strings students are on a free or reduced lunch program.  One of the schools is a Title 1 school and every string student from this school needs a scholarship and instrument.  In the non-Title 1 schools instruments, rental assistance and scholarship assistance are given to students who are on free or discounted lunch programs.

Sinfonietta Strings was designed from the outset to require no school district funds since even critical programs are and will continue to be cut. Having established Sinfonietta Strings in three of the elementary schools we wish to add another Title 1 school by September 2016.  We need to raise $4,500 for each Title 1 school we teach in and $3,000 for non-Title 1 schools. We would like to continue the program in one of the three Middle Schools. In the after school string ensemble, we would like to enroll more students not able to afford tuition.  Importantly we do not want the cost for the tuition paying parents to become unreasonably high in order to subsidize the 40% in need of scholarship.

Your donation will put an instrument in students' hands and the training to go with it. Students that would not have the opportunity any other way.  Please spread the word!

story:
MI.CA. FOUNDATION IS A PROJECT aiming at promoting the improvement of health conditions and the social and economic progress of Mozambique.

Vision


Spread access to health care in Africa.


Values


In carrying out its role, the Mi.Ca. Foundation will be guided by the following values:


Integrity

Dedication

Confidence


Promote the improvement of health conditions and the social and economic progress of Mozambique.

From an economic perspective, Mozambique has been defined by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) as one of the most dynamic economies in sub-Saharan Africa, the rate of GDP growth is around to' 8%. Exports increased from $ 360 million in 2000 to a peak of 1 115 billion in 2013. It is expected to continue growing.

Despite the positive data on growth rates, mainly linked to the sector of raw materials, it must be stated that the wealth is poorly distributed, 54% of the population lives below the poverty line, the agricultural sector still accounts for the existence 80% of the workforce and infrastructure and health and education systems are still inefficient.

To allow Mozambique to benefit more revenue from the exploitation of its resources, the project Mi.Ca. Foundation will engage in the construction of a communication network air and ground, in the training of local staff and in other projects aimed at improving the education system and the country's health, the raising of the subsistence level and the development of small and medium enterprises .

The first essential step is to implement a network of air and land transport, in order to ensure an emergency service, named "Flying Doctors", which will help the inhabitants of remote or disadvantaged areas, not easily accessible by other means of transport; but that will also allow a timely intervention in the most serious and urgent cases, administering first aid and assistance.

The second step will be to facilitate trade in goods between local suppliers and final users (local and foreign), so as to promote the growth and development of local small and medium enterprises (craftsmen, fishermen, farmers, small producers) and to facilitate and improve the availability of goods, services and labor, both for the leisure sector (hospitality / catering) for manufacturing companies and service sectors.

The transport service would also undertake the delivery of the correspondence between the coast and inland.

The potential of creating satellite activities ahich increase and better not only the economic but also the hygienic / sanitary conditions and cultural needs of local populations, is huge.


It must be considered that many of the developments of international air transport of big airlines, will inevitably affect the development of the territory. Just think, for example, that large companies use, as a criterion in its strategic business decisions, an unpredictable and rapidly changing market forces and variables of profit, rather than adopt the considerations on social and territorial variables.

Our program Mi.Ca. Foundation, brings together air transport with other transport routes (land and sea), and communications.

We expect continued efforts to strengthen transport and logistics facilities, at local level, with particular attention to environmental protection, safety and innovative transport solutions, efficient in terms of energy and cost; we refer also to possible problems of "quarantine".

As for environmental protection, it is unlikely that the main environmental problem associated with air travel, that is, the noise and engine emissions, would be relevant (unlike the large commercial aircraft and passengers) in the context of small ultralight or caravel, because of their payload, range and the small stream. But above all for the use of natural airstrip (airstrips in clay, with low environmental impact).

Consider, on the other hand, the enormous and significant effect of the construction of large airports (such as loss of open space and soil erosion; the impact on the water and on the fields of drainage, etc, not to mention of flora and fauna, especially in coastal areas).

As for the aspects of quarantine, we adopt measures (as defined by WHO) to prevent the spread of epidemics, especially malaria or yellow fever, potentially carried by vectors. We proceed further with regular pest control means, to ensure that the target is reached.

That is why we need immediate support for the start-up of this challenging task that takes time, diplomacy and constant dedication.

We need funds to start the business of air transport, with its licenses and concessions for both governmental activity itself and for the construction of the airstrips; funds for the construction of structures for initial reception of patients; logistics facilities for sorting and temporary storage of goods and correspondence; rental of premises for training / updating of personnel.

BIOGRAPHY

Mi.Ca. Foundation, partners of ZRP Aviation, is a project aimed at improving the social / economic / health conditions of Mozambique.

It 'a project of health care at distance, so as to improve the hygiene conditions and health of some inland areas of Mozambique, currently unacceptable.

Promotion of a transport project "low fares" of people and goods, so as to encourage local shadow economies.

Our greatest pride is the SAFETY of the means used and the respect for environment, especially on the coast.

ZRP is a team of professionals known for its rigor in safety.

It is also the first company established in Zanzibar to have developed the aviation activities from a leisure / tourism point of view, with a blloming flight school.

Our passion for the sky and the land of Africa, that continuosly touch us, persuaded us to return something back, through this our new project.

SUPPORT US!



TECHNICAL PROJECT:


  • Request license and government concession for the exercise of aviation and commercial land transport.

  • Creating new airstrips with reduced environmental impact.

  • Contact and collaboration with local and foreign volunteer doctors, for the provision of medical care and health care (free and upon payment, depending on the level of income of the various segments of the population or local expat residents). Health self-education at patients home.

  • Contact with local producers and suppliers for collaboration and performance of the transport service from the hinterland to the coast and vice versa.

  • Creating a logistics network for the mail sorting and temporary storage of packages (in shipment / delivery).

  • Recruiting and training local staff.

  • Marketing and Communication in order to inform the local and foreign investors about the private activities of "Flying Doctors" and freight low fares of the transport company.


Governmental Licenses

- Authorizations and concessions

- Rights and stamps

- Pilot training

- Airstrip building (in clay court, with low environmental impact)

- Purchase and maintenance of aircraft (second hand), Cessna C172

- Offices and warehouses Rentals.


As far as tariffs are concerned, the only ones will be "low fares", applied for the private transport of goods and people.

As regard as the project "Flying Doctors", it will be about voluntary contributions to be collected on-site, since it is a matter of activity coming from volunteer doctors, for bands of subsistence.

As for the private medical tasks/job upon payment, only local tariffs and prices will be appliied.

story:
Sirley Avila is a Farmer elected and re-elected by her community as a "Delegate", the first representative step in the cuban electoral system.

She had the mission of BUILDING THE ONLY RURAL SCHOOL in many sq. miles in the west of cuba.

Sirley gained international respect when she suceeeded in this task despite all the aggressions, threats, and pressure from the political police's darkest forces.

SHE HAS BEEN CONTINUALLY AND INCREASINLY HARRASED... UNTIL THE LAST MACHETE ATTACK THAT TOOK HER LEFT HAND, RIGHT SHOULDER AND BOTH KNEES.

This fund is to help her recovery, and to secure her most basic needs and hopefully raise awareness about the need for her protection. (I am quickly building the website, please check it out at : www.supportsirley.org

100% of the funds will be put in the disposition of Sirley Avila for her own management.

I Hope I reached your heart with this, and I WANT TO THANK EVERYONE WHO HAS A LOVING HEART AND A GIVING HAND


Gracias a todos !
Ernesto Eduardo


NEWS LINKS:
http://www.diariodecuba.com/derechos-humanos/14...
http://www.martinoticias.com/content/agreden-ma...
http://www.cubaencuentro.com/cuba/articulos/ten...

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


5/24/2015  MACHETE ASSAULT, Post-Operatoy Video

VIEWERS DISCRETION - VERY GRAPHIC CONTENT :( :( :( :( 


(please note the character, and how strong and courageous this woman is !!!)
 


Medical Resume:
They cut her hand  and they throw it to the pigs, so Dorctors coudn't re-attach it; She had may still lose the entire right arm due to the shoulder cut, and both knees has been compromised

:( :( :( :( 

2012 SIRLEY AVILA is elected by her community for her unique values and courage, she then gains notoriety and international recognition for her bravery and determination to have a Rural School built for her small "pueblito"

SIRLEY is the archetype of the sacrificed heroin... she truly is and because of so she deserves our protection !




08/19/2013  -  AN EXAMPLE OF CONSTANT POLICE HARASSMENT, COHERTION AND THEATS !

Find This Campaign On

story:
▲▲▲ For our English speaking friends, please scroll for the translated story until you hit these mountains. ▲▲▲

Climb Again până azi

Din 2013 am reușit, prin muncă voluntară și mici finanțări, să aducem la cursuri gratuite de escaladă peste 100 de copii cu deficiențe de vedere și auz, 40 de copii cu autism și în jur de 50 de tineri cu alte tipuri de dizabilități. 

Am organizat probe demonstrative sau competitive la majoritatea concursurilor din calendarul competițional al Federației Române de Alpinism și Escaladă, am fost în excursii la munte și am încercat să îi scoatem cât mai des la activități în afara internatului în care își petrec majoritatea timpului.

În acest timp, am închegat o echipă de 8 copii și juniori cu deficiențe senzoriale cu real potențial în performanță sportivă.


Ce ne-am propus

Vrem ca anul școlar viitor să transformăm proiectul Climb Again în curs permanent al școlii pentru deficienți de vedere din București. Vrem ca toți cei 120 de copii ai școlii să beneficieze de cel puțin un antrenament bilunar, prin care să le îmbunătățim percepția spațiului și orientarea, capacitatea de memorare și rezolvare a problemelor, și care să le dea curajul și încrederea în sine pentru o viață independentă ca adulți.

Noi am văzut schimbarea în acești copii, și avem nevoie să arătăm lumii că barierele nu există decât în mintea oamenilor. Ajută-ne să atingem o masă critică de beneficiari și să confirmăm acest sport ca o soluție reală de incluziune socială.


Ce avem nevoie

Vom construi un panou de escaladă în sala de sport pentru a putea lucra mai ușor cu toți copiii din școală. Avem nevoie de materiale pentru asta.

Vom aduce la antrenamente suplimentare la sala de escaladă pe acei copii care au înclinații spre performanță. Avem nevoie de transport pentru ei.

Vom aduna o echipă mai mare de instructori care să poată lucra intensiv cu grupe mici de copii. Avem nevoie să le răsplătim efortul, după aproape 2 ani de voluntariat.

Vom continua să organizăm concursuri și excursii la munte pentru cei mici. Avem nevoie de fonduri logistice pentru asta.
Pragul de 20.000 $ este minimul necesar pentru un mix de activități care se întind pe 9 luni cât durează anul școlar. În paralel, facem eforturi pentru a obține sponsorizări în echipament sportiv. Dacă nu atingem suma propusă, banii vor fi folosiți tot în programul dedicat copiilor cu deficiențe de vedere, însă numărul beneficiarilor va fi mult mai mic, iar efortul nostru de drămuire a fondurilor mult mai mare.

Cum se schimbă lucrurile? 

Trăim într-o Românie în care acești copii sunt izolați, iar sub 13% din adulții cu dizabilități ajung să muncească și să ducă o viață independentă. Noi vrem să contribuim la schimbare, și am găsit metoda prin care să insuflăm încredere acestor copii. Escalada este un sport incluziv, care aduce în echilibru fizicul și psihicul, și în care diferențele între cei cu nevoi speciale și cei tipici nu există atâta timp cât metodele de învățare sunt adaptate.

De când a apărut Climb Again, am reușit să aducem în săli publice copii cu deficiențe de vedere, să introducem probe pentru ei în concursurile de cățărat, să facem demonstrații și să convingem lumea că singura dizabilitate a lor e proiecția greșită pe care o au oamenii din jur.

Hai să continuăm să-i scoatem din casă, să îi provocăm și să nu-i lăsăm să ajungă stingheri în lumea largă. Fii și tu parte din planul nostru!


▲▲ Dacă îți place povestea noastră, arată-le și prietenilor tăi ceea ce facem deja și ce plănuim să mai facem. Folosește butoanele de share de mai jos - cine știe de unde mai sare un donator?


▲▲▲▲▲▲ [ENGLISH]


Climb Again until today

Since 2013, through voluntary work and little financing, we managed to bring to our climbing classes over 100 children who are visually and hearing impaired, 40 children with autism and another 50 children with other disabilities.

We organized demonstrative and competitive paraclimbing trials at most contests held by the Romanian Federation of Sport Climbing, we went climbing outdoors and tried to involve the children as often as we could in activities outside the foster home in which they spend most of their time.

During this time, we have also assembled a team of 8 children and juniors with real potential to top performance in paraclimbing internationally.


What we want to achieve

We want to turn our Climb Again program into a permanent class at the special school for the visually impaired in Bucharest by the time the next scholar year starts. We want all 120 children in the school to benefit from training twice a month: developing their space perception and orientation, their memory and problem solving capacity and giving them the courage and self esteem they need to become independent adults.

We have seen the change in these kids and we need to show everybody that limits and boundaries are all in our heads.


What we need

We plan on building a climbing wall in the school’s gym in order to reach all the children in the school. We need proper building materials and equipment to do this.

We plan on extensively training the children who show potential, at a climbing gym downtown. We need to transport them from here to there.

We want to gather a bigger team of instructors that can intensively train small groups of children. We need to reward their continuous effort, after two years of voluntary work.

We will continue to organize trips and contests in the mountains. We need logistic funds for this.

The 20,000$ objective is the minimum we would need for a mix of activities that last for the entire school year of 9 months. At the same time, we are investing our efforts into obtaining sponsorships in the form of equipment and climbing gear. If we don’t reach our target, the money will be still spent on working with visually impaired children, but the number of beneficiaries will be much smaller, and our efforts to skimp the money much bigger.


How things change

We live in a country where these kids are isolated, and less than 13% of the disabled adults in Romania get in the work field and live an independent life. We want to contribute to social change, and we have found the method to give these children the self-confidence they need. Climbing is an inclusive sport, that imposes balance between the body and the mind, and where the differences between typical people and people with special needs tend to disappear as long as the learning methods are adapted.

Since we started the Climb Again project, we managed to bring visually impaired children to public gyms and mix them with the typical crowds, to introduce problems for paraclimbers at local climbing competitions, to generate awareness and convince people that the only disability these children have is the faulty projection the world around has in relation to them.

Let’s keep on getting these kids out of the house, challenging them and never letting them become socially awkward. Be a part of our plan!


▲▲ If you like our story, share it with your friends. Use the buttons below – who knows where the donors appear from next?
story_txt:
▲▲▲ For our English speaking friends, please scroll for the translated story until you hit these mountains. ▲▲▲

Climb Again până azi

Din 2013 am reușit, prin muncă voluntară și mici finanțări, să aducem la cursuri gratuite de escaladă peste 100 de copii cu deficiențe de vedere și auz, 40 de copii cu autism și în jur de 50 de tineri cu alte tipuri de dizabilități. 
Am organizat probe demonstrative sau competitive la majoritatea concursurilor din calendarul competițional al Federației Române de Alpinism și Escaladă, am fost în excursii la munte și am încercat să îi scoatem cât mai des la activități în afara internatului în care își petrec majoritatea timpului.
În acest timp, am închegat o echipă de 8 copii și juniori cu deficiențe senzoriale cu real potențial în performanță sportivă.




Ce ne-am propus
Vrem ca anul școlar viitor să transformăm proiectul Climb Again în curs permanent al școlii pentru deficienți de vedere din București. Vrem ca toți cei 120 de copii ai școlii să beneficieze de cel puțin un antrenament bilunar, prin care să le îmbunătățim percepția spațiului și orientarea, capacitatea de memorare și rezolvare a problemelor, și care să le dea curajul și încrederea în sine pentru o viață independentă ca adulți.


Noi am văzut schimbarea în acești copii, și avem nevoie să arătăm lumii că barierele nu există decât în mintea oamenilor. Ajută-ne să atingem o masă critică de beneficiari și să confirmăm acest sport ca o soluție reală de incluziune socială.
   Ce avem nevoie

Vom construi un panou de escaladă în sala de sport pentru a putea lucra mai ușor cu toți copiii din școală. Avem nevoie de materiale pentru asta.


Vom aduce la antrenamente suplimentare la sala de escaladă pe acei copii care au înclinații spre performanță. Avem nevoie de transport pentru ei.


Vom aduna o echipă mai mare de instructori care să poată lucra intensiv cu grupe mici de copii. Avem nevoie să le răsplătim efortul, după aproape 2 ani de voluntariat.

Vom continua să organizăm concursuri și excursii la munte pentru cei mici. Avem nevoie de fonduri logistice pentru asta.


Pragul de 20.000 $ este minimul necesar pentru un mix de activități care se întind pe 9 luni cât durează anul școlar. În paralel, facem eforturi pentru a obține sponsorizări în echipament sportiv. Cum se schimbă lucrurile? 


Trăim într-o Românie în care acești copii sunt izolați, iar sub 13% din adulții cu dizabilități ajung să muncească și să ducă o viață independentă. Noi vrem să contribuim la schimbare, și am găsit metoda prin care să insuflăm încredere acestor copii. Escalada este un sport incluziv, care aduce în echilibru fizicul și psihicul, și în care diferențele între cei cu nevoi speciale și cei tipici nu există atâta timp cât metodele de învățare sunt adaptate.


De când a apărut Climb Again, am reușit să aducem în săli publice copii cu deficiențe de vedere, să introducem probe pentru ei în concursurile de cățărat, să facem demonstrații și să convingem lumea că singura dizabilitate a lor e proiecția greșită pe care o au oamenii din jur.
Hai să continuăm să-i scoatem din casă, să îi provocăm și să nu-i lăsăm să ajungă stingheri în lumea largă. Fii și tu parte din planul nostru!
