story:
Summary

CareerPathTool is a software in cloud where anyone who wants to gain a better understanding of their work-life preferences and expectations of future career  can get support and guidance to the right direction.

CareerPathTool is a cloud-based tool that with taking in account user preferences, expectations, personal strengths, competencies, experience (if any) also helps make sense of career management fundamentals. Additionally CareerPathTool helps you to prepare an action plan to consciously shape your professional mobility. 

 

Benefits

CareerPathTool helps you determine your true calling in work and in life.
Imagine accomplishing results you have always desired, challenges you feared are overcamed and your level of positiveness and enthusiasm is growing every day.
It is all possible. You just need to find out what is the right way.

What We Need & What You Get 

The minimum goal is to collect € 9900. That helps us to create an online tool and web-based environment, The Portal. The collected money will be used for programming and web design.  Project management work will be done by enthusiasts on a voluntary basis.

In the first phase of the plan we expect to make the cloud-based user environment, which will be filled with worksheets for users. Our first user-group is pupils and students. The initial plan is that first version should be ready for testing by September 2016 and be available for public use a  month later.

To be able develop the page as it is planned we need approximately 20 k €. It means adding more functions like different level of exercises, assessments, personality tests, advanced level of analytics etc.

In the long run the CareerPath Tool will be a modern and dynamic environment for all interested parties - students, employees, companies, colleges, universities and so on.

How it works?

 

In CareerPathTool an user creates a new private account and can do a number of activities related to the analysis of his/her career:

 

  • Creation of a career profile (to be completed in-depth profile of competencies, values, preferences, expectations and opportunities)
  • Career plan (simple and clear form and the instructions for drawing up the action plan)
  • Career diary (describe all of existing experience in the form  that will later help you candidate to a new job, as well to analyze the results of one's current employment)
  • Instructions and guidelines for career development and planning
  • Information about the different possibilities for professional self-improvement.

CareerPath Tool is suitable for everybody - pupils, graduates, students, employees, seniors or any of you who today are looking for (new) direction in your life.

The Tool is very powerful and guides a user through a numerous steps to analyze the real expectations and opportunities for future.

CPT is free to use for everybody who is interested, it is very simple and requires no special training. You can return to CareerPath at at any time and update your records, edit data and make new plans.

Risks & Challenges

The Tool will be available in English and also in other languages if there is interest from users. For example Spanish, Swedish, Portugese, Italian, German, Lithuanian etc.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute we would be happy to maintain your contact so you could help us with feedback and suggestions when the first demo version is launched. Please sign up with your e-mail so we can contact you.

Also, if the topic is important to you and you could provide language service in the future (to translate the content of the Tool) or adjust it closer to your local users, we would be happy to hear from you!

story:
Help Get Kids Ready to Meet Kenya's Challenges

In five years, Small Solutions has introduced technology to more than 100 classrooms in Kenya.  We have seen so much excitement and potential in learners. We have only scratched the surface of their eagerness and need for technology.   Please fund this program: Invent and Learn. Help unleash their potential as the inventors and creators of their country's future. .  

This program

Is designed and led by David Muya. He is an Kenyan award winning Microsoft Innovator and teacher of technology. 

  • Will train teachers to facilitate creative problem solving

  • Will bring the full power of the internet to children so they can access the knowledge of the global community.

  • Will demonstrate the changes resulting from this Invent & Learn curriculum. 

Our Invent & Learn curriculum pilot brings together some of best teachers in Kenya to evaluate the cognitive impact of this 'maker' curriculum.   The curriculum draws from the book by Gary Stager and Sylvia Martinez Invent to Learn  http://inventtolearn.com.

Leaders of Breakthrough Ideas

To demonstrate the power of this learning model:

  • Help us purchase  technical resources: Little Bits, Tablets, iPads, Projectors, Arduino Boards
  • Fund our trainers:  David Muya , Christian Kakoba, Karikuki Waweru, Oscar Limoke, Kevin Ndungu. 

The Impact

Proof of Concept.  Funders want to see outcomes. Students transformed from observers to creators, game players to game makers, . 

  • Teachers will have alternatives to content based education in  a laboratory for experiential learning

  • Students engaged in creating, inventing, applying thinking to real world problems

Kenyan Leaders in Educational Technology

The thousands of students who have participated in our programs no longer feel left out.  They know that they have a future.

  • Daniel creates amazing art.
  • Young Women Teaching Technology

Connect Your Community to a Kenyan School

The power of the internet is to connect kids and their ideas across continents :

  • Kids designing 3D images for printing together across the internet gateway
  • Fund this, you will fund the facilitators of this co-creativity

Learn more about us on Facebook,  www.smallsolutionsbigideas.org, flick.com/smallsolutionsbigideas; youtube channel Small Solutions Big Ideas.

story:
To make a change can mean a lot of things. Volunteering for service hours may make some kind of change, but by giving back to the community through true compassion, commitment, and leadership, this change can blossom and turn into something beautiful. Having the opportunity to bring joy to people by playing for various nursing homes, Daniel Maclean, Hadassah Lai, and I were committed to contribute to the community in a larger scale, something even more inspiring. In addition to creating a campaign, we decided to perform a charity concert for Musical Angels.


Musical Angels, founded by Dr. Gustavo Tolosa, is a certified 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization whose mission is to uplift and improve the quality of life of hospitalized children by actively engaging them in the process of making music with their own hands and hearts. Musical Angels provides free, weekly piano lessons to children ages six and above while they are at the hospital.

For our campaign, our goal is to reach a minimum of $1000 which would go directly to the Musical Angels organization. Your donations would mean the world to these hospitalized children! The funds would allow the organization to purchase musical instruments that remain in hospitals for children to continue learning and making music, assist the children in continuing music lessons after they leave the hospital, and bring the best music teachers to each hospital to teach weekly lessons. The hospitals are located in the Dallas area. They include the Children's Medical Center, Scottish Rite Hospital for Children, Our Children's House at Baylor, and the Medical City Children's Hospital.

We believe this campaign can improve the lives of many hospitalized children, and hope this small idea may inspire other hospitals to join in on the effort to really make a difference in these children's lives.The charity concert will be on September 5th at Zion Lutheran Church (6121 E. Lovers Ln. Dallas, TX 75214) from 2:00pm - 3:30pm. We will be featuring works by Beethoven, Chopin, Mendelssohn, Ginastera, and Dvorak. We will also have guest artists, the Silver Strings, who have also performed in various nursing homes across the city of Plano such as the Legacy at Willow Bend, The Conservatory Senior Living, and the Life Care Center at Plano. Lastly, there will be a nice reception provided by us, so please come!

As we enter high school as seniors in the upcoming school year, time is a very precious asset, and after putting much time and effort into this campaign and managing, coordinating, and practicing for this upcoming concert on September 5th, we hope you all can come join in, donate, spread the word, and enjoy the Labor Day Weekend with us!

Our event is live on Facebook, so head on over to:https://www.facebook.com/events/750723471716369/

Again, your contributions will make a huge difference to every hospitalized child who is a part of Musical Angels, and we hope you can come to our concert on September 5th!

Thank You!

-Daniel Maclean, Hadassah Lai, and David Danjul

story:
In brief

The Debating Society Germany e.V. are the national non-profit representatives and organisers of schools debating in Germany. We are proud to host the 28th World Schools Debating Championship 2016 in Stuttgart Region for ten days from 19th-29th July. 

The World Schools Debating Championships (WSDC) were founded in 1988 as an international competition which brings together the most talented school-level debaters from across the globe. The championships provide young people from a wide range of countries and cultural backgrounds with an opportunity to meet and engage on a variety of topics. The tournament prides itself on testing the mettle of student debaters and promoting the values of free speech,  logical argumentation and intercultural understanding.


How will we invest your money?

For most national debating associations, the costs of travel and participation are significant to near impossibly high. The host always puts upon himself to rally enough funding to keep participation fees low, so that all talented highschool students who are chosen for representing their country as a national delegate can afford attendance.

As organisers, we would invest funding into meals, transportation, conference room rental fees, equipment (technology, documentation, certificates, handbook), general logistics, cultural events, travel bursaries for selected university student judges and other general event components. Most elements rise in costs fast, given the nature of expected 500 attendees. Your support helps us keep participation fees low and thus enables us to unite highschool students from across the globe.

Every member of the organising team works for free.

See our perks for great individual and corporate publicity! ------------------------->

Impact

Making WSDC 2016 happen has a domestic, as well as a global effect:

  • Help broaden this grassroot movement in Germany, an EFL (English as a foreign language) nation
  • Achieve more access for talented pupils to debating to achieve more skills for university and job market transition
  • Global outreach to a potential number of sixty nations to come together and engage in debating, the only true non-violent alternative to conflict solving and mutual understanding
  • WSDC as a movement grows with its reputation. We simply would like to be great hosts!

Experienced organization team

Accommodating 500 debating community members, most of them minors, for ten days comes with great responsibility. Our team consists of experienced staff who are very committed to live up to this challenge:

  • 16 years of experience with hosting international debating tournaments (annual 'EurOpen Schools Debating Championship Stuttgart')
  • Trained staff
  • Stuttgart is one of the safest major cities in Germany and Europe
  • High enough level of craziness for debating to never give up, shared by teachers and former debaters!

Other means of support

Even if you can't support us financially, you may know people in key positions in small and major businesses who might have an interest in WSDC in Stuttgart, and whom you could refer us to. Contact us at convenor@wsdcgermany2016.com 

We thank Indiegogo for this opportunity, we hope you can spread their word as well!
story_txt:
In brief The Debating Society Germany e.V. are the national non-profit representatives and organisers of schools debating in Germany. We are proud to host the 28th World Schools Debating Championship 2016 in Stuttgart Region for ten days from 19th-29th July. 

The World Schools Debating Championships (WSDC) were founded in 1988 as an international competition which brings together the most talented school-level debaters from across the globe. The championships provide young people from a wide range of countries and cultural backgrounds with an opportunity to meet and engage on a variety of topics. The tournament prides itself on testing the mettle of student debaters and promoting the values of free speech,  logical argumentation and intercultural understanding.
   How will we invest your money? For most national debating associations, the costs of travel and participation are significant to near impossibly high. The host always puts upon himself to rally enough funding to keep participation fees low, so that all talented highschool students who are chosen for representing their country as a national delegate can afford attendance.As organisers, we would invest funding into meals, transportation, conference room rental fees, equipment (technology, documentation, certificates, handbook), general logistics, cultural events, travel bursaries for selected university student judges and other general event components. Most elements rise in costs fast, given the nature of expected 500 attendees. Your support helps us keep participation fees low and thus enables us to unite highschool students from across the globe.
Every member of the organising team works for free.
See our perks for great individual and corporate publicity! ------------------------->
Impact
 Making WSDC 2016 happen has a domestic, as well as a global effect:


Help broaden this grassroot movement in Germany, an EFL (English as a foreign language) nation
Achieve more access for talented pupils to debating to
     achieve more skills for university and job market transition
Global outreach to a potential number of sixty nations to come together and engage in debating, the only true non-violent alternative to conflict solving and mutual understanding
WSDC as a movement grows with its reputation. We simply would like to be great hosts!


    Experienced organization team  Accommodating 500 debating community members, most of them minors, for ten days comes with great responsibility. Our team consists of experienced staff who are very committed to live up to this challenge:  16 years of experience with hosting international debating tournaments (annual 'EurOpen Schools Debating Championship Stuttgart')
Trained staff
Stuttgart is one of the safest major cities in Germany and Europe
High enough level of craziness for debating to never give up, shared by teachers and former debaters!    Other means of support Even if you can't support us financially, you may know people in key positions in small and major businesses who might have an interest in WSDC in Stuttgart, and whom you could refer us to. Contact us at convenor@wsdcgermany2016.com 
   We thank Indiegogo for this opportunity, we hope you can spread their word as well!

story:
Fusion Is Expanding!
Member Atomic Number Is Increasing! 
Critical Mass Approaching! 
We Need More Room!


Arch Reactor Is Moving

Welcome to Arch Reactor, the St. Louis community educational 501(c)(3) nonprofit hackerspace (sometimes also referred to as a makerspace). We are the oldest and largest organization of it's type in the St. Louis area. We specialize in collaborative learning, a DIY attitude, and inspiring interest in S.T.E.M. related fields (Science, Technology, Engineering, & Mathematics). Our focus is on education and teaching classes in electronics, programming, manufacturing, robotics, woodworking, and arts that are open to the general public.

http://archreactor.org

Unique Things We Do

  • Largest 3D printer meetup in the metro area.  Learn to make your own ANYTHING, including how to build a 3D printer.
  • Classes on robotics, home automation, security, and basic programming, based around the Arduino and Raspberry Pi open source platforms. 
  • Our members are regularly involved in the St. Louis community, such as at the First Friday Program at the St. Louis Science Center on the first Friday of each month.
  • A SPACE PROGRAM!  Launch weather balloons into high altitudes to capture amazing photos.  The Spirit of St. Louis is alive and well.
  • DIY Programs:  Learn to fix stuff or make your own furniture in our shop! Have you read about IKEA Hacks? You can hack IKEA furniture and items to your heart's content here.
  • Seen on Pinterest?  Make it at Arch Reactor!  The laser cutter, CNC machines, power tools, and the collective expertise of our membership help you get it done.
  • Do you have your own group get-together idea?  Need room for it? We’ve got it. Once we get moved into the new location, we will have over twice as much of it!


If These Walls Could Talk

We are currently in the process of relocating to a much larger building about one-and-a-half miles away, at 2215 Scott Avenue, St. Louis, Missouri. Where we will be breathing a new breath of educational maker life into an old building and local community.

This gem of a building at our new location has a rich history of being home to the Dixie Cream Donut Flour Company for several decades. The building has basically been used as storage for almost 20 years.  However, the expanse of the first floor interior is in need of a complete overhaul in order to be transformed into the new and updated Arch Reactor. Our members and supporters have been planning, procuring, cleaning, and doing everything we possibly can in order to complete this move project. In order to make such a large undertaking possible, we need your support too!



What Do We Need?

The short answer is nearly everything. The new location has an interior square footage that is more than twice the size of our current location, but right now it is a large rectangular box. This is where your help comes in. The needs of this new space start with the basics of interior electrical, plumbing, heating and cooling, framed interior walls, drywall, and paint. Helping fund our campaign will go towards meeting all of those needs. Every dollar donated to our build out is worth more than just a dollar, it's also a vote of confidence in our educational mission for our community.

We are requesting both monetary or material donations for the continued build out of the new location. We have a detailed itemized list of material needs that we can also share with you.  Since we are a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, any direct donations are tax deductible. We would also like to commemorate your generosity in a dedicated manner in the new space. Please see the list of fundraising perks to the right for more information.

The members of our educational non-profit organization have stepped forward with donations of their own personal funds (along with hundreds of hours of volunteered time) to cover the first two phases of the move to the new location. The continued funding of $9000 raised from the contributors to this campaign will go towards the third phase: making the space amazing and giving it infinite educational potential for the community. The money raised during this fundraiser by you will go directly towards dividing the interior with walls, adding insulation, installing the electrical elements, plumbing, heating and cooling, lighting, painting, and finishing the parking area of the new location.  Most of this work will be accomplished by the members themselves, saving the expense of paying anyone else to do the manual labor.


Planned New Layout - Over 5000 Square Feet


 

Current Layout - About 2400 Square Feet



You Are Invited to Come and Join Us!

Additionally, we are always looking for new members to join us!  Please check out our website: http://archreactor.org, if you are interested in any of the various things that we do.  If you are close to the St. Louis area, consider this an invitation to stop by and visit with us during our meeting times (Usually every Sunday and Tuesday evening. See our calendar on the website) and tell us what you want to learn or make. If you are not local, consider visiting our discussion boards, accessible through our website and leaving us a message about our move for us to read there.

Last of all, even if you can't contribute, please share the word about our campaign! Help us to make some noise on social media and around your workplace. Indiegogo's sharing tools are located right here on the top left of this page. You can also follow Arch Reactor on various social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+) and re-post our updates and announcements on those sites. 

Every little bit helps!

                 http://archreactor.org and http://archreactor.org/moving           

  

What Could Possibly Go Wrong?

This is one of our favorite taglines. It just fits so many things we do (Just ask how our telepresence robot got set on fire by a laser). We have already completed quite a lot of the work needed to get us up to this point in the moving process. Should our campaign not meet our goal we will still be moving, but at a slower pace and with major sacrifices. Our plans include moving into a modern, professional space that will truly be one of a kind. Without successfully completing our funding goals, compromises will have to be made to fit within a smaller budget. There may be less space, less equipment, less efficient fixtures, less education, and less we can do expanding our community for makers and hackers!

Please consider making a donation to benefit our move campaign today.


Sincerely,

The Membership of Arch Reactor

You can also find us on Social Media:
Twitter: https://twitter.com/archreactorstl

FaceBook: https://www.facebook.com/ArchReactor

Google +: https://plus.google.com/communities/115687168138444250946

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/archreactorstl/


Perk Images:

                                       
                                                   (Technetium Perk: Sticker)
                                   

                  (Promethium Perk Magnet)                        (Audrey Kissel Lafser)

                        

                          (Basic AR T-shirt)                            (Proposed Limited Edition T-shirt)

*Regarding Perks at the Curium, Einsteinium, Unobtainium levels that grant the contributor their name or logo laser cut or CNC engraved into an item:  Our expert Laser or CNC folks will work with you to Determine the Best possible layout For your Gear, Provide a Mock-up Image for your approval, and then Produce the Gear for the Wall of Gears Installation or Nameplate in Bamboo.

**Regarding the Perks at the Radium and Uranium Levels:  If more is collected at this level that we need for Wood Studs or Drywall sheets, then the extra will be applied to other areas of the construction project, such as electrical or plumbing.

*** Regarding the Perks for the VIP portion of the Grand Reopening Party. The date of the party for has not yet been set. The VIP Perks for this party may  include: A separate additional VIP party on another night and/or a designated VIP area. Free valet service for the party. A number(TBD) of free drinks (21 and up) for you and your guest(s) at the party. Uber: one ride to & one from the party from/to a single destination in the Greater St. Louis Area for you and your guest(s).

story:
Every child deserves an opportunity

Basic education like reading, writing, and math skills will unlock the world for children. It is the key to jobs and higher education, but also to the simple things we all take for granted like reading a book, searching Google, or writing a letter.

We have seen with our own eyes what future could await them if they don’t catch a break – and that is why we need you!

Some of the children in Santa Fe

A local school for the local children

When we were helping out right after the hurricane Haiyan in the poor area of Santa Fe near Tacloban, we asked what they would be needing the most when things got back to normal in time. They showed us the concrete foundation for an unfinished building and told us that it was supposed to be a school, but they didn’t have the resources to finish it. So right now, the volunteer teachers are not able to carry out proper lessons for the children.
So we decided to help them complete the school! The drawings are ready, the location is ready, the teachers and the locals who will manage the school are ready.

Are you? 


The building drawing of the school.

How can you help

We need a lot of help to complete this project – you can help by:

Making donations for materials and labor

EVERY donation – even the smallest one – gets us closer to our goal. We will even show you our appreciation by giving you a thank you gift (perk). Donate now by selecting your perk to the right!

Spreading the word

Actually you don’t even need to donate in order to help. If you just share the word, you’ll be helping us a lot! So please share this campaign on your social media – send your friends an e-mail or a letter! Spread the word if you have supported us!


Photos from the building of the school.

Questions and answers

Why $10,000?

We actually need $55,000 to complete the school. But we've already commenced building and collected the first $10,000 by other means. We're collecting the money in stages so the building can progress gradually. See photos of the progress in the gallery.

What if you collect more than $10,000?

We'll use all the money (except for fees to payment providers, Indiegogo and also for the perks) for building the school... Should we collect more than is needed we'll use them for e.g. furniture and school materials.

What did you do to collect the first $10,000?

We used out network, we created a run where all the proceeds went to the project.

Will you update me on the progress of the project?

Of course! At every stage as well as when the school is opened, we will send you status updates including photos and videos.

Have a question? Please ask it in the comments and we'll answer as soon as possible!

About HOPE Project

HOPE Project is a non-profit volunteer organization founded by a group of friends in Denmark, who wanted to help out after the hurricane Haiyan struck the Philippines in November 2013. Our local relief efforts in February 2014 showed how big a difference we made in the city of Santa Fe. Being from a country where education is free and mandatory we know how important education is and that is why we want to help the children of Santa Fe to a better future.

What we have done before

In 2014 – three months after the biggest typhoon in Philippine history struck the coast – we went to the Philippines to deliver the funds we had raised to provide roof over the heads of some of the families who lost their homes. We chose to go to Santa Fe right outside of Tacloban, which was the area that got hit the worst.


Choosing the right roofs, see more images in the gallery.


Video from our previous project, with music donated by Tim Schou / A Friend In London.

story:
Short Summary

Our mission with High Tide is to create unique opportunities for growth in today's adolescents through adventure and service experiences. Our goal is to do that through trips that will help broaden the perspective of life and the rest of the world for high school teens. The trips will include adventure and service learning components to help shape the teens into the best men and women they can be (personally and for their community).

Specifics:

  • We'll be encouraging high school teens to start asking themselves tough questions: Who am I? What are my interests? What do I want to contribute to the world? How do I get from here to there?
  • Technology-free... WHAT?! All of our trips will be designed to help teens get away from the isolation that social media can cause. This way, they can be 100% present during the trips and get the best possible experience. 
  • All of our trips will be focused on service-learning and adventure-learning. 
  • Each trip will involve a reflection component so the participants can figure out ways to take what they've done on the trip and apply it to their own communities and futures. 
  • A hands-on reorientation program where the participants take a step in applying themselves positively in their own communities after their trips. 

Other future goals include:

  • Incorporating counselor positions for college students where they apply to work as a trip leader. It will be a unique leadership and mentorship opportunity while making a huge impact on both adolescent and collegiate lives. 
  • Create custom trips for specific groups, classes, sports teams, etc. as well as plan trips that any individual between the ages of 13-18 in the United States can apply to participate on. 
  • Scholarship/Sponsorship programs to help fund an experience for a student(s). 

What We Need & What You Get

We're aiming to raise at least $5,000 with this campaign, but we want you to know exactly where it's going! Don't worry... we have some great perks for you too!

  • Before we can apply for grants or foundation donations to use for our trips, we need to have our IRS paperwork squared away. This money will help with that as well as government filing fees, web hosting, program materials, and so much more!
  • With each donation, you not only get us a step closer to bringing our dream to life and shaping the future of adolescents, but you get something cool in return:

With every $50 donation and up, you'll receive this custom designed High Tide tee! It's the perfect conversation starter to how you're changing the lives of adolescents.  Big thanks to Heavy Color for their awesome design and support of High Tide!
www.heavycolor.com

We're excited to be able to give you a sneak peek into Arise Coffee Co. They're putting a new meaning behind coffee by donating a percentage of their proceeds from monthly subscriptions to nonprofit organizations throughout the world. We're lucky enough to have creator, Matt Golley, on our team of board members, and he has so graciously donated a few bags of coffee for some lucky $100 High Tide supporters!
www.arisecoffeeco.com
With donations of $250 or more, we'll include you as a founder of the organization. After all, it's your generosity and support bringing Hide Tide to life.  
We're really excited about the $500 donation perk- designing a trip! If there's any way to truly understand what our mission is, it's by diving in and getting your hands dirty. You'll be able to work with the team on picking the location, the social issue it's focused on, and the adventure component that is involved. We'll even take it a step further and let you join us as a participant to see what your trip is like in person!
$1,000 or more, and you sponsor an experience for an individual teen on a future trip. Know that you're changing a life by opening a door to one of the most unique experiences they could ever have. 

The Impact

Think about your own life for a second. Would a unique service and adventure related opportunity, different from anything else you've ever experienced, have changed the way you look at the world? Maybe something like this actually did! Imagine the impact your $1 can have on what a high school teen chooses to do with the rest of his or her life. Pretty cool, huh?

Let's take this even one step further. Our participants will not only be volunteering to benefit communities throughout the globe, but they will also be developing a mindset and lifestyle change that keeps them actively serving their own communities for years to come. 

What better way to truly change a life than by opening doors, getting out of comfort zones, and taking a giant leap into what the world has to offer? 

How You Can Help 

Kid President, a personal favorite of ours, said, "Doing nothing is a great way to change nothing." 

We're asking you to take that step and do something. 

We understand that money can be hard to come by these days. If contributing financially is completely out of the question, you can still be a major part of High Tide! Here's how:

  • Share, Share, Share! Social media presence can be a huge thing... and it's FREE! Share the link to our campaign page with your friends and followers alike! The more who know, the better!
  • Write a letter to potential donors that you may have a personal relationship with. Simply explain what High Tide is, that you're supporting it, and ask them to support too. If you would like a draft letter, we're happy to send you one that you can also write a short message on! Contact us at info@hightideadventure.org to request a copy.
  • Do you have a blog or other way of mass communication? We would love for you to share our story!
Please know that your love, support, and interest in High Tide means more to us than we could ever explain. Should you have any additional questions about the organization or how you can be a part of it, please contact us at info@hightideadventure.org. 
-Bethany & Tucker Green
story_txt:
Short Summary Our mission with High Tide is to create unique opportunities for growth in today's adolescents through adventure and service experiences. Our goal is to do that through trips that will help broaden the perspective of life and the rest of the world for high school teens. The trips will include adventure and service learning components to help shape the teens into the best men and women they can be (personally and for their community).
Specifics:  We'll be encouraging high school teens to start asking themselves tough questions: Who am I? What are my interests? What do I want to contribute to the world? How do I get from here to there? Technology-free... WHAT?! All of our trips will be designed to help teens get away from the isolation that social media can cause. This way, they can be 100% present during the trips and get the best possible experience.  All of our trips will be focused on service-learning and adventure-learning. 
Each trip will involve a reflection component so the participants can figure out ways to take what they've done on the trip and apply it to their own communities and futures. 
A hands-on reorientation program where the participants take a step in applying themselves positively in their own communities after their trips.   Other future goals include:



Incorporating counselor positions for college students where they apply to work as a trip leader. It will be a unique leadership and mentorship opportunity while making a huge impact on both adolescent and collegiate lives. 

Create custom trips for specific groups, classes, sports teams, etc. as well as plan trips that any individual between the ages of 13-18 in the United States can apply to participate on. 
Scholarship/Sponsorship programs to help fund an experience for a student(s). 

   What We Need & What You Get We're aiming to raise at least $5,000 with this campaign, but we want you to know exactly where it's going! Don't worry... we have some great perks for you too!  Before we can apply for grants or foundation donations to use for our trips, we need to have our IRS paperwork squared away. This money will help with that as well as government filing fees, web hosting, program materials, and so much more! With each donation, you not only get us a step closer to bringing our dream to life and shaping the future of adolescents, but you get something cool in return:


With every $50 donation and up, you'll receive this custom designed High Tide tee! It's the perfect conversation starter to how you're changing the lives of adolescents.  Big thanks to Heavy Color for their awesome design and support of High Tide!www.heavycolor.com


We're excited to be able to give you a sneak peek into Arise Coffee Co. They're putting a new meaning behind coffee by donating a percentage of their proceeds from monthly subscriptions to nonprofit organizations throughout the world. We're lucky enough to have creator, Matt Golley, on our team of board members, and he has so graciously donated a few bags of coffee for some lucky $100 High Tide supporters!www.arisecoffeeco.com

With donations of $250 or more, we'll include you as a founder of the organization. After all, it's your generosity and support bringing Hide Tide to life.  

We're really excited about the $500 donation perk- designing a trip! If there's any way to truly understand what our mission is, it's by diving in and getting your hands dirty. You'll be able to work with the team on picking the location, the social issue it's focused on, and the adventure component that is involved. We'll even take it a step further and let you join us as a participant to see what your trip is like in person!

$1,000 or more, and you sponsor an experience for an individual teen on a future trip. Know that you're changing a life by opening a door to one of the most unique experiences they could ever have. 


   The Impact Think about your own life for a second. Would a unique service and adventure related opportunity, different from anything else you've ever experienced, have changed the way you look at the world? Maybe something like this actually did! Imagine the impact your $1 can have on what a high school teen chooses to do with the rest of his or her life. Pretty cool, huh?
Let's take this even one step further. Our participants will not only be volunteering to benefit communities throughout the globe, but they will also be developing a mindset and lifestyle change that keeps them actively serving their own communities for years to come. 
What better way to truly change a life than by opening doors, getting out of comfort zones, and taking a giant leap into what the world has to offer?    How You Can Help 
Kid President, a personal favorite of ours, said, "Doing nothing is a great way to change nothing." 
We're asking you to take that step and do something. 
We understand that money can be hard to come by these days. If contributing financially is completely out of the question, you can still be a major part of High Tide! Here's how:


Share, Share, Share! Social media presence can be a huge thing... and it's FREE! Share the link to our campaign page with your friends and followers alike! The more who know, the better!
Write a letter to potential donors that you may have a personal relationship with. Simply explain what High Tide is, that you're supporting it, and ask them to support too. If you would like a draft letter, we're happy to send you one that you can also write a short message on! Contact us at info@hightideadventure.org to request a copy.
Do you have a blog or other way of mass communication? We would love for you to share our story!

Please know that your love, support, and interest in High Tide means more to us than we could ever explain. Should you have any additional questions about the organization or how you can be a part of it, please contact us at info@hightideadventure.org. 
-Bethany & Tucker Green

story:
PandaDraw: The Amazing Drawing and Teaching Robot!

We want to make a fun, low-cost robot that will help parents and teachers teach important STEM concepts, that will engage kids and inspire both creativity and analytical skillsets, and that will allow artists to grow their followings (and make $$)! 

PandaDraw is currently only on IndieGogo!

 _______________________________________________________________________

Who can use PandaDraw?

Anyone!

TEACHERS: Wouldn't you love a hands-on, interactive, engaging system with which to help explain basic math concepts like geometry, trigonometry, cartesian coordinates, etc? Or even more advanced concepts like calculus, automation, robotics, and 3D printing? What if you could send students cherry-picked problems that are specifically tailored to their personal weaknesses... at any time of day?

PARENTS: 3D printing and automation are revolutionizing the way the world works, so give your kids a head start in the world of STEM! Would you like a fun, easy way to introduce your kids to 3D printing or teach them valuable STEM concepts? Using our robotic xy platform, kids become quickly fascinated with the power of printing and robotics. You can dock any existing pen/marker/pencil/puffy pen directly on to the Panda, upload your drawing, and watch it create unique art. Or, work with your kid to learn new STEM skillsets using the educational package! 

Our future products will build upon the skills they've learned from PandaDraw and introduce a third axis of automation, as a gateway into the fascinating (and lucrative) world of 3D!

ARTISTS: We will initiate challenges to engage our artist community, feature some of the great art work on our blog/twitter/instagram/facebook, and even offer the chance to sell your art (printed on coasters, bags, canvas, coffee mugs, etc). You could earn $$ with your artwork by selling it-- how cool is that!?


KIDS: Ever wished you were a brilliant, talented artist?  Our adorable, incredible PandaDraw will connect to the cloud so you can download and draw beautiful, perfect images of anything you want -- abstract art like that shown below (we will even provide many for you!), your portrait, your pet, pictures you've uploaded, etc!

 ___________________________________________________________________________                     

< Draw with the power of code! Educational fun you will love! > "Educational fun you'll love!"  

 _________________________________________________________________________

A better way to learn with the educational package!

The more users there are, the more interactive and bigger the PandaDraw STEM library will be! Users can add to the library their own cool problems for others to solve.

Teach basic math concepts as well as advanced STEM! 



One example of basic geometry: Students learn the relationships between geometric shapes in 2D and 3D. PandaDraw prints out the 2D shapes, and your child can configure the 3D shapes and experiment with the geometries.



Example of basic coordinate graphing. The educational package will teach your child/student very important math fundamentals!




Care to calculate the area of the orange feathers? Or integrate this quarter circle? PandaDraw can even do these problems of higher complexity!

___________________________________________________

A better way to draw!

 What will you be drawing with PandaDraw?

         

  



The more users there are, the more interactive, fun, and robust the PandaDraw art community will be!

We can't wait to see your artwork! PandaDraw will host challenges to engage the artist community. We'll feature great art work on our blog, and even offer the chance to see your art on physical objects (coasters, bags, coffee mugs, etc.). You could also earn $$ from your artwork from prizes on Sinter3D, which is totally cool!

___________________________________________________________________________
PandaDraw will feature iOS and Android applications that could make anyone an amazing artist! You'll be able to share and print directly from our free app!  

                                                      

PandaDraw IndieGoGo

      Powered by arduino !


PandaDraw will be built from computer parts and open hardware.  We will also make our app compatible with more devices to help make PandaDraw as convenient as possible.     

Upload images in the required file format, and you'll be on your way. 

Even if you don't have a PandaDraw, you can draw your own creations by hand, scan them in, and send them to friends with one of the amazing PandaDraw art bots!


 ___________________________________________________________________________

Support PandaDraw with Panda Perks!

                                                                                               
Make PandaDraw Even More Incredible! 
$7,500 from Indiegogo will help us obtain the parts we need to finish our PandaDraw prototypes and make an impact on the future of education and art. We'll be able to create form-fit parts, 3D-print the shell with a protective finish, and make our pen holder durable and lightweight. After our fundraising is complete, we'll be ready to ship pre-orders between March and July of 2016. 
This campaign will also help us keep this product awesome and low-cost so we can share our product with you at launch next year. We know you'll appreciate a product built with quality and care, so we are turning to the crowd-funding site Indiegogo to help with resources needed to make an awesome product (that will work with the IoT and arduino).    
Pre-order your PandaDraw for just $200.00 on IndieGoGo!  

___________________________________________________


PandaDraw Challenges and Benchmarks

PandaDraw needs support from crowd-funding sites like IndieGoGo to make enough of the devices and to make them as high quality as we can.  With your help, we can hone motion control, develop the apps needed to control the robot, reduce cost, and begin manufacturing!  

We will 3D print and finish Panda's parts and motion control platform.  Help us obtain the tools and we need to finish and assemble our exciting, one-of-a-kind panda parts for these adorable PandaDraw robots you'll love!

                                                  

                                        ____________________________________________________________________________

Please share with your friends, families, classmates, and teachers! Follow our progress on PandaDraw, only available on Indiegogo! 

Thank you for your support!

_____________________________________________________________________________

                                                  Twitter.com/pandadrawings

story:
Who We Are:

  • CDA Climbing School was established early 2018 in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.
  • We are in the process of acquiring permitting and licensing to host the school at Q'emiln City Park in Post Falls, Idaho. We have been working closely with the City of Post Falls Parks department and have their blessing to pursue this project. We are currently most of the way through the permitting process and don't anticipate any hangups.
  • CDA Climbing School exists to serve our local recreational community and beyond.
  • The aim of CDA Climbing School is to give the local community the knowledge and know-how in order to use the appropriate techniques while minimizing risk in the outdoors.
  • CDA Climbing School is not intended to be a guiding service.
  • Our practices are based on years of experience and modeled after safety standards set forth by the AMGA (American Mountain Guides Association) and PCIA (Professional Climbing Instructors Association).

Our Vision

  • The bulk of the business end of CDA Climbing School will be operating our Summer Youth Program which will run from June 11, 2018 to August 30th, 2018 at Q'emilin City Park in Post Falls, Idaho. The day camp will operate Monday - Thursday, 9am - 5pm and is open to climbers 11-17 years of age. The main idea with the Summer Day Camp format is that kids get an outdoor education as well as climbing instruction.
  • Adult programming is also available and will run from the time we receive our permits until the weather makes a turn towards winter likely around October. Cold weather climbing clinics may become available based on interest and demand. Adult clinics are short (3 hours) and to the point. During times when our Youth Programming is running adult clinics will be available from 5:30pm - 8:30pm Monday - Thursday, and open for various times during the weekend. Recommended ages for adult clinics are 16+.
  • Curriculum is broken down into 5 subjects: Belaying, Anchors, Rappelling, Technical Rescue, and Climbing Movement and Technique.
  • Custom clinics such as lead climbing (leading a climb from the ground up and clipping permanent protection as you climb) and trad climbing (traditional climbing where you place removable protection as you climb) are also available upon meeting certain prerequisites and assessments based on our 5 core curriculum subjects.
  • If we receive enough demand a Climbing with Kids (10 and under) clinic will become available.
  • In the future, we hope to expand to more of the surrounding area as things develop to include multi-pitch climbing instruction.

What We Need & What You Get

  • CDA Climbing School is currently being funded solely out of pocket by the founder. We are using Indiegogo as a tool to judge interest in the climbing school as well as raising additional funding to make the school as beneficial as it can be to the community.
  • If we hit $1,000 climbing shoes will be available free of charge for our clinics.
  • If we hit $2,000 a "Community Climbs with Us" free day will be hosted.
  • If we hit $4,000 two "Community Climbs with Us" free days will be hosted.
  • If we hit $6,000 a seasonal shop dedicated to all things climbing will be opened locally.
  • If we hit $8,000 a sizable climbing shoe rental fleet will be purchased and made available to the public.
  • If we hit $10,000 we will begin the process of expanding our programming into the surrounding areas of Idaho.
  • If we hit $12,000 a seasonal climbing shop dedicated to climbing will be opened during warm months as well as a used winter gear trade open in the colder months.
  • Each benefit is accumulative to the next.

The Impact

  • We strongly believe rock climbing is beneficial physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually.
  • Empower our community to conquer fears and develop that "CAN DO" attitude.
  • Help educate the community about preserving our recreational resources for future generations.

Risk Management

  • Rock Climbing is an inherently dangerous sport. We can minimize the risk with proper education and training, and those skills can be passed around by a tight knit community.
  • Lead instructors are at a minimum fully certified Single Pitch Instructors through either the AMGA or PCIA.
  • Assistant Instructors have learned all of the required curriculum, but are not yet certified.
  • All necessary safety equipment will be provided by CDA Climbing School.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We understand if you can't make a financial contribution at the moment. Please help by spreading the word about CDA Climbing School and ask about getting involved with us and the local community at CDACLIMBINGSCHOOL.COM or CDACLIMBINGSCHOOL@GMAIL.COM.

Who We Are:

CDA Climbing School was established early 2018 in Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.
We are in the process of acquiring permitting and licensing to host the school at Q'emiln City Park in Post Falls, Idaho. We have been working closely with the City of Post Falls Parks department and have their blessing to pursue this project. We are currently most of the way through the permitting process and don't anticipate any hangups.
CDA Climbing School exists to serve our local recreational community and beyond.
The aim of CDA Climbing School is to give the local community the knowledge and know-how in order to use the appropriate techniques while minimizing risk in the outdoors.
CDA Climbing School is not intended to be a guiding service.
Our practices are based on years of experience and modeled after safety standards set forth by the AMGA (American Mountain Guides Association) and PCIA (Professional Climbing Instructors Association).


Our Vision

The bulk of the business end of CDA Climbing School will be operating our Summer Youth Program which will run from June 11, 2018 to August 30th, 2018 at Q'emilin City Park in Post Falls, Idaho. The day camp will operate Monday - Thursday, 9am - 5pm and is open to climbers 11-17 years of age. The main idea with the Summer Day Camp format is that kids get an outdoor education as well as climbing instruction.
Adult programming is also available and will run from the time we receive our permits until the weather makes a turn towards winter likely around October. Cold weather climbing clinics may become available based on interest and demand. Adult clinics are short (3 hours) and to the point. During times when our Youth Programming is running adult clinics will be available from 5:30pm - 8:30pm Monday - Thursday, and open for various times during the weekend. Recommended ages for adult clinics are 16+.
Curriculum is broken down into 5 subjects: Belaying, Anchors, Rappelling, Technical Rescue, and Climbing Movement and Technique.
Custom clinics such as lead climbing (leading a climb from the ground up and clipping permanent protection as you climb) and trad climbing (traditional climbing where you place removable protection as you climb) are also available upon meeting certain prerequisites and assessments based on our 5 core curriculum subjects.
If we receive enough demand a Climbing with Kids (10 and under) clinic will become available.

What We Need & What You Get

If we hit $10,000 we will begin the process of expanding our programming into the surrounding areas of Idaho.
If we hit $12,000 a seasonal climbing shop dedicated to climbing will be opened during warm months as well as a used winter gear trade open in the colder months.
Each benefit is accumulative to the next.


The Impact

We strongly believe rock climbing is beneficial physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually.
Empower our community to conquer fears and develop that "CAN DO" attitude.
Help educate the community about preserving our recreational resources for future generations.


Risk Management

Rock Climbing is an inherently dangerous sport. We can minimize the risk with proper education and training, and those skills can be passed around by a tight knit community.
Lead instructors are at a minimum fully certified Single Pitch Instructors through either the AMGA or PCIA.
Assistant Instructors have learned all of the required curriculum, but are not yet certified.
All necessary safety equipment will be provided by CDA Climbing School.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand if you can't make a financial contribution at the moment. Please help by spreading the word about CDA Climbing School and ask about getting involved with us and the local community at CDACLIMBINGSCHOOL.COM or CDACLIMBINGSCHOOL@GMAIL.COM.

story:
The Learn Or Teach Spiel

My name is Clever Mukori and yes, my folks are still trying to figure out the distinction between an adjective and a noun, love 'em though! I was born in Zimbabwe and consider myself very fortunate for divine providence and parents that had the means to afford me a top tier education. At present, i'm a Chemistry & Biology graduate of Concordia College in Moorhead, MN, an institution that not only deserves credit for my recent medical school admission, but for teaching me to Be Responsibly Engaged in the World (BREW).

Through study, research, and my experiences living in Africa and now the United States, I've become deeply aware of the unique educational challenges that various communities worldwide are facing and have founded Learn Or Teach to address these. 

Learn Or Teach is a Cross-disciplinary online learning platform that provides FREE learning content on Anything, Anytime, and Anywhere. In addition, we provide ratings based compensation to our content contributors, who can be anyone but typically range from college education majors to primary/secondary education teachers, professors, and tradesmen/women.

With respect to addressing barriers to educational access, not only do we provide our content completely and eternally free, we establish physical learning centers in needy communities. This we do by forming public and private partnerships with primarily local institutions and leveraging existing systems such as libraries or schools and providing technological resources that students can use to access our content.

 

In addition, we are partnering with Facebook on their Free Basics platform, which is a limited free version of the internet available through mobile connectivity in about 50 developing countries presently. By submitting our website to their platform, we will be able to reach millions of the world’s neediest learners, from tender first graders to small business farming women eager to learn new marketing and production skills.

 Learn Or Teach generates revenue through advertising, charitable donations and SAAS products such as Learning Management System Services and workforce training services. The unique combination of our content acquisition, access facilitation, and revenue generation strategies set apart Learn Or Teach as an industry leading education services company.

 

What We Need

We divided our project into two phases, each of which will take 6 months to develop. We are scheduled to start Phase 1 development in June of 2018 and reach completion by the end of December 2018. Phase 1 will be launched in January of 2019. The second phase will begin in June of 2019 and end in December of 2019. Phase 2 will launch in January of 2020. Our fundraising goal is our total yearly budget for all costs associated with developing, launching the first phase, and operating until June 2019. The breakdown is as follows:

 

  • Software Development - $45,000
  • Marketing - $5,000
  • Legal Proceedings - $2,000
  • Miscellaneous - $18,000 ( cloud services, operational, technical services etc)

If the campaign does not succeed as expected, we will seek V.C. investment and combine the campaign funds with future investment dollars.

Learn Or Teach is a product for and by the people, so it is up to us the people to spread the word far and wide to everyone who will lend and ear. Please back us, follow us on facebook, twitter, instagram, linkedin, and snapchat, and share our campaign on these platforms and via email! Let is spread like a fire! 

 

Our gift to you

We are absolutely thrilled to inform you about our unique and fashionable perks which are outlined below. We would like to emphasize that each campaign backer will have a broad choice of offerings, will reserve the right to accept or deny their perk, and will receive their perk regardless of how the campaign turns out. Needless to mention, each backer can give any dollar amount they would like.

  • $20-34 contribution - Your choice of 2 Learn Or Teach wristbands & a Keychain
  • $35-49 contribution - A Learn Or Teach notepad + earphones
  • $50-99 contribution - A premium Learn Or Teach Coffee Mug + stress ball
  • $100-149 contribution - Your choice of a t-shit & tote/drawstring bag
  • $150-499 contribution -  Your choice of a Learn Or Teach baseball cap & hoodie
  • $500 + contribution - Your choice of a premium Learn Or Teach watch

Here are a few samples, available to order in White, Blue, Black, and Grey

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the main risks that we face during development and after launching include the following:

i.) Receiving a below par product from the development team we are contracted with

Response:  We are contracted through a free-lancing company that performs vetting services of the free lancers who are on the platform and gives extensive reviews about their prior work including examples of projects they have worked on. Learn Or Teach has in the past few months, narrowed down a detailed and legally binding proposal including detailed and quoted specifications. The developer will  be compensated on a hourly basis, with lump-some weekly  payments that can be halted in the event of any concerns.

ii.) Running out of funds before completing development or before our one year budget time

Response:  As stated in the point above, Learn Or Teach has in the past few months, narrowed down a detailed and legally binding proposal including detailed and quoted specifications. The developer cannot change the costs of the project midway and we will not begin before raising the necessary funds for development. As for operational costs, in the event that we fall short, we will pursue V.C. funding, loan options, and continue to contribute personal funds

iii.) Failing to find content contributors

Response: We have already begun signup and reviewing potential content contributors, who are already under review. We will continue with this process, advertising also to increase brand awareness   

iv.) Failing to raise funds for phase two.

Response: We have chosen specifications for Phase 1 that are advanced enough to allow us to operate for an extended period before having to add any other features. This also includes revenue generating features such as advertisement, learning management system services, and charitable donations. We are very confident that the revenue streams will be successful, however, in the event that they do not turn out as well as expected, we will again rely on seeking investor funding, loans, and personal funds to be able to implement Phase 2.

 

Still have additional questions? Click here to watch answers to some FAQ's.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Unable to give us a monetary contribution at this time? Hakuna Matata! Here is how else to help:

 

 

  • Spread the word far and wide! Use Indiegogo sharing tools, share on all social media platforms!!
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin, and Snapchat!!
  • Subscribe to our email list on the Learn Or Teach Website
  • Share our campaign with your email contacts, export them on Linkedin and email them directly to share the good news of Learn Or Teach, they will appreciate it!

 

Still have additional questions? Click here to watch answers to some FAQ's.
story_txt:
The Learn Or Teach Spiel
My name is Clever Mukori and yes, my folks are still trying to figure out the distinction between an adjective and a noun, love 'em though! I was born in Zimbabwe and consider myself very fortunate for divine providence and parents that had the means to afford me a top tier education. At present, i'm a Chemistry & Biology graduate of Concordia College in Moorhead, MN, an institution that not only deserves credit for my recent medical school admission, but for teaching me to Be Responsibly Engaged in the World (BREW).
Through study, research, and my experiences living in Africa and now the United States, I've become deeply aware of the unique educational challenges that various communities worldwide are facing and have founded Learn Or Teach to address these. 

Learn Or Teach is a Cross-disciplinary online learning platform that provides FREE learning content on Anything, Anytime, and Anywhere. In addition, we provide ratings based compensation to our content contributors, who can be anyone but typically range from college education majors to primary/secondary education teachers, professors, and tradesmen/women.
With respect to addressing barriers to educational access, not only do we provide our content completely and eternally free, we establish physical learning centers in needy communities. This we do by forming public and private partnerships with primarily local institutions and leveraging existing systems such as libraries or schools and providing technological resources that students can use to access our content.

 
In addition, we are partnering with Facebook on their Free Basics platform, which is a limited free version of the internet available through mobile connectivity in about 50 developing countries presently. By submitting our website to their platform, we will be able to reach millions of the world’s neediest learners, from tender first graders to small business farming women eager to learn new marketing and production skills.
 Learn Or Teach generates revenue through advertising, charitable donations and SAAS products such as Learning Management System Services and workforce training services. The unique combination of our content acquisition, access facilitation, and revenue generation strategies set apart Learn Or Teach as an industry leading education services company.
 
What We Need 

We divided our project into two phases, each of which will take 6 months to develop. We are scheduled to start Phase 1 development in June of 2018 and reach completion by the end of December 2018. Phase 1 will be launched in January of 2019. The second phase will begin in June of 2019 and end in December of 2019. Phase 2 will launch in January of 2020. Our fundraising goal is our total yearly budget for all costs associated with developing, launching the first phase, and operating until June 2019. The breakdown is as follows:
 


Software Development - $45,000
Marketing - $5,000
Legal Proceedings - $2,000
Miscellaneous - $18,000 ( cloud services, operational, technical services etc)

If the campaign does not succeed as expected, we will seek V.C. investment and combine the campaign funds with future investment dollars.
Learn Or Teach is a product for and by the people, so it is up to us the people to spread the word far and wide to everyone who will lend and ear. Please back us, follow us on facebook, twitter, instagram, linkedin, and snapchat, and share our campaign on these platforms and via email! Let is spread like a fire! 
 
Our gift to you
We are absolutely thrilled to inform you about our unique and fashionable perks which are outlined below. We would like to emphasize that each campaign backer will have a broad choice of offerings, will reserve the right to accept or deny their perk, and will receive their perk regardless of how the campaign turns out. Needless to mention, each backer can give any dollar amount they would like.

$20-34 contribution - Your choice of 2 Learn Or Teach wristbands & a Keychain
$35-49 contribution - A Learn Or Teach notepad + earphones
$50-99 contribution - A premium Learn Or Teach Coffee Mug + stress ball
$100-149 contribution - Your choice of a t-shit & tote/drawstring bag
$150-499 contribution -  Your choice of a Learn Or Teach baseball cap & hoodie
$500 + contribution - Your choice of a premium Learn Or Teach watch

Here are a few samples, available to order in White, Blue, Black, and Grey


 
 
Risks & Challenges
Some of the main risks that we face during development and after launching include the following:
i.) Receiving a below par product from the development team we are contracted with
Response:  We are contracted through a free-lancing company that performs vetting services of the free lancers who are on the platform and gives extensive reviews about their prior work including examples of projects they have worked on. Learn Or Teach has in the past few months, narrowed down a detailed and legally binding proposal including detailed and quoted specifications. The developer will  be compensated on a hourly basis, with lump-some weekly  payments that can be halted in the event of any concerns.
ii.) Running out of funds before completing development or before our one year budget time
Response:  As stated in the point above, Learn Or Teach has in the past few months, narrowed down a detailed and legally binding proposal including detailed and quoted specifications. The developer cannot change the costs of the project midway and we will not begin before raising the necessary funds for development. As for operational costs, in the event that we fall short, we will pursue V.C. funding, loan options, and continue to contribute personal funds
iii.) Failing to find content contributors
Response: We have already begun signup and reviewing potential content contributors, who are already under review. We will continue with this process, advertising also to increase brand awareness   
iv.) Failing to raise funds for phase two.
Response: We have chosen specifications for Phase 1 that are advanced enough to allow us to operate for an extended period before having to add any other features. This also includes revenue generating features such as advertisement, learning management system services, and charitable donations. We are very confident that the revenue streams will be successful, however, in the event that they do not turn out as well as expected, we will again rely on seeking investor funding, loans, and personal funds to be able to implement Phase 2.
 
Still have additional questions? Click here to watch answers to some FAQ's.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Unable to give us a monetary contribution at this time? Hakuna Matata! Here is how else to help:
 

 

Spread the word far and wide! Use Indiegogo sharing tools, share on all social media platforms!!
Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin, and Snapchat!!
Subscribe to our email list on the Learn Or Teach Website
Share our campaign with your email contacts, export them on Linkedin and email them directly to share the good news of Learn Or Teach, they will appreciate it!

 
Still have additional questions? Click here to watch answers to some FAQ's.

story:
GRIT

Grit is a business mentorship organization that helps entrepreneurs in developing countries achieve success, where access to education, business training, and funding for growth is limited. 

Our passion is to show driven but struggling entrepreneurs that they CAN achieve their business goals, even if they are outside the realm of what they imagine to be possible. 

We are starting our business mentorship program in Uganda, and then expanding to developing countries around the world. 

 

OUR GOAL

The capital we raise through our Indiegogo campaign will be used for 2 things:

1. To fund our "Pilot Project" 

In February 2019, we are going back to Uganda to test our business model. We will bring 2 mentors will us, and work with 3 of the entrepreneurs we met with while on our research trip in July 2018.

Over the course of 3 weeks, we will learn about their goals and challenges, provide business training, adjust their business models, and start to implement the strategies developed to get them on a path towards achieving their business goals. 

Our pilot project is fundamental to the success of our social venture. Through testing our business model and generating success stories, we will gain credibility for when we return and start seeking corporate sponsorship to fuel our organization.

2. To pay for 2 salaries in Uganda

To get operations started, we plan to hire a "community business officer" and a "finance officer" on the ground.

 

THE PROBLEM

UNEQUAL OPPORTUNITIES. 

Hardworking, passionate entrepreneurs with innovative ideas and big aspirations for their businesses are obstructed from achieving their goals. The challenging environment and lack of opportunities in many developing countries prevents ambitious entrepreneurs from reaching their potential and creating the life they envisioned. 

While on my research trip in Uganda, I met with countless entrepreneurs who had, against great odds, tackled the first set of challenges that come with starting a business. However, after surpassing these hurdles and making it a few years into operation, they have come to a standstill and are struggling to create sustainable business models that earn profit. 

This is not due to a bad idea, or a lack of focus or determination – but instead, a lack of readily available resources to help them achieve success.

 

THE OPPORTUNITY

Us. 

With the experience many of us have gained through obtaining specialized training or a college/university degree, working in a professional field, or running our own business, we have gained valuable knowledge and skillsets that others have not the the opportunity to. ​

The great thing about experience, is that it can be shared.

 

 

HOW IT WORKS

MENTORSHIP

GRIT matches entrepreneurs with mentors (you) to work side by side while developing and implementing a business plan. The purpose of providing this type of hands on training is to create a sustainable, knowledge-transfer mentorship model where, once the mentor leaves, the entrepreneur feels confident in their ability to successfully operate their business on their own. 

 

 

TYPES OF MENTORSHIP

 

 

Holistic Mentors choose 1 or 2 entrepreneurs, travel to their destination, and work side by side (for 2 - 4 weeks) to help them create a sustainable business model. Together they start to implement the strategies developed. The mentor provides the entrepreneur will all necessary training to ensure their success of their business. 

Specialized Mentors choose 1 area of focus they want to mentor in (eg. marketing, accounting, operations, finance), and a specific town/region that interests them. They then travel to that location, and depending on how long they’re able to stay, are partnered with between 10-20 entrepreneurs. They provide training in the field they have chosen to each entrepreneur on an individual basis for 2-3 days. 

Industry Mentors choose an industry they have experience in and are put in an online group of 5-6 other mentors who have experience in the same industry. The online group will collectively provide advice from the comfort of their own home to mentors/business community officers working on the ground. 

 

MICROFINANCING

GRIT will also offer two microfinancing services for entrepreneurs, so they can access loans, if needed, to implement the strategies developed during the “mentorship” phase.  

Loans are provided through:

1. Our independently run “SACCO” (savings and credit cooperative organization based in Uganda), which provides an incentive for entrepreneurs to start saving, and an easy way of acquiring small loans. 

2. Our Crowdfunding platform to maximize the amount of loans we can provide to our entrepreneurs.

 

THE CROWDFUNDING PLATFORM

Entrepreneurs who are eligible to be placed on the crowdfunding platform will have their profile included on the “Lend” page, which is geared towards lenders and donors. This profile will include a business overview as well as a summary of the specific costs necessary to reach their next goal, and a “loan details” section.

100% of the money loaned or donated will go to the entrepreneurs, and at a 0% interest rate. 

This provides people who want to help these driven entrepreneurs but aren’t in the position to take time off work or travel, with the ability to show their support and make a real difference from their own home.

 

MENTOR PAGE

 

EXPLORE PAGE

 

ENTREPRENEUR'S PROFILE 

 

MICROFINANCING PLATFORM - ENTREPRENEUR'S PROFILE

 

THE RESEARCH TRIP

In July 2017, I travelled to Uganda (with my mentor, my dad) to better understand the goals and challenges of entrepreneurs, and to determine if there is a low risk way of providing a micro financing service. 

Through some amazing connections I made before the trip, we were welcomed by the most dedicated, hard-working, passionate team who helped us at every step along the way. 

 

 

Together, we interviewed countless entrepreneurs, I met with two different mayors, several town counsellors, several banking institutions, and I was able to do some advocacy work and speak in front of a group of 80 entrepreneurs from the community.  

 

 

The entrepreneurs of our "Pilot Project"

 

Aziz

Aziz started Bugembe Tailoring Machines 12 years ago. He provides made-to-order clothing and alteration services, and has a team of 3 tailors working for him. As his passion lies in design, Aziz's primary goal is to create his own Ugandan fashion label and attract customers from all over Uganda.  

 

Monica

Monica is a go-getter; she has a Master's degree in Development Studies and started her own primary school in Kitgum 2 years ago. However, these days she is focusing most of her energy on her mushroom business, which she has big aspirations for. Monica has been successful in selling mushrooms to the local market for the past 3 years, and is working towards her next step of opening up a "one-stop-mushroom-shop" that doubles as a restaurant. She also plans to export dried mushrooms internationally. 

 

James

 James started his own welding business, Maganda Welders, in Bugembe 3 years ago. He operates primarily in the residential market, creating items such as windows, doors, beds, gates, and wheelbarrows. He has 5 employees working for him, and is saving to buy more equipment and relocate to a larger space. His goals are to expand, offer a better service to customers, and become one of the biggest competitors in the area. 

 

The pilot project is fundamental for the success of our business mentorship organisation. 

Help us bring this pilot project to life, so together we can help entrepreneur's achieve success in places where the opportunities we have had aren't present. Help us turn their dreams into reality. 

 

MORE QUESTIONS?

Check out our "Q&A" video under the main one at the top of our campaign!

We also have a temporary website up: https://www.gritbm.com 

 

REWARDS

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The biggest challenge of the pilot project will be raising enough to make it happen and bring a team to Uganda with me. 

As I have spent time in both Bugembe and Gulu on my research trip (the two towns/cities we will be going back to), I have become familiar with the areas and have formed relationships with important stakeholders (friends/team to assist us, town council and various mayors/officers, and the entrepreneurs we will be working with). 

I will take our two mentors through a pre-departure business and culture acclimatization brief, and explain the process of how everything will work as soon as we land on the ground. They will meet part of our team, and be introduced to the entrepreneurs each of them will be working with. The entrepreneurs were extremely welcoming and excited the first time I met them, and were willing to take over an hour out of each of their days to talk with me and walk me through their businesses. This being said, communication may pose a challenge at first - as we have different accents and speak at different paces - but after spending time with each other, these barriers will fall to the side. As I mentioned, I also have a dedicated, passionate team on the ground there who are happy to attend meetings and assist in any way possible.
