story:
Program Overview

Project iSWEST (Innovating Solutions with Engineering, Science and Technology) is an annual summer program in Ghana organized by Nsesa Foundation, a Ghanaian non-profit. Its primary aim is to get high school students solving problems by inspiring them to be creative, equipping them with the requisite tools, soft and hard – basic science, engineering and technology (SET) – skills, while coaching them to develop innovative solutions to problems in their communities.


Project iSWEST 2015 is a solution-focused, 3-week workshop for 30 high school students in Ghana. It is our goal to attract at least 15 girls to this workshop in line with our mission of getting more women into STEM. The 30 participants will form 6 teams each consisting of 5 members to work on their respective projects. Each group will use either programming, electronics or both - embedded systems - to work on a project from any of these 5 categories:

  • Agriculture

  • E-commerce

  • Education

  • Energy

  • Transportation

Each group will receive active coaching through the innovation process - problem identification, solution building, prototyping, business plan development and project deployment.

Impact

Our vision is to create an "Innovation Revolution" in Ghana, a state in which the youth across the length and breadth of the country are developing innovative solutions to problems in their communities using Science, Engineering & Technology (SET). At the core of Project iSWEST is our desire to inspire the youth of Ghana to believe that they have the capacity to be innovative as well as to empower them to develop solutions to the problems within their communities.


Project iSWEST 2014

We ran a successful program last year. One of the highlights of Project iSWEST 2014 was when the participants together with their facilitators assembled and programmed this robot "HEADtron" (on the Arduino Uno microcontroller) which turns 180 degrees and runs away when it detects an obstacle within a certain distance.

For more information about last year's program, check below:

http://newsghana.com.gh/nsesa-foundation-ends-project-iswest/
http://www.ists.dartmouth.edu/news/boateng.html
http://engineering.dartmouth.edu/magazine/service-to-society-spreading-engs-21-1/


Stories of Project iSWEST Alumni

Our alumni have already began making impact in Ghana. For more info, check below:

http://www.nsesafoundation.org/meet-princess-allotey/
http://www.nsesafoundation.org/keziah-narkwor-george/
http://leversinheels.tumblr.com/post/115675895417/innovation-in-stem-keziah-george
http://www.myjcr.com/news/ucc/1859-myjcr-ucc-team-member-among-top-30-young-ghanaian-achievers
http://www.nsesafoundation.org/meet-eric-vondee/


The Team (Team Nsesa)

We are a highly motivated group of young Ghanaians studying both in the U.S. and Ghana, who are passionate about changing the status quo. Below are our team members:

George Boateng, Dartmouth College (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science)

John Kotey, Columbia University (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science)

Isaac Sesi, KNUST - Ghana (Electrical Engineering)

Anne-Marie Abeasi, KNUST - Ghana (Electrical Engineering)

Keziah George, University of Ghana (Materials Science and Engineering)

Princess Allotey, University of Ghana (Actuarial Science)

Peter O’Hara, KNUST - Ghana (Computer Science)

Victor Kumbol, KNUST - Ghana (Pharmacy)

Maurice Gorleku, University of Cape Coast (Medicine)


Additional Info

Checkout out our website: http://www.nsesafoundation.org/project-iswest/ and Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/project.iSWEST for more information about Project iSWEST 2015.

Below are our team members:George Boateng, Dartmouth College (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science)John Kotey, Columbia University (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science)Isaac Sesi, KNUST - Ghana (Electrical Engineering)Anne-Marie Abeasi, KNUST - Ghana (Electrical Engineering)Keziah George, University of Ghana (Materials Science and Engineering)Princess Allotey, University of Ghana (Actuarial Science)Peter O’Hara, KNUST - Ghana (Computer Science)Victor Kumbol, KNUST - Ghana (Pharmacy)Maurice Gorleku, University of Cape Coast (Medicine)Additional InfoCheckout out our website: http://www.nsesafoundation.org/project-iswest/ and Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/project.iSWEST for more information about Project iSWEST 2015.

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT

  We have completed first stage of fundraising with campaign on Kickstarter where 498 backers pledged $44,736 for new Head & Neck Anatomy book project. 

   Based on requests I decided to extend the campaign little longer and open opportunity for more people to join the project. 

  As artists ourselves we know there is a need for more in-depth reference of the human head regarding age, ethnicities, and emotions. Sometimes a 2D image alone is just not enough. When painting, sculpting, or creating digital models, artists often struggle with understanding flat images using poorly explained reference books and anatomically incorrect digital files, tools, and assets that are overflowing the Internet.

  With our second book we are redefining the human head, often the most difficult area of human anatomy to understand. This time we are taking it a step further by bringing this imagery to you in full 3D. By connecting the images in our new book to the Augmented Reality smartphone app, you will have access to precise 3D model images wherever and whenever you need them.

  This book focuses exclusively on using 3D modeling, CT, MRi and 3D scan techniques of the head & neck. It covers forms, shapes, facial topography, gender differences, age groups, body types, ethnicities, and the anatomy of the human head and neck.



Here is a brief rundown of the estimated 150 page content of head and neck anatomy of female & male, senior, adult, teen, child and baby:

Skull, muscles, cartilages, fat pads, glands, blood, vessels, cervical vertebrates, thyroid, function and form, shapes and masses, ethnicity, eye movement, mouth expressions, nose reference, ear reference, functions of facial muscles, dynamic and age wrinkles, proportions, emotions, edge loops and mesh flows, facial topography & Facial Action Coding System

  Augmented Reality or AR is a type of virtual reality that aims to duplicate the world's environment in silico or in a computer. An augmented reality system generates a composite view for the user that is the combination of the real scene viewed by the user and a virtual scene generated by the computer that augments the scene with additional information. The virtual scene generated by the computer is designed to enhance the user's sensory perception of the virtual world they are seeing or interacting with. The goal of Augmented Reality is to create a system in which the user cannot tell the difference between the real world and the virtual augmentation of it.

   The book's pages are going to be markers for triggering 3D model images within the custom built smartphone app. The AR will be built in Unity engine and coded in Vuforia software for iOS/Android smartphone app deployment

   To illustrate idea and technology the male head model is connected with Augmented Reality onto Anatomy For Sculptors book cover:


 The fundraising goal for this project is set at the minimum level to make this project a success. If we are able to raise funds beyond the goal there are many opportunities to make this book and app better by adding additional features and 3D content that has been left out to keep the page count, development time, and cost lower. The more funding we raise - the more 3D features and interactive elements the book will have.



  Two years ago when we launched the Kickstarter campaign for our first book 381 people backed our idea and many others have purchased books since then. We have received stunning feedback from our customers and industry experts, and have been invited to read lectures for several universities and colleges. Here are a few things our supporters have said about us: 

Louis Henry Mitchell

“I am the Creative director of Character Design for Sesame Street. I am also a teacher of art and I wanted to express my gratitude and amazement at your accomplishment with your book "Anatomy For Sculptors". Any student of anatomy would benefit from that brilliant work!! I am a sculptor but I primarily draw and your book is second only to "Artistic Anatomy" 

- Dr. Paul Richer.

Rey Bustos artistic anatomist and educator

"Anatomy For Sculptors for me is the best anatomy book that has come around in a while. As an educator specializing in anatomy for artists I can honestly say that it is now on my very short list of best anatomy books anywhere. I must add though that the title should be "Anatomy for ANY artist". This is a must have for all artists.” -

Ben Knap,  Lead character artist at Hi-Rez Studios.

The last book has been AMAZING and has really helped me with furthering my understanding of anatomy. I am very excited for the new book and interested in the augmented reality model and how that will look. The only feedback I can say is PLEASE KEEP THESE COMING! The books you are getting out there allow for an expidited understanding of anatomy and forms. I have been making character art for 10 years professionally and have multiple reference statues from areas like anatomytools.com, yet in that time I learned 1/3 from the ref statues than from your book, and in a muuuuch shorty time. 

Aaron Costic, Ice Sculptor, Four times National Champion 

GREAT BOOK!! I’ve been practicing a human for competition & it is really helping!!" 

Alan Friend, Scottish painter

Anatomy4Sculptors.com is a resource every artist should know about. Their latest Kickstarter campaign, Head and Neck Anatomy, combines 21st century technical wizardry, deep anatomical knowledge, and major artistic talent. Put simply, it may well create the most advanced and comprehensive body of artistic and anatomical knowledge on the human head and neck ever assembled.

   We have prepared awesome rewards packages including t-shirts, anatomy books, charts, physical and digital objects, lectures and workshops. 


   Anatomy For Sculptors began as a website for sculptors to learn the secrets of expressing the human form based in academic knowledge of classic human anatomy. Our mission was to make this information accessible and understandable for everyone.

   Over the last 5 years, we built the anatomy4sculptors.com website and then published our book by the same name with the help of a professional photographer, models, editor, and a graphic designer. Using dozens of books and countless online resources as references, in combination with licensed anatomical photographs, we created hundreds of illustrations visualizing the human body and its features. 

   Since we successfully crowd funded and published the book two years ago, we have distributed over four-and-half thousand copies in hardcover and paperback, as well as digital copies. We have also been privileged to present our work at numerous art colleges and universities. The more people we have met along the way, the more people have told us that our book makes for an amazing resource not only for classical artists and sculptors, but also for CG artists.

   Originally headed by myself and anatomy teacher and illustrator Uldis Zarins, our core team has grown to include CG Artist Jon Hanzelka, Project Manager and Digital Artist Sergio Alessandro, Marketing and Communications Manager Lisa Donze, programmer Janis Kondrats, graphic designer Edgars Vegners and business adviser Reinis Znotins.


   We've priced our project at the absolute bare minimum. If we raise more, we'll be able to produce a larger print-run, use better paper stock, and do full-color interiors. Here's a breakdown of what is involved:

  • Production costs - includes author/illustrator/CG artist team, marketing team, video production, book layout design, poster and t-shirts for pledges. 
  • Indiegogo/PayPal Fees - Roughly 8%-10% of final funding. 
  • Production of books - These rates vary depending on the amount ordered, but it is likely our most sizable budget item. 
  • Development of iOS/Android Augmented Reality app. 
  • Shipping & shipping supply - Another sizable expense, depending on amount shipped and number of international orders. 
  • Taxes - self-employed rates apply. 
  • Buffer Amount - necessary for ANY Kickstarter. Set aside for dropped pledges, lost books, refund requests, and any miscalculations.



RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We have the experience of successfully funding a Kickstarter campaign for the original Anatomy for Sculptors book, and to date have delivered 4600 books around the globe. Our team is in place with additional support for this larger and more technologically demanding campaign, and we expect to be able to move full-steam ahead according to plan.

Potential Challenges are:

1. Development and coding for the Augmented Reality application, which may take longer than anticipated. 

2. The manufacture and delivery of custom manufactured rewards, such as teaching display models, which may also take longer than initially planned.

We have done extensive planning and pre-work, so we are confident that we will be able to make our deadlines and meet our milestones on time - or in some cases, even be ready with print rewards early. However, in case of any delays, we will provide our backers with clear and timely communication of the status of this project and provide updated delivery estimates.

Thank you again for your support and confidence in Anatomy For Sculptors!

story:
Who We Are: 

Callaloo is a cultural children's media brand that creates books, digital content, animation and live performances for children ages 3-7. Using folklore (Caribbean Diaspora / World culture), we promote literacy through community, history and cultural preservation.  

THE TEAM: 

Marjuan Canady (Creator/ CEO/Writer) 

Nabeeh Bilal (CCO/ Illustrator/Visual Director)

Tatiana Alexander (CFO / Producer) 

In two short years, the Callaloo team has touched thousands of children worldwide through our book, web-series and live performances. Those experiences have given us insight on what parents want for their kids, what teachers are missing in the classroom and most importantly what kids get excited about!

We use cultural stories from the past to empower and educate children in the present! When you support Callaloo and our products, you are supporting a new generation of education, young people and cultural literacy and action. We are telling our story with purpose, passion and fun! Be part of our Callaloo Movement and DONATE!


What We Need & What You Get

When you donate your money goes to: 

  • HOW TO WITH CALLALOO (public tv kids show / online web-series) 
  • National Touring, Children's Programs, Readings
  • Animation, Games and App Development
  • Callaloo 2 (The second book in the series!) 

The Impact

When you support Callaloo you are: 

  • Supporting Cultural Literacy and Diverse storytelling worldwide
  • Preserving Caribbean/African Diaspora storytelling and folklore
  • Investing in the future of children's media (books, television, film, animation, games and merchandise) 
  • Supporting artistpreneurs and creative professionals 

Risks & Challenges

It's very expensive and challenging to produce consistent work. Our Callaloo team is made up of three people and now we need to expand to keep up with our demand. We must hire: 

  • Actors, teaching arts, educators and production staff and crew
  • Develop games, apps and digital content to accompany our books
  • Produce merchandise to accompany our books
  • Rent office space to effectively work as a company 

Other Ways You Can Help

Low on Cash? You can still support us! 

  • WATCH & SHARE our How to with Callaloo episodes with your kids! 
  • BUY our book online!
  • FOLLOW us on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest and RE-POST our work!

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for the support! 

-Team Callaloo

#LetsMakeCallaloo

www.callaloothebook.com

story:
Worum geht es in dem Projekt?

Gruppe42 bemüht sich um einen offenen, unaufgeregten Diskurs abseits der schmalen, medial vermittelten Meinungsvorgabe. Mit der Einladung von Dr. Daniele Ganser wollen wir dafür sorgen, dass der Diskurs rund um 9/11 in seiner Wichtigkeit nicht abnimmt und hoffen, gerade so, auch die Zusammenhänge zwischen der herrschenden Flüchtlingskrise, den plumpen Ressentiments gegenüber unserer muslimischen Mitmenschen und der zusehends reaktionärer werdenden westlichen Gesellschaft aufzeigen zu können.

Warum sollte jemand dieses Projekt unterstützen?

Die Zusammenhänge zwischen 9/11 und der herrschenden Flüchtlingskrise sind unmöglich von der Hand zu weisen.
Gerade aus Solidarität mit den heimatvertriebenen Menschen und in der Hoffnung, dass es über kurz oder lang gelingen kann, von den dafür verantwortlichen Regierungen und den Konzernen, die von dem "War against Terror" profitiert haben, Reparationszahlungen zu verlangen, die für einen Wiederaufbau in den Heimatländern sorgen könnten, sollte ein wichtiger Grund sein um dieses Projekt zu unterstützen und zu fördern.
Abgesehen von der Organisation dieser Veranstaltung wird Gruppe42 auch den Vortrag von Dr. Daniele Ganser aufzeichnen und frei dem Internet zur Verfügung stellen. Um hier mit guter Qualität bürgen zu können ist eine Unterstützung für uns wichtig.

Wann & Wo wird der Vortrag stattfinden?

Am 24. September 2016 im ODEON Theater in Wien. Nähere Informationen & Updates findest du im Facebook Event auf: https://www.facebook.com/events/675025029315869/

Der Preis pro Karte liegt momentan bei 35€. Wer beim Crowdfunding 80€ spendet, bekommt eine Karte dazu.

Reservierung:

karten@odeon.at
01 / 216 51 27

Was passiert mit dem Geld bei erfolgreicher Finanzierung?

Das Geld wird zu einem großen Teil für die Saalmiete verwendet und den restlichen Betrag werden wir in gutes Equipment für die Aufzeichnung investieren.

Wer steht hinter dem Projekt?

Hinter dem Projekt stehen Gruppe42 und der Verein K.u.K. (Kunst und Kritik).

story:
About Biotechin.Asia

Biotechin.Asia is a Singapore-based biotech and healthcare news website. A part of Biotech Media Pte. Ltd., the site was founded by 3 Nanyang Technological University (NTU) graduate alumnus. 

Biotechin.Asia is focused on delivering simplified, curated, fact-based news for all stakeholders in the biotech and healthcare ecosystem. The original articles published are written by science graduates, students, PhDs, doctors and engineers.

As a virtual newsroom, Biotechin.Asia covers the latest in research/news/insights from around the world while putting a spotlight on developments in Asia. It aims to nurture and bring together an ecosystem of biotech and healthcare startups, academicians and industry onto a common platform.

SciWOW - WonderWomen in Science

Biotechin.Asia is proud to present SciWOW - WonderWomen in Science video interview series, featuring outstanding women in the fields of science and technology.

We are glad to feature these 12 amazing women as part of this series as we truly believe they are the perfect fit for such a series. Due to gender disparity still prevalent in today’s society, especially in the fields of science and technology, we hope to raise awareness of this issue and highlight the contributions as well as importance of amazing women as role models. 

The videos will be released as one interview per episode on Biotechin.Asia and Youtube for everyone to watch and be inspired!

The impact

Women need role models and mentors to look upto and be inspired.

The founders of Biotechin.Asia, Dr Sandhya Sriram and Dr Laxmi Iyer felt the compelling need to produce this series as they feel that women in science leadership are not represented well enough; they feel that Biotechin.Asia is the perfect platform to showcase these amazing women.

Millions of women in science or non-science backgrounds around the world will be impacted by this video interview series.

We aim to produce this series every year with women in science from different parts of the world. 

The present series features women from different backgrounds, different origins and with different perspectives. 

What we are asking and what you get

We have a strong team in place and we have already completed filming all the interviews.

We are in post-production and editing stages now and working with some amazing friends to help us with out. We are extremely passionate and want to make sure this series is a huge success. 

  • We are raising USD 5000/- for all the hard work that has been put in by our team, our interns, the freelance editor(s) and music composer(s).
  • You pitch in for this campaign, and we will credit your name in the series! You pitch in more and we will add your photo/company ad as well!
  • If you cannot pitch in right now, please help spread the word about our campaign and series. Share it on your social media feeds! Please create some noise!

About Biotechin.Asia
Biotechin.Asia is a Singapore-based biotech and healthcare news website. A part of Biotech Media Pte. Ltd., the site was founded by 3 Nanyang Technological University (NTU) graduate alumnus. 
Biotechin.Asia is focused on delivering simplified, curated, fact-based news for all stakeholders in the biotech and healthcare ecosystem. The original articles published are written by science graduates, students, PhDs, doctors and engineers.
As a virtual newsroom, Biotechin.Asia covers the latest in research/news/insights from around the world while putting a spotlight on developments in Asia. It aims to nurture and bring together an ecosystem of biotech and healthcare startups, academicians and industry onto a common platform.

SciWOW - WonderWomen in Science
Biotechin.Asia is proud to present SciWOW - WonderWomen in Science video interview series, featuring outstanding women in the fields of science and technology.
We are glad to feature these 12 amazing women as part of this series as we truly believe they are the perfect fit for such a series. Due to gender disparity still prevalent in today’s society, especially in the fields of science and technology, we hope to raise awareness of this issue and highlight the contributions as well as importance of amazing women as role models. 
The videos will be released as one interview per episode on Biotechin.Asia and Youtube for everyone to watch and be inspired!
The impact
Women need role models and mentors to look upto and be inspired.
The founders of Biotechin.Asia, Dr Sandhya Sriram and Dr Laxmi Iyer felt the compelling need to produce this series as they feel that women in science leadership are not represented well enough; they feel that Biotechin.Asia is the perfect platform to showcase these amazing women.
Millions of women in science or non-science backgrounds around the world will be impacted by this video interview series.
We aim to produce this series every year with women in science from different parts of the world. 
The present series features women from different backgrounds, different origins and with different perspectives. 
What we are asking and what you get
We have a strong team in place and we have already completed filming all the interviews.
We are in post-production and editing stages now and working with some amazing friends to help us with out. We are extremely passionate and want to make sure this series is a huge success. 

We are raising USD 5000/- for all the hard work that has been put in by our team, our interns, the freelance editor(s) and music composer(s).
You pitch in for this campaign, and we will credit your name in the series! You pitch in more and we will add your photo/company ad as well!
If you cannot pitch in right now, please help spread the word about our campaign and series. Share it on your social media feeds! Please create some noise!

story:
The American Legion Post 41 Jr. Shooting Sports Program is a non-profit organization (501 C 19) based out of Keyser, WV.  The American Legion Junior Shooting Sports Program is a gun safety education and marksmanship program that encompasses the basic elements of safety, education, enjoyment and competition.   Shooters use the .177 caliber air rifle. Both males and females ages 11 ½ to 18 can participate, through Legion sponsorship; disabled youth are encouraged to join, as competitive shooting is a sport that creates an equal playing field for all competitors.

Junior Shooting Sports is a three-part program that combines the Basic Marksmanship Course, Qualification Awards and Air Rifle Competition into a well-rounded activity.

Basic Marksmanship Course

The Basic Marksmanship Course, given to Shooting Sports participants, offers comprehensive instruction for beginning shooters with little or no marksmanship experience. Designed for an instructor’s easy use, the course teaches gun safety and marksmanship fundamentals, using short lectures or discussions, followed by hands-on activities.

Qualification Awards

Graduates who want to keep improving their skills can enroll in air-rifle qualification courses provided by the National Rifle Association and the Civilian Marksmanship Programs. These courses offer personal skill-development ladders for shooters to achieve established performance standards.

Air Rifle Competition

The annual 3-Position Junior Air Rifle National Championship is a tournament that begins with postal matches. State and/or regional champions are determined and advance to a qualification round (also a postal match) to determine the athletes who will earn expense-paid trips to compete in the national championship. The national championship is a shoulder-to-shoulder match held each July at the USA Shooting range facilities at the Olympic Training Center in Colorado Springs.

As an organization we are dedicated to providing a positive environment with a strong emphasis on team unity, individual skill improvement, and sound fundamentals. Our coaches encourage team members to excel as both athletes and as students.  We strive to prepare our players for a competitive level in competition, life skills and to work toward the ultimate goal of receiving a college scholarship.  As a side note, WVU has a world class rifle team but we very rarely see WV residents on the team, we aim to change this.

We have been working very hard in our promotion of our programs and to date, we have the full support and approval from the Mineral County Chamber of Commerce, the Mineral County Commissioners, the Mineral County Parks and Rec Department and Mineral County Schools.

We currently have over 100 students registered to take part in the fall of 2018.  As an FYI, it takes $1,650. to fully equip each team member, this is not counting the costs associated with an indoor air rifle range and training venue which will be located in the Keyser City limits.

In an effort to offset the high cost of youth sports, coaches and team members often seek donations and sponsorships from individuals and companies.  Your support will ensure that shooters have the opportunity to compete and to achieve full potential in the sport of Competitive Air Rifle Marksmanship.

As a thank you for providing this much needed support, we will proudly display a banner with your logo and company or individual name in our range facility.  We will also provide your information, listed under the heading;  “Sponsors/Supporters” which will let our teams, parents and our fans of your support in our newsletter, webpage  and our face book page.

Please visit our Face Book page to learn more about our program.  https://www.facebook.com/American-Legion-Post-4....   For additional information please contact me at 240-580-5015 or by email at wvaljssp@gmail.com.

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
< ENGLISH story below >

Afin de financer le début de ma thèse, je me lance dans un financement participatif.

 

MAIS AVANT DE PARLER FINANCEMENT... VOICI UNE RAPIDE AMORCE À MON PROJET!

 

« En deux mots ou moins, que désirez-vous le plus pour vos enfants ? »

Les réponses courantes sont « bonheur», « satisfaction », « accomplissement personnel », « équilibre », « santé », « amour », « sens dans la vie »… Plus généralement, on pourrait parler d'un objectif de « Bien-être ».

 

Une autre question pourrait ensuite être mise en parallèle avec la première:

 

« En deux mots ou moins, qu’est-ce que l’école enseigne en premier lieu ? »

À ceci, la plupart des parents répondent « compétences de réflexion », « réussite », « conformité », « discipline », ou encore « travail »… En soi l’école actuelle forme surtout à la réussite professionnelle.

 

De ce constat, Martin Seligman met en avant le fait « qu’il n’y a quasiment aucun rapprochement, aucun chevauchement entre les notions issues de ces deux questions ». Nous pourrions pourtant imaginer que l’école, sans compromettre aucune de ces notions, puisse enseigner à la fois les compétences du bien-être et les compétences de la réussite. Nous pourrions imaginer une "éducation positive".

 

 

L'ensemble de cette réflexion représente mes premiers pas et mes premières lectures en matière de psychologie positive et d'éducation positive. Depuis, j'ai écrit mon mémoire de master sur cette thématique et je me suis engagé dans un projet de thèse doctorale toujours sur le même sujet.

 

PRÉSENTATION DÉTAILLÉE - TRAVAIL DE RECHERCHE ET FINANCEMENT PARTICIPATIF:

 

Plus précisément, je travaille sur la résilience et les programmes scolaires de résilience. Surtout connue en France grâce à Boris Cyrulnik, la résilience tire ses origines des études de chercheurs anglo-saxons dans les années 60 et 70. Dans les sciences humaines, il s'agit du processus permettant à un individu de rebondir après un événement traumatique plus ou moins sévère, ou après avoir souffert d'une adversité plus chronique (qui perdure dans le temps, environnement néfaste...).

 

Dans le cadre scolaire, les programmes de résilience se basent sur des principes et théories en psychologie pour aider les élèves à apprendre comment gérer les adversités du quotidien. Entre autres, l'objectif est de leur donner des clés pour mieux gérer le stress immédiat provoqué par l'élément traumatisant, puis pour apprendre à prendre du recul par rapport à celui-ci, pour y trouver une explication causale, pour s'ouvrir à un/des support(s) relationnel(s) extérieur(s), pour enfin rebondir et avancer.

 

J'ai donc produit mon mémoire de Master lors de l'année scolaire 2016-2017; suite à l'obtention de mon diplôme j'ai repris un protocole plus rigoureux à partir de Septembre 2017 afin de réaliser une revue de littérature (integrative review) en vue d'une première publication dans un journal scientifique international. Ce travail de revue sur les théories générales et concepts de la résilience en psychologie a connu une première période d'analyse et de synthèse des papiers sélectionnés jusqu'à Janvier 2018. À l'heure actuelle la rédaction de l'article touche à sa fin; il devrait bientôt être soumis à un éditeur. En parallèle un deuxième protocole pour un travail de revue similaire a été lancé: l'intérêt sera cette fois centré sur le milieu scolaire et les programmes de résilience à l'école.

 

Outre l'objectif de publication, l'ensemble de ces recherches forme également le cadre théorique de la thèse.

 

 

Néanmoins, l'obtention d'un contrat doctoral pour 3 ans de thèse s'avère être un parcours laborieux. Les enseignants-chercheurs qui me suivent, et moi-même, travaillons à l'élaboration de dossiers et contrats pour financer concrètement mon projet de thèse jusqu'à une soutenance dans quelques années. Ces démarches devraient aboutir à un contrat doctoral au début 2019. Le financement participatif s'appliquerait donc pour le reste de cette année 2018 afin de m'aider à couvrir mes frais d'hébergement et divers frais liés à mes déplacements et au travail de recherche. Ceux-ci deviennent difficiles à soutenir personnellement.

 

ME CONNAITRE UN PEU PLUS:

 

Clément Métais, 25 ans.

>>  https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Clement_Me...

>> (Clément Métais sur LinkedIn)

 

Après avoir terminé 2 années dans le milieu technique (IUT génie électrique), je me suis changé les idées lors d'une année en Australie, pour finalement me réorienter vers des études dans l'enseignement (EPS). Lors de cette année chez les Wallabies, j'étais assistant de Français sur un des campus (Timbertop, video ci-dessous) de l'institut scolaire "Geelong Grammar School". Sans trop le savoir à l'époque j'ai eu un avant goût de la psychologie positive et de l'éducation positive. Geelong Grammar fut une pionnière en la matière. Je suis aujourd'hui en plein dedans, mais j'étais à l'époque bien loin de comprendre ce qu'ils voulaient dire en parlant de PosEd (Positive Education)!

 

 

Puis après un court passage par une formation en tourisme sportif (me donnant la chance d'aller faire quelques saisons estivales en tant que guide touristique en Islande), mes études m'ont ensuite rapidement emmené vers l'enseignement de l'EPS. Et c'est en deuxième année de Master à Strasbourg que j'ai décidé de m'éloigner légèrement des concours de l'éducation nationale pour me concentrer sur mon mémoire en Psychologie Positive concordant avec un des domaines de notre formation (psychologie). Ayant depuis poursuivi sur ma lancée avec le projet de thèse, l'EPS n'intervient plus directement dans le cadre de mes recherches actuelles.

 

COMMENT PARTICIPER ?

 

  • Partagez ce projet sur vos réseaux ! (petits boutons de partage à côté du bouton rose)

ou

  • Cliquez sur le bouton rose "Soutenez ce projet" et donnez la somme que vous voulez !

 

À QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE ?

 

L'objectif a été fixé à 3500 euros. Comme brièvement exposé plus haut, ce chiffre représente mes frais d'hébergement et divers frais annexes pour la fin de l'année 2018 jusqu'à l'obtention un contrat doctoral à partir de 2019. Néanmoins, un dépassement de ce montant me permettrait une participation à d'autres frais de la vie au quotidien, ainsi que l'achat d'une nouvelle (et nécessaire) plateforme numérique de travail (ordinateur portable).

 

2100 € : 7 mois de loyer de Juin à Décembre 2018

700 € : Frais d'alimentation pour 7 mois

700 € : Frais divers (déplacements, documentation scientifique, frais de recherches liés par exemple à l'accès aux articles sur les librairies scientifiques du net et autres plateformes en ligne...)

 

N'hésitez pas à me solliciter pour toute autre question ! Je suis tout disposé à vous en dire plus sur la résilience !     (clement-metais@laposte.net)

 

Merci d'avance à tous pour votre intérêt !

_____________________________________________________________________________________

< ENGLISH >

 

In order to fund the begining of my Doctor Thesis, I am starting a crowdfunding campaign.

 

BUT BEFORE TALKING ABOUT FUNDINGS... HERE'S A FIRST TASTE OF MY PROJECT!

 

" In two words or less, what do you most want for your children? "

A lot of parents would respond ‘Happiness’, ‘Confidence’, ‘Contentment’, ‘Balance’, ‘Good Stuff’, ‘Kindness’, ‘Health’, ‘Satisfaction’... In short, we want well-being for our children.

 

" In two words or less, what do schools teach?  "

If you are like other parents, you responded, ‘Achievement’, ‘Thinking Skills’, ‘Success’, ‘Conformity’, ‘Literacy’, ‘Mathematics’, ‘Discipline’... In short schools teach the tools of accomplishment.

 

From this statement, Professor Martin.E.P. Seligman noticed that there is almost no overlap between the two lists. Although accomplishment, success, literacy, and discipline can be considered as basics, we can yet imagine that schools could, without compromising either,  teach  both  the  skills  of  well-being  and  the  skills  of  achievement. We could imagine Positive Education.

 

 

This whole reflection corresponds to my first steps and readings in the topics of positive psychology and positive education. Since then, I wrote my Master Thesis on this subject and I started a Doctor Thesis project on this same subject.

 

DETAILED PRESENTATION - RESEARCH WORK AND CROWDFUNDING:

 

Precisely I work on resilience and school-based resilience programs. In the field of psychology, resilience holds its roots in the 60's and 70's with studies from important figures such as Garmezy, Werner, Rutter, Masten. This construct refers to the processes by which individuals achieve positive developmental outcomes despite exposure to known threats to adaptation.

 

Within an educational prospect, school-based resilience programs stem from those theories and concepts in psychology. They intend to help students/children dealing with daily and life adversities. Amongst others, the objective is to give them keys to better manage stress triggered by the aversive element, to appraise it, to learn to step back and look wisely at it, and to find all sorts of support in their environment, to finally bounce and move forward.

 

Thus, I wrote my Master Thesis during the 2016-2017 French school year. Following my graduation, I then started over a more rigorous protocol for an integrative review on general concepts and theories of resilience. The main objective of the review is a first scientific publication. After a reading and data synthesis stage, my article is now getting done and soon will be submitted to a publisher. Aside of that, a second review protocol has been started, this time it focuses specifically on resilience in the context of school-based programs.

Apart from the publication objectives, those reviews also constitute the whole theoretical framework of my thesis.

 

 

Though, obtaining fundings for a 3-year doctoral contract appears to be a path strewn with obstacles. The professors (future thesis directors) following my research and I are working on files and contracts in order to get a proper funding. This process should turn out well and drive towards a paid contract in 2019. This page of crowdfunding then applies in 2018; it would sustain my accommodation expenses and several other costs pertaining to my research work.

 

WHO AM I ?

 

Clément Métais, 25 years old.

>>  https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Clement_Me...

>> (Clément Métais on LinkedIn)

 

After having graduated a 2-year HNC ‘Industrial Computing and Electronic Science', I cleared my mind by doing a gap-year in Australia, to finally switch to Physical Education teaching studies once back in France. During this experience amongst Wallabies I was French assistant on one of the Geelong Grammar School campuses (Timbertop, see video below). Not really realizing it at that time, I actually had a first taste of positive psychology and positive education (PosEd' they used to say). In fact Geelong Grammar is quite a pioneer in this domain.

 

 

Then after a brief vocational course on 'Outdoor activities tourism' (giving me the chance to work a couple of times as a touristic guide in Iceland), I rapidly moved towards Physical Education teaching studies. Therefore, it was during my second year of Master that I wrote my Master thesis and that I decided to slightly step aside Physical Education to focus more on Positive Education. Then pursuing this at a Doctor Thesis level quickly became a clear goal to me.

 

HOW CAN YOU PARTICIPATE ?

 

  • Share my project on your social networks (little sharing icons next to the pink button)

or

  • Click on this big pink button "Back it" and give how much you want :)

 

HOW THE FUNDINGS WILL BE USED ?

 

I aim at getting 3500 euros (about 4280$, or 3060£). As briefly exposed above, this represents my accommodation expenses and several other costs until December 2018 (until getting a proper doctoral paid contract in 2019). However, getting beyond that goal would definitely help me cover other costs such as daily expenses or a new (and necessary) work platform (laptop).

 

2100 € : 7 months (June to December 2018) accommodation rent

700 € : Food expenses for 7 months

700 € : Several expenses (travels for the purpose of my research work, scientific litterature, fees for online scientific libraries...)

 

Do not hesitate asking me more questions. I would be more than happy to talk more with you about resilience !     (clement-metais@laposte.net)

 

Thanks a lot to you all for your interest in this project !

Je suis tout disposé à vous en dire plus sur la résilience !     (clement-metais@laposte.net) Merci d'avance à tous pour votre intérêt !_____________________________________________________________________________________< ENGLISH > In order to fund the begining of my Doctor Thesis, I am starting a crowdfunding campaign. BUT BEFORE TALKING ABOUT FUNDINGS... HERE'S A FIRST TASTE OF MY PROJECT! " In two words or less, what do you most want for your children? "A lot of parents would respond ‘Happiness’, ‘Confidence’, ‘Contentment’, ‘Balance’, ‘Good Stuff’, ‘Kindness’, ‘Health’, ‘Satisfaction’... In short, we want well-being for our children. " In two words or less, what do schools teach?  "If you are like other parents, you responded, ‘Achievement’, ‘Thinking Skills’, ‘Success’, ‘Conformity’, ‘Literacy’, ‘Mathematics’, ‘Discipline’... In short schools teach the tools of accomplishment. From this statement, Professor Martin.E.P. Seligman noticed that there is almost no overlap between the two lists. Although accomplishment, success, literacy, and discipline can be considered as basics, we can yet imagine that schools could, without compromising either,  teach  both  the  skills  of  well-being  and  the  skills  of  achievement. We could imagine Positive Education.  This whole reflection corresponds to my first steps and readings in the topics of positive psychology and positive education. Since then, I wrote my Master Thesis on this subject and I started a Doctor Thesis project on this same subject. DETAILED PRESENTATION - RESEARCH WORK AND CROWDFUNDING: Precisely I work on resilience and school-based resilience programs. In the field of psychology, resilience holds its roots in the 60's and 70's with studies from important figures such as Garmezy, Werner, Rutter, Masten. This construct refers to the processes by which individuals achieve positive developmental outcomes despite exposure to known threats to adaptation. Within an educational prospect, school-based resilience programs stem from those theories and concepts in psychology. They intend to help students/children dealing with daily and life adversities. Amongst others, the objective is to give them keys to better manage stress triggered by the aversive element, to appraise it, to learn to step back and look wisely at it, and to find all sorts of support in their environment, to finally bounce and move forward. Thus, I wrote my Master Thesis during the 2016-2017 French school year. Following my graduation, I then started over a more rigorous protocol for an integrative review on general concepts and theories of resilience. The main objective of the review is a first scientific publication. After a reading and data synthesis stage, my article is now getting done and soon will be submitted to a publisher. Aside of that, a second review protocol has been started, this time it focuses specifically on resilience in the context of school-based programs.Apart from the publication objectives, those reviews also constitute the whole theoretical framework of my thesis.  Though, obtaining fundings for a 3-year doctoral contract appears to be a path strewn with obstacles. The professors (future thesis directors) following my research and I are working on files and contracts in order to get a proper funding. This process should turn out well and drive towards a paid contract in 2019. This page of crowdfunding then applies in 2018; it would sustain my accommodation expenses and several other costs pertaining to my research work. WHO AM I ? Clément Métais, 25 years old.>>  https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Clement_Me...>> (Clément Métais on LinkedIn) After having graduated a 2-year HNC ‘Industrial Computing and Electronic Science', I cleared my mind by doing a gap-year in Australia, to finally switch to Physical Education teaching studies once back in France. During this experience amongst Wallabies I was French assistant on one of the Geelong Grammar School campuses (Timbertop, see video below). Not really realizing it at that time, I actually had a first taste of positive psychology and positive education (PosEd' they used to say). In fact Geelong Grammar is quite a pioneer in this domain.  Then after a brief vocational course on 'Outdoor activities tourism' (giving me the chance to work a couple of times as a touristic guide in Iceland), I rapidly moved towards Physical Education teaching studies. Therefore, it was during my second year of Master that I wrote my Master thesis and that I decided to slightly step aside Physical Education to focus more on Positive Education. Then pursuing this at a Doctor Thesis level quickly became a clear goal to me. HOW CAN YOU PARTICIPATE ? Share my project on your social networks (little sharing icons next to the pink button)orClick on this big pink button "Back it" and give how much you want :) HOW THE FUNDINGS WILL BE USED ? I aim at getting 3500 euros (about 4280$, or 3060£). As briefly exposed above, this represents my accommodation expenses and several other costs until December 2018 (until getting a proper doctoral paid contract in 2019). However, getting beyond that goal would definitely help me cover other costs such as daily expenses or a new (and necessary) work platform (laptop). 2100 € : 7 months (June to December 2018) accommodation rent700 € : Food expenses for 7 months700 € : Several expenses (travels for the purpose of my research work, scientific litterature, fees for online scientific libraries...) Do not hesitate asking me more questions. I would be more than happy to talk more with you about resilience !     (clement-metais@laposte.net) Thanks a lot to you all for your interest in this project !

story:
Who we are:

Libre Computer (Project) was created with the goal of commoditizing general-purpose computing platforms through Free Open Source Software (FOSS). We support software engineering efforts in upstream Linux, u-boot, and other community projects for the hardware platforms we adopt. To date, we have launched three FOSS supported platforms: Le Potato, Renegade, and Tritium. These boards act as the foundation of composible and re-usable computing systems. We continue to drive upstream software development for these platforms so that they become more intuitive, faster, and more capable. All of our platforms receive long term support in excess of five years.

Firefly (Team) is a core Libre Computer partner based in Zhongshan, China. With nearly ten years of hardware and software development expertise, the Firefly team is the top independent design house (IDH) for Rockchip-based solutions. They first brought the Firefly RK3399 platform to the market nearly two years ago and continue to deliver reliable performant solutions for design customers.

Overview of Renegade Elite:

Renegade Elite is a low-profile high-performance 4K-capable 64-bit ARM computer with 4GB of LPDDR4 RAM capable of running desktop-class Linux based operating systems like Debian, Arch, Ubuntu, Fedora, OpenSUSE, Android 8.1, and more. At 1.19 cm (0.47 inches), it is one of the thinnest SBCs on the market as well as being one of the fastest compared to Cortex-A53 boards like the Raspberry Pi 3 or Cortex-A17 boards like the ASUS Tinker Board. It is supported by upstream Linux which means that software support for hardware capabilities will continuously improve unlike other platforms that rely on proprietary vendor board support package (BSP).

Renegade Elite features a rich set of standards-compliant external interfaces. There are two USB 3.0 Type-C ports featuring DisplayPort Alternate Mode for driving 4K monitors (only one can be used in DisplayPort Alternate mode at a time). The rear Type-C port also features support for USB Power Delivery which enables single cable power, 4K video, and peripheral connectivity. HDMI 2.0 with 4K is also featured and can be driven simultaneously with DisplayPort, Embedded DisplayPort, or MIPI DSI.

For server application, the board offers UEFI-capable GUI bootloader, onboard headers for 802.3at (30W) PoE+ mezzanine support, and battery backed real-time-clock (RTC). High-speed header expansion with 4-lane PCI-E 2.1 enables SSD and SATA mezzanines while low-speed header expansion support USB, SDIO, UART, and I2C mezzanine. eMMC 5.x connector supports module with up to 128GB of storage.

For product integration, Renegade Elite supports Embedded DisplayPort, MIPI-DSI, MIPI-CSI, and MIPI-CSI/DSI dual role interfaces. Paired with stereo vision cameras or displays, Renegade Elite becomes an ideal platform for virtual reality, artificial intelligence, stereo computer-vision, heterogeneous compute, GPGPU, convolutional neural-networks, OpenCL, TensorFlow, and Caffe.

Renegade Elite Expansion Mezzanines

The expansion mezzanine for Renegade Elite comes in two flavors: Lite and Advanced.

Lite Expansion Mezzanine Features:

  • M.2 M-Key Connector with 4 Lane PCI-Express for SSDs and High Speed Peripherals
    • Supports 22mm x 30mm/42mm/60mm/80mm/110mm Lengths
  • M.2 E-Key Connector with SDIO and USB 2.0 for Wireless Expansion (No PCI-E!)
    • Supports 22mm x 30mm Length

The Advanced Expansion Mezzanine has all of the capabilities of the Lite Expansion Mezzanine along with three additional features:

  • Lithium Polymer Battery Support via XT30 Connector
  • Battery Backup and UPS functionality
  • 25W Power-over-Ethernet+ (IEEE 802.3at) support
    • Support for charging battery

The advanced mezzanine allows Renegade Elite to be used in situations with unreliable power and/or Ethernet only applications. That means you do not have to run separate power wires to Renegade Elite.

RK3399 Key Specification:

  • Dual performance out-of-order ARM Cortex-A72 cores
  • Quad power-optimized in-order ARM Cortex-A53 cores
  • Quad OpenGL ES 3.2/Vulkan/OpenCL 1.2 ARM Mali-T860 cores
  • 4GB LPDDR4 SDRAM
  • 128Mb SPI NOR for GUI bootloader
  • 120mm x 72mm x 11.9mm

Project Status:

The board has been fully tested and the PCBs are undergoing production. We expect manufacturing to be completed and fulfilled by late August. We will slowly release more demonstration videos as we free more time for filming. If there's something you have a question about or not sure on, don't hesitate to leave a comment.

Frequently Asked Questions:

Do you have a model with more than 4GB? - No, RK3399 is limited to 4GB of addressable memory.

What is the difference between this and a Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ or ASUS Tinker Board or ODRIOD-XU4? - This is 4 times as fast as a Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+, twice as fast a ASUS Tinker Board, and 35% faster than an ODROID-XU4. It has four times or twice the available memory of those models. It supports 64-bit ARMv8 where as ASUS Tinker Board and ODROID-XU4 only support 32-bit ARMv7. Onboard PCI-E high speed expansion interface enables high speed peripherals that are not possible on those other boards.

What is the difference between this and a ROCKPro64 or ROCK960? - While both of those are based on the same RK3399 SoC, Renegade Elite is designed using higher performance components. The board layout is optimized for full size cooling and better heat dissipation. Firefly team also specializes in Rockchip solutions and provides more software support than other vendors.

What is the difference between this and the original Renegade? - The original Renegade is designed as a power efficient device using at most 5W. It uses less power than a Raspberry Pi 3 Model B+ while offering higher performance. Renegade Elite is designed from the ground up as a high performance solution using up to 15W. Power consumption is roughly triple that of the Renegade so this new board is suitable for applications that require higher performance at the expense of more energy consumption.

How is shipping handled? - All products are shipped out of Shenzhen, China and may be subject to import duties and taxes imposed by your regional or local government. If it is subject to such regulations, it is your responsibility to pay it in order to receive the merchandise.

story:
Who We Are

Alternativ Global Entrepreneurs partners with communities to deliver high-impact business training and mentorship, equipping people to start small businesses, create jobs, and break the cycle of poverty. We envision a world where every person is able to embrace their potential, take charge of their future, and thrive economically through dignified and sustainable work.

We know that in order to eliminate poverty, we must strengthen the economic capacity of communities. Alternativ's unique Business Essentials Course helps families launch small businesses that create new jobs, improve financial resiliency, and improve the standard of living for our friends all over the world!

Of special concern to Alternativ is the reality that many women face day-to-day. Our Business Essentials Course is especially impactful for women and girls in safe houses, maternity homes, vocational programs, and co-ops because they learn how to accomplish their dreams and have a voice in their homes and communities.

For example, Ruby* is one of the inspiring women we have seen flourish from this training. Just two years ago, at age 20, she was struggling to survive on the streets of Kampala, Uganda after her family threw her out for becoming pregnant. She was sleeping in an abandoned bus at a church, very sick and malnourished. Our partner took her into their program for abused and neglected pregnant girls where she was able to regain her physical, mental, and spiritual health and deliver a baby boy.

Ruby was one of 30 young mothers trained in Alternativ’s course in January 2018. Since then, she has started making notebooks by hand and wholesaling them to a shop right outside the local university. She sold out of her first batch in just 2 days! Now she’s employing the other teen mothers at the shelter to make the books and just recently secured a contract with the largest child sponsorship agency in town to supply all of their students with notebooks!

Because of her business, Ruby is able to provide for her son while also attending school and pursuing her own educational goals!

Ruby was able to change her course because the women's shelter leadership were equipped through Alternativ's train the trainer approach. This means not only Ruby but all the women who arrive in this shelter have the opportunity and the new hope that Ruby was given. Through this campaign, we seek to extend our reach to connect with more leaders and more women just like Ruby. Here are just some of the many women we've impacted over the years. This is your opportunity to help us impact more.

*Ruby's name has been changed to maintain her privacy.

The Impact

Our graduates go on to start many diverse businesses! Examples include corner stores, beauty salons, taxi services, AC repair, water kiosks, movie theaters, agricultural businesses, coffee roasters, coffee/tea shops, restaurants, daycare centers, book producers, and artisan goods. We've found that:

  • Over 55% of graduates go on to start a new enterprise within 12 months,
  • Income rises between 40 and 70% within 12 months of training,
  • Each new company employs 2.4 others within 12 months, and
  • On average, graduates share their knowledge with 16 other friends, family, and co-workers!

We have a goal to triple our impact next year with the new Alternativ Global Entrepreneur online training, which is why we’ve launched this campaign.

Our Goal

We've seen the incredible results this training can have, and now we need YOUR help to reach even more people trapped in poverty. We’ve seen thousands of women and men all over the world light up while learning how to increase their family income and more importantly, start achieving their dreams. Now, after over five years of helping people succeed through our Business Essentials Course, we want to expand.

Until now, our process for distributing the Alternativ Business Essentials Course has been high-touch and time-intensive. We have recognized this limitation and have big dreams of our own: to equip thousands more moms, grandmas, and rising stars with the knowledge to change their futures and their communities. Tripling our impact to 1000 entrepreneurs in 2019 would mean we could reach 16,000 more community members who will be learning about business for the first time!

In order to make this goal a reality, we need to build an online training program that will multiply our efforts exponentially. In keeping with our train the trainer model, our online content will teach other nonprofit leaders how to effectively identify entrepreneurs, train them using the Business Essentials Course, and mentor and support their new businesses.

We are great at launching businesses! But, we need help to bring the online training to life. We want to create videos, websites, and graphics that will represent the quality values we teach, so we need to work with experts. We will use these funds to contract the expertise we need to launch this content well.

Can you help us reach our goal?

What We Need & What You Get

In order for us to reach the people that need this most, we need to raise $50,000 to develop the digital delivery of our preliminary training modules for leaders so they can access the content from anywhere, anytime!

  • $18,000 - Content development of scripting and lesson printables
  • $10,600 - Set up the back end of our new online training portal, hosting fees, and legal fees
  • $12,500- Professional editing of 5 of our most popular translations
  • $6,500 - Videography and graphic design
  • $2,400- For Perks and Delivery

As an appreciation for you backing our project, we have some simple perks to show our gratitude! Be sure to check out our levels to the right for a complete list! If you prefer to back us at a different level and receive no perks, simply hit "BACK IT" in the upper right corner.

$5 - You'll get a virtual high five. Every gift will receive an interactive handmade sketch from one of our global entrepreneurs! We hope you enjoy learning about their dreams and crafting your own!

$10 -  Back us at $10 or more and we'll send a special thank you postcard from a country we work in.

$25 - Show your support with one of our UV laminate stickers, perfect for your water bottle, laptop, or luggage!

$50 - You get a limited edition Jean & June "BOSS" T-shirt that tells the world you are the boss of your life and you mean business!

$75 - Gotta catch them all! With your gift of $75, you'll receive a t-shirt plus the essential pack of the sticker, postcard, and handmade sketch! 

$100 - We love that you're investing in change. We're honored to send all the other perks with the eye-opening DVD of Poverty, Inc. Get yourself a watch party going and let's smash poverty!

$250 - Love to share? This one's for you! 5 T's and stickers for you and your crew!

$ 500 - Bronze Level Sponsorship. Perfect for a generous donor or small business owners!

  • A display for your home or office.
  • Your / your organization's name as a contributing partner on our website.
  • One special message of gratitude and promotion on our Social Media.

$1000 - Silver Level Sponsorship.  Sponsorship fit for a team!

  • All perks within the Bronze Level Sponsorship.
  • You / Your organization's name as a Silver Sponsor on our website and Indiegogo related newsletters.
  • Team T’s, 5 T-shirts for your staff.

$2500 - Gold Level Sponsorship. Showcase your true dedication to business empowerment!

  • All perks within the Silver Level Sponsorship.
  • Once our online training platform is launched, you will serve as a premier sponsor with logo placement across an online training module and a special mention within the recorded training (will reach organizations worldwide!)
  • Within our online training platform, an exclusive video interview to share your expertise with our global partners and entrepreneurs.
  • Quarterly Social Media promotion. 

$5,000 - Platinum Level Sponsorship. We can't thank you enough for your amazing dedication to helping people follow their dreams and we want you involved. 

  • All perks within the Gold Level Sponsorship.
  • Logo placement and special mention throughout FOUR online modules (pending content approval).
  • The opportunity for one of your staff to directly engage with aspiring entrepreneurs abroad by joining our partner on their next trip to Haiti! Showcase your organization's commitment to breaking the cycle of poverty by joining us for a one-week training in our wonderful community in Haiti, including pre-trip training, meals, accommodation, and on-the-ground activities; airfare not included.

$15,000 - Explore and Empower Package.  A once in a lifetime opportunity for two! A visit to beautiful Uganda, including an amazing 3-day Safari and a 2-day site visit, benefiting our partner Remnant Generation. You and your guest will meet and encourage young entrepreneurs while taking in the sights! This trip includes pre-trip training, meals, accommodation, and on-the-ground activities during the 5-day stay; airfare not included.

*All the funds raised during this campaign will go towards helping reach more families waiting for an opportunity to act on their dreams. Every contribution will help make the online training a reality for these budding entrepreneurs all over the world. If we surpass our goal, we will be able to offer additional advanced content and professional translations of more unique languages for the Business Essentials curriculum ($7,000 each).

Food for Thought...

  • Globally, there are 122 women aged 25-34 living in extreme poverty for every 100 men of the same age group.
  • In 18 countries, husbands can legally prevent their wives from working.
  • Discriminatory legal frameworks and customary laws can place significant constraints on women’s ability to earn an income by restricting their access to inheritance, land, property and credit. As a result, women are less likely than men to have an income of their own, rendering them financially dependent on their partners and increasing their vulnerability to poverty.

As long as women are economically disempowered in the world of work and their communities, we will not succeed in ending poverty. The creation of inclusive and peaceful societies will continue to remain out of reach until women and girls are safe from all forms of violence and can play an active role in economic decisions that affect their lives.*insert citation

Alternativ Global Entrepreneurs is working to reach these women. From Pakistan to Thailand to Uganda to Nicaragua, we are committed to supporting women as fully functioning members of society and business. We value their vital voices as part of the financial and economic systems we seek to bolster. Even in the toughest environments, we are able to influence change through women’s business co-ops which provide a workaround for legal and cultural restrictions.

Risks & Challenges

We've worked hard to make sure that our curriculum and training program are top-notch, but here are a few things we are always thinking about.

Cultural Obstacles: Overcoming cultural obstacles is often one of our biggest challenges, especially when working in regions where human rights and women's rights are lacking. One way we plan to address this is by providing supplemental training modules to specifically address these cultural challenges.

Support Infrastructure: We also plan to have an online support group for trainees so they can help each other come up with ideas to the challenges they face without having our Western perspectives suggest all the solutions or answers to their problems. We know they are the experts on their community and we're just there to help support their efforts.

Skillset: Our team is led by experienced staff with advanced degrees and decades of international work. Our director holds a Master's Degree in Global Finance, Trade, and Economic Integration and has worked in economic development and entrepreneurship for over 10 years. Through this campaign we will be able to hire digital experts needed to execute this project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't give, doesn't mean you can't help! We'd love your support!

  • Follow us! Follow our social media, sign up for the newsletter, and stay up-to-date on all of our exciting progress. We'd love to connect with you on Instagram. 
  • Share this campaign on your social media and LinkedIn. If you're excited, others will be too! Share the love and help us reach our goal! 
  • Are you involved with other non-profits, ministries, or other groups providing support and inspiration to communities abroad or locally? Talk to us about different ways we can help bring this crucial education direct to your people. Inquire at info@alternativproject.org.

Through this campaign, we seek to extend our reach to connect with more leaders and more women just like Ruby. Here are just some of the many women we've impacted over the years. This is your opportunity to help us impact more.*Ruby's name has been changed to maintain her privacy.The ImpactOur graduates go on to start many diverse businesses! Examples include corner stores, beauty salons, taxi services, AC repair, water kiosks, movie theaters, agricultural businesses, coffee roasters, coffee/tea shops, restaurants, daycare centers, book producers, and artisan goods. We've found that:
Over 55% of graduates go on to start a new enterprise within 12 months,
Income rises between 40 and 70% within 12 months of training,
Each new company employs 2.4 others within 12 months, and
On average, graduates share their knowledge with 16 other friends, family, and co-workers!
We have a goal to triple our impact next year with the new Alternativ Global Entrepreneur online training, which is why we’ve launched this campaign.Our GoalWe've seen the incredible results this training can have, and now we need YOUR help to reach even more people trapped in poverty. We’ve seen thousands of women and men all over the world light up while learning how to increase their family income and more importantly, start achieving their dreams. Now, after over five years of helping people succeed through our Business Essentials Course, we want to expand.Until now, our process for distributing the Alternativ Business Essentials Course has been high-touch and time-intensive. We have recognized this limitation and have big dreams of our own: to equip thousands more moms, grandmas, and rising stars with the knowledge to change their futures and their communities. Tripling our impact to 1000 entrepreneurs in 2019 would mean we could reach 16,000 more community members who will be learning about business for the first time!In order to make this goal a reality, we need to build an online training program that will multiply our efforts exponentially. In keeping with our train the trainer model, our online content will teach other nonprofit leaders how to effectively identify entrepreneurs, train them using the Business Essentials Course, and mentor and support their new businesses.We are great at launching businesses! But, we need help to bring the online training to life. We want to create videos, websites, and graphics that will represent the quality values we teach, so we need to work with experts. We will use these funds to contract the expertise we need to launch this content well.Can you help us reach our goal?What We Need & What You GetIn order for us to reach the people that need this most, we need to raise $50,000 to develop the digital delivery of our preliminary training modules for leaders so they can access the content from anywhere, anytime!
$18,000 - Content development of scripting and lesson printables
$10,600 - Set up the back end of our new online training portal, hosting fees, and legal fees
$12,500- Professional editing of 5 of our most popular translations
$6,500 - Videography and graphic design
$2,400- For Perks and Delivery
As an appreciation for you backing our project, we have some simple perks to show our gratitude! Be sure to check out our levels to the right for a complete list! If you prefer to back us at a different level and receive no perks, simply hit "BACK IT" in the upper right corner.$5 - You'll get a virtual high five. Every gift will receive an interactive handmade sketch from one of our global entrepreneurs! We hope you enjoy learning about their dreams and crafting your own!$10 -  Back us at $10 or more and we'll send a special thank you postcard from a country we work in.$25 - Show your support with one of our UV laminate stickers, perfect for your water bottle, laptop, or luggage!$50 - You get a limited edition Jean & June "BOSS" T-shirt that tells the world you are the boss of your life and you mean business!$75 - Gotta catch them all! With your gift of $75, you'll receive a t-shirt plus the essential pack of the sticker, postcard, and handmade sketch! $100 - We love that you're investing in change. We're honored to send all the other perks with the eye-opening DVD of Poverty, Inc. Get yourself a watch party going and let's smash poverty!$250 - Love to share? This one's for you! 5 T's and stickers for you and your crew!$ 500 - Bronze Level Sponsorship. Perfect for a generous donor or small business owners!
A display for your home or office.
Your / your organization's name as a contributing partner on our website.
One special message of gratitude and promotion on our Social Media.
$1000 - Silver Level Sponsorship.  Sponsorship fit for a team!
All perks within the Bronze Level Sponsorship.
You / Your organization's name as a Silver Sponsor on our website and Indiegogo related newsletters.
Team T’s, 5 T-shirts for your staff.
$2500 - Gold Level Sponsorship. Showcase your true dedication to business empowerment!
All perks within the Silver Level Sponsorship.
Once our online training platform is launched, you will serve as a premier sponsor with logo placement across an online training module and a special mention within the recorded training (will reach organizations worldwide!)
Within our online training platform, an exclusive video interview to share your expertise with our global partners and entrepreneurs.
Quarterly Social Media promotion. 
$5,000 - Platinum Level Sponsorship. We can't thank you enough for your amazing dedication to helping people follow their dreams and we want you involved. 
All perks within the Gold Level Sponsorship.
Logo placement and special mention throughout FOUR online modules (pending content approval).
The opportunity for one of your staff to directly engage with aspiring entrepreneurs abroad by joining our partner on their next trip to Haiti! Showcase your organization's commitment to breaking the cycle of poverty by joining us for a one-week training in our wonderful community in Haiti, including pre-trip training, meals, accommodation, and on-the-ground activities; airfare not included.
$15,000 - Explore and Empower Package.  A once in a lifetime opportunity for two! A visit to beautiful Uganda, including an amazing 3-day Safari and a 2-day site visit, benefiting our partner Remnant Generation. You and your guest will meet and encourage young entrepreneurs while taking in the sights! This trip includes pre-trip training, meals, accommodation, and on-the-ground activities during the 5-day stay; airfare not included.*All the funds raised during this campaign will go towards helping reach more families waiting for an opportunity to act on their dreams. Every contribution will help make the online training a reality for these budding entrepreneurs all over the world. If we surpass our goal, we will be able to offer additional advanced content and professional translations of more unique languages for the Business Essentials curriculum ($7,000 each).Food for Thought...
Globally, there are 122 women aged 25-34 living in extreme poverty for every 100 men of the same age group.
In 18 countries, husbands can legally prevent their wives from working.
Discriminatory legal frameworks and customary laws can place significant constraints on women’s ability to earn an income by restricting their access to inheritance, land, property and credit. As a result, women are less likely than men to have an income of their own, rendering them financially dependent on their partners and increasing their vulnerability to poverty.
As long as women are economically disempowered in the world of work and their communities, we will not succeed in ending poverty. The creation of inclusive and peaceful societies will continue to remain out of reach until women and girls are safe from all forms of violence and can play an active role in economic decisions that affect their lives.*insert citationAlternativ Global Entrepreneurs is working to reach these women. From Pakistan to Thailand to Uganda to Nicaragua, we are committed to supporting women as fully functioning members of society and business. We value their vital voices as part of the financial and economic systems we seek to bolster. Even in the toughest environments, we are able to influence change through women’s business co-ops which provide a workaround for legal and cultural restrictions.Risks & ChallengesWe've worked hard to make sure that our curriculum and training program are top-notch, but here are a few things we are always thinking about.Cultural Obstacles: Overcoming cultural obstacles is often one of our biggest challenges, especially when working in regions where human rights and women's rights are lacking. One way we plan to address this is by providing supplemental training modules to specifically address these cultural challenges.Support Infrastructure: We also plan to have an online support group for trainees so they can help each other come up with ideas to the challenges they face without having our Western perspectives suggest all the solutions or answers to their problems. We know they are the experts on their community and we're just there to help support their efforts.Skillset: Our team is led by experienced staff with advanced degrees and decades of international work. Our director holds a Master's Degree in Global Finance, Trade, and Economic Integration and has worked in economic development and entrepreneurship for over 10 years. Through this campaign we will be able to hire digital experts needed to execute this project. Other Ways You Can HelpJust because you can't give, doesn't mean you can't help! We'd love your support!

Follow us! Follow our social media, sign up for the newsletter, and stay up-to-date on all of our exciting progress. We'd love to connect with you on Instagram. 

Share this campaign on your social media and LinkedIn. If you're excited, others will be too! Share the love and help us reach our goal! 
Are you involved with other non-profits, ministries, or other groups providing support and inspiration to communities abroad or locally? Talk to us about different ways we can help bring this crucial education direct to your people. Inquire at info@alternativproject.org.
