story:
Leaders In Community (LiC) – Kickstarter Campaign – Save our charity!

Summary - Who are we?

We are an entirely youth-led charity, we started 10 years ago to provide positive opportunities for children and young people aged from 5 up to 25 in the Tower Hamlets area. Our work is primarily focused on youth leadership and positive engagement. This is because we live in an area of East London which has the highest rate of child poverty in the UK. According to the Index of Multiple Deprivation, our young people make up 10% of the most deprived within the country. 49% of the children grow up in poverty. Over half of the local population are from a black or minority ethnic background and a large number are classified as NEET (Not in Education, Employment, or Training).

Over the 10 years we have helped 1000s of young people each year make positive choices about thier future, we have supported  young people build thier lives after being in prison and those under achieving aim high. We need your help to carry this on!

Our founder Momtaz Ajid, has been involved in the organisation as a young person. Having grown up in the local area, she understood the challenges faced by young people from the area and set up this voluntary organisation in 2006 to give other likeminded individuals from similar backgrounds the opportunity to build skills, confidence for employment.

What started out as a youth network group, sharing employment advice and opportunities for young people, became a campaigning group raising awareness about young people’s barriers to employment or education. We are still the only youth led charity in Tower Hamlets, working predominately with marginalised and disenfranchised group of people.

10 years on, we now deliver a weekly programme of activities, providing young people with the creative opportunities, skills and motivation to develop themselves and their peers into confident and inspirational leaders within the broader Tower Hamlets area.

Our activities are:

- Under 12s programme: Ballet, Guitar classes, and Violin tuition part of our Centre for creative expression.

- Peer Leadership programme, offering employability guidance and skills training to young people aged 16-25, with specialist support for those out of education, training or employment. This also includes mentoring, volunteering and an opportunity to become a trustee at LiC.

- Food for Thought mentoring- bringing benefits to both young people 15-20 year olds and the employee mentors who take part. Participants report that the Food for Thought sessions have been a huge success, enabling more than 50 young people from difficult backgrounds to ‘cook up a life plan’ with advice and support from warm hearted and knowledgeable employees.

- Music Leaders- is a music development programme for young people aged 12-19 to learn live band music skills, record their music and develop their artistry skills.

-Opportunities for young people to explore the arts, media, sports and the enterprise hub (for all ages).

What we need

We need to raise £50,000 to fund our activities above for the next 1-2 years. The charity currently employs only 1 full time member of staff and 2 part time staff. We heavily rely on the work of our 25 volunteers to help us meet the needs of the local young people.Without the dedication of our staff and volunteers we just couldn't function.

 
What you get

To say “thank you”, we pledge to give something back for your donation:

£1 A small donation to LiC Crowd funder – You become signed up to our newsletter x unlimited

£5 A personal thank you email from the MD of LiC x 200

£10 Free gift hampers made up by the LiC’s girl group x 20

£20 A music CD by LiC music academy students x 100

£20 Men’s haircut at LiC’s Tower Hamlet’s barber company x 50

£20 Free meeting space in Tower Hamlets x 50

£50 Janet Jackson tickets at the Barclaycard Birmingham Arena x 4 (30/3/2016)

£50 Learn how to cook in our cooking class for girls - 2 lessons x 10

£50 Attend and join in with the music academy for 2 lessons. The class will perform a song of your choice with an option to record it x 10

£1,000 1 x E-blast and website advert for your company on the LiC website x 15

£1,000 Sit on our board for at least 2 years and learn from the best FTSE 250 young professionals x 2

£5,000 Lifelong recognition as a guardian to LiC. Invitation to annual meetings, social events and local council meetings x 2

£15,000 Become a sponsor for LiC. Full page advert, monthly newsletters, 10 Tweets/month X 1 for a year

Any questions on the above prizes, please email us on info@leadersincommunity.org

Rewarding you

This campaign will last until 25th April 2016.

To keep everyone up to date and excited with the kick-starter project, we will
release 3 videos when we achieve each financial milestone.

1.  We reach £10K – A new single will be filmed by our talented singer Naomi and the band

2.  We reach £25,000k – Our cooking group will be filmed showing you a unique recipe to use for home cooking

3.  We reach £50,000 – Fireworks will go off in Tower Hamlets/our dance group will be filmed performing a hip-hop dance with all the LiC board members and Momtaz (CEO) - expect us to go out in style!

If we do not reach our target.

We would be devastated if we don’t meet our target. It will mean our 10 year old charity will likely close down, leaving destitute young people with nowhere to turn to. This could cause some of our young people joining gangs, not meeting their aspirations and potentially causing social problems to the Tower Hamlets community.

If we exceed our target.

This would be truly amazing and it will mean that we will be able to continue for at least 2 years, carrying on with providing award winning youth provision to the many young people in need of the support guidance. It will allow us to expand our services and provide niche work where it is needed, such as working with ex-offenders, or those leaving care.

The impact of your donations

Your donations will help us continue to deliver learning that meets the needs of our users, and focus on addressing barriers to achievement. E.g. You will support the delivery of our participatory music workshop, which brings positive personal and social benefits to the young people who take part. Our classes are heavily oversubscribed with waiting lists, with children and young people coming together from all walks of life, accessing instruments that are otherwise too expensive to try.


Did you know?
In Tower Hamlets, nearly 1 in 7 children in reception (4- to 5-year-olds) and over 1 in 4 of children in year 6 (10- to 11-year-olds) are obese. We have the fifth highest proportion of obese 10-to 11-year-olds in London and the sixth highest in the country.

Similarly there are groups of young people who do not reach expected levels of educational attainment which impacts on their future employment prospects. Traditional programmes at school can have limited impact on some young people and this is the case with the young people we see.

Our work

Our work provides critical front line service for children, young people and families to ensure we reduce these barriers.The impact of our work cannot always been quantified by statistics, our young people face numerous challenges and barriers. From low educational attainment, childhood obesity to mental health – all of which we help!

In 2015- 84 children and young people took part in our music workshops. By taking part in these sessions, we aim to improve the children and young people’s learning, confidence, health and social development as well as wellbeing.  Getting involved in these programmes gives them space, gets them out of the home and promoting self-confidence.  The skills the children gain here are all transferable and will enable the children to feel a sense of achievement and self-worth.

In 2015 we saw:

·  Over 900 young people benefited from our service

·  We delivered a Silver Awards programme equivalent to 1 GCSE

·  We supported 80 young people into employment, training or education.

·  We hosted a further 60 Work placements in our tiny office. 132 volunteers completed 2,000 hours

·  126 children and young people accessed our sports development programme.

Finally….. Help Leaders In Community reach its goal! Help the children and young people of Tower Hamlets by donating.

If you cannot donate, please tell your friends and family about this campaign.

Share this link: http://igg.me/at/lic/x/13395859

We will also be uploading a longer film on our YouTube page LIC_projects

Get updates on our Instagram: leadersincommunity

Facebook: leaders in community

Twitter: LIC_projects

Speacial Credits:
Staff and young people at LiC
Creative Director: Hawa Khan, Videographer:Jordan Reilly, Editor: Abdul Wajid Miah, Song: Falling down, by Sass words of wisdom and Naomi Bless

story:
Summary

Founded in 2012, KIPP Memphis Academy Middle opened its doors to a small 5th grade class and has since grown to serve 395 students in the Hyde Park neighborhood of North Memphis. 96% of our students qualify for Title 1 free and reduced meals, and the overwhelming majority come from low-income households.

As our first 8th grade class gets ready to graduate in 2016, we’ve realized how our school has outgrown our old library system. Before we had reached our full enrollment, English teachers were relied upon to provide books to their students in small “classroom libraries.” This was an extremely difficult task, considering the demands of instructing English in a region where less than 30% of students read on or above their grade level.

In the Fall of 2016, KMAM will invest in 7,000 new, protected books that will be leveled meticulously to meet our students' needs. While donors often love to give us used and dollar-bin books, these tend to fall apart quickly and aren't the most popular or age-appropriate books that we'd need to compel our students to be lifelong readers. We are asking you to donate to our library effort so that we can buy the most interesting and long-lasting texts, because our students deserve equal opportunity to great books! 

What We Need

The American Library Association recommends that any school library contain a ratio of *at least* 25:1 books per student. At KMAM, we currently have 6 books for every 1 KIPPster enrolled. This is far below what our students need! 

7,000 books would bring our ratio up to about 15:1. 

Each leveled text costs about $4, while binding and protecting the book costs anywhere from $5 to $8 on top of that. The more we raise, the more books we can obtain! 


The Impact

A school library would seriously increase student literacy and performance in nearly every subject:
  • Studies show that just the presence of a central library in schools can boost student achievement by up to 23%.
  • Students who read for pleasure score 2x higher on state assessments than those who do not.
  • Students are 3x more likely to read for pleasure if they have a wide choice of appropriate and high-interest texts.                                                                                                                                                                      
Already our KIPPsters read, on average, 1 million words a week (and we have just surpassed 75 million for this school year)! Every student knows exactly what level they are reading on, and they can tell you what their reading goal for the future is. We have reading blocks every day scheduled just for joyful, independent reading. Their biggest complaint (as you'll see in the video above) is that they don't have enough *choice* of texts. After all, in middle-income homes the ratio of books per child is 13:1 where as in low-income neighborhoods, the ratio is 1 book for every 300 children.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Want to volunteer with the library once we're off the ground? Email mwallace@kippmemphis. org to get involved.
  • Spread the word! Send out this campaign page with all of Indiegogo's awesome sharing tools!

We have reading blocks every day scheduled just for joyful, independent reading. Their biggest complaint (as you'll see in the video above) is that they don't have enough *choice* of texts. After all, in middle-income homes the ratio of books per child is 13:1 where as in low-income neighborhoods, the ratio is 1 book for every 300 children.




Other Ways You Can Help  Want to volunteer with the library once we're off the ground? Email mwallace@kippmemphis. org to get involved. Spread the word! Send out this campaign page with all of Indiegogo's awesome sharing tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Chef Theo!  USVI Culinary Ambassador & Celebrity Chef, and I want to personally share with you some Crop Circle Life hacks from farm-to-table in the most sustainable and flavorful ways available seasonally! 

I’ve been on the Wendy Williams Show, and have cheffed publicly or privately for some of MY favorite celebrities- and perhaps yours too- I teach youth programs at Culinary Institutes globally, produced two seasons of a cooking show for Canadian tv called “The Virgin Gourmet”, and have been curating some of my most unique and popular USVI Sweet And Savory recipes to make them available through a multimedia Interactive “course” and cookbook called #SweetAndSavory!

Through your crowdfunding help, and with every share across every social media platform, as well as every donation and pledge made, I will be able to print and sign one hundred copies of my first cookbook, Sweet And Savory, to gift to underserved youth programs.

I have independently financed the project thus far and as the USVI Culinary Ambassador and an active member of the Williams Sonoma Chef Collective, I  have already scheduled demos, book signings, and special meet-ups throughout the year in North Carolina, Virginia, Georgia, New York, Los Angeles and even the South of France during the Cote d’Azur WebFest - and now this crowdfunding campaign will make it possible to bring #SweetAndSavory to your community!

  •  A passion for food culture cuisine and travel mentorship are the themes of this crowdfund campaign and hashtag #SweetAndSavory
  •  Subscribers will have the opportunity to follow us online as we impact underserved youth programs through the hashtag #SweetAndSavory and at hands-on workshops while donating paperback copies of Chef Theo Gumbs Caribbean Thai Fusion cookbook.  

What We Need & What You Get

Our $2,500 goal will help us sponsor the cost of printing a paperback version of Chef Theo Gumbs Caribbean Thai Fusion cookbook to be donated to underserved youth programs locally and abroad.

  •  Every subscriber will be automatically entered to win special perks regardless of how small or large of a pledge!  
  •  For as little as 5 bucks, you can be added to our email list for inclusive offers and access to digital recipe cards! 

  •  We will be heading into multiple cities to include Canada as I have a great platform there over the years as a guest chef from the Caribbean.  This was a great opportunity for my culinary students that were able to attend all the way from the USVI and work with The Saint Pius Culinary Institute.

  •  The goal is to impact as many underserved youth programs as possible by way of food culture cuisine and mentorship through hands-on workshops. Offering healthy food options and cooking workshops as well as their own paperback copy of my very first cookbook providing continuing inspiration and even apprenticeship opportunities!

  • If we don't reach our entire financial goal we will still reach as many programs in our demographic areas as possible and collectively achieve our intention beyond measure!

  • We have prepared a virtual interactive media platform for continuing and future outreach and FUNdraisers.

The Impact

The impact on a child can ultimately impact an entire family in ways you may not imagine.  Exposing young minds to new foods and healthy farm-to-table trends will help them make better educated choices. This can be a game changer – changing or inspiring ones’ outlook on sustainability for an entire lifetime or generation or even an entire family of generations!

  •  I was able to achieve this successfully in the past as a culinary instructor, Captain of the USVI culinary Olympic team and owner of one of the top catering high end catering companies Theo's personal Chef and catering service.
  • My students took part in events in Canada, Miami at Johnson and Wales University, Wildcat events, youth chef competitions, hatch chef events, VIP private villa events, and too much more to name!!  They also ran a lunch program that was open to the public.

Risks & Challenges

Every project has its own unique Risks and Challenges that may occur; ours may or may not include delays in reprints of hard back copies due to the holidays.  We are prepared to serve as many paperback copies to the underserved youth programs as we are able should we meet and exceed our goals!  And if we get thousands of pledges it might take me longer to hand sign every thank you note than the two weeks anticipated.

  •  These are the challenges that come with the territory and we are prepared and ready to overcome our hurdles to be of service to the underserved youth programs both locally and globally.

  •  Through my intense travel and collaborations over the years, I have built a great network of net worth with organizations and culinary counterparts.  I have existing on-the-ground support to facilitate and implement my workshops and cooking classes to existing underserved youth programs in various cities around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially over the next forty-five days, that doesn't mean you can't help!

Other ways you can help include, but are not limited to:

  •  Be a Chef Theo Gumbs Fusion CrowdFUN Ambassador and help us get the word out about the #SweetandSavory campaign!
  •  Each one teach some and please share with all your friends, family and on social media!!
  •  By using the Indiegogo Sharing tools  to share #SweetAndSavory across your social media networks you can help generate a buzz and literally get the campaign trending!  

#WhatGrowsAroundComesAround #EachOneTeachSome #SweetAndSavory #CrowdFUN with #ChefTheoGumbs!

story:
Kurz

Letztes Jahr beschloss ich, auf Geburtstagsgeschenke zu verzichten und mir statt dessen Geld geben zu lassen - davon konnte ich dann 5x Ziegen an arme, nepalesische Familien übergeben. 

Aus dieser Idee heraus fliege ich nun kommenden Mai ( auf eigene Kosten ) nach Meghauli, Nepal, um dort armen Familien so viele Ziegen wie möglich zu finanzieren. 

Ziegen? Warum Ziegen?

Ziegen hatten schon immer den Ruf von nervenden und Ärger machenden Biestern. Doch sie tragen in vielen Ländern - so auch in Nepal - zur unmittelbaren Ernährungssicherung bei.
 Ziegen sind besonders widerstandsfähig, können sich auch von verdorrten Pflanzen ernähren und so Zeiten mit geringem Niederschlag und wenig Futter trotzen. 

Ziegen gegen Armut

Eine Ziege kann in Nepal eine ganze Familie ernähren. Ihre Milch ist überaus nahrhaft und fördert die gesunde Entwicklung der Kinder. Einige Familien verkaufen Milch und Käse, den sie selbst nicht benötigen. Mit jenem Geld können sie Medikamente oder Schulbücher für ihre Kinder kaufen. 

Und noch mehr: Ausscheidungen können als Düngemittel genutzt werden - und der Nachwuchs der Ziegen gegen Dinge wie teuere Werkzeuge eingetauscht werden! 
 Bereits mit 30 Euro schenken Sie somit einer Familie eine stabile Lebensgrundlage! 

Nepal Fakten:

  • 68 % der Erwerbstätigen in Nepal arbeiten in der Landwirtschaft 

  • Das durchschnittliche Monatseinkommen liegt bei nur 18 Euro

  • Industrielle Bedingungen sind in Nepal insbesondere aufgrund der schlechten Infrastruktur und der hohen Gefahr von Naturkatastrophen denkbar schlecht

Über Mich

Mein Name ist Ute Oussar. Seit über 20 Jahren bin ich in der Erwachsenenbildung (Erstausbildung körperbehinderter Jugendlicher) tätig und engagiere mich ehrenamtlich in verschiedenen Bereichen und Projekten (Sportverein, diverse Projekte in der 3. Welt, Tierschutz). 

Da ich besonders Menschen bewundere, die "vor Ort" helfen, habe ich seit langem nach einem Projekt gesucht, wo Hilfe wirkungsvoll ankommt. 

Durch unseren Betriebsarzt bekam ich schließlich Kontakt zum Gründer der Klinik Clinic Nepal und bereite mich nun auf meinen 1. Einsatz in Nepal vor, bei dem ich dieses Jahr im angegliederten Waisenhaus ehrenamtlich arbeiten werde, sowie - mit Ihrer Hilfe - vielen bedürftigen Familien helfe, sich selbst zu helfen... 

( Bildquellen: Titel - ACAF / Textbild -  travelwayoflife )

story:
Who are The Alkebulan Trust?

The Alkebulan Trust is a Non Profit Organization registered as a Limited By Guarantee in England and Wales. Our registration Number is 09284882. We have been established since October 2014.

What are your aims?

Our aims are to rebuild the infrastructure in Africa, beginning with the Education and Healthcare system. As this is a major task we are breaking it down into easy managable step by step goals. One of which is conducting weekly workshops in London, first to different age groups, and of African & Caribbean descent.

What are you raising funds for?

We are raising funds so we can secure our costs for the next 12 months. This includes administration costs like the phone bill, website maintenance, to securing time slots for the workshops and all the things necessary to conduct the workshop to a professional standard. So please go ahead and make your donation of any amount.

What if I don't have money to donate?

If you do not have any funds to donate. Then you can always share this campaign with your friends and family through e-mail or social media like Facebook.

story:
The CHI Method

Help me empower women, one habit at a time! (Unique Valentine's Day Gift, Fellas!)

In December, I had my fifth surgery in less than five years.

My adult life has been riddled with illnesses from PCOS to Endometriosis to most recently a life-altering diagnosis of Fibromyalgia. Despite these challenges, I still work full time at a Community Mental Health Center while balancing being a mom, wife, and caretaker of our home and pets.

As I laid in bed, recovering from my surgery, I found myself unhealthy and unhappy - and impulsively purchased my hundredth diet system after seeing my timelines filled with people's New Years' resolutions, pictures of successful people on the system, dreaming about wanting my own weight loss, and a special "one-time" offer.  

$300 later...

I am waiting for my shipment and instantly feeling regret. I realized I had hopped from identifying a problem - straight to a solution. I had taken no time to assess why the last 99 times had failed and what I required to be successful. I was just throwing money at the problem, hoping this solution might be the one that finally sticks. Sound familiar? 

I thought to myself - why am I successful in my business life but can't tackle my own weight? That’s when I realized I use proven continuous improvement models in business. I’ve personally seen the success they bring about in changing companies, cultures, processes, products and systems. 

Why had I not taken these successful methods and applied them to my own individual growth? 

The issue with many of these corporate systems is they typically have a narrow and specialized focus: Lean and Six Sigma focus heavily on the manufacturing world. Agile Methodology focuses on software teams. The Snowball Method focuses on paying off your debt. Cognitive Behavioral Analysis is usually done in Individual or Group Therapy. You get the idea.

I realized that there are important elements in these various systems I’ve used throughout my career that could be adapted and woven into a system that is focused on the individual and their growth - and The CHI Method was born.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's how you can help:

  • I am launching a 6-8 month Beta Team and you are invited!
  • My focus during Beta will not be on driving revenue, but on refining the system - collecting data - and building our success stories for an AWESOME Go Live Campaign as we head into 2021. 
  • I am currently paying all costs out of pocket, including 3 super talented lady soloprenuers who are building their own freelancing business. I believe in the Fight for $15 and want to be able to pay living wages for their hard work during our Beta Team Campaign.
  • I need to be able to market and promote the Beta Team Campaign so we can get a big, diverse group of women with big goals they need help achieving.  I hope you will help me spread the word, but some paid advertising goes a LONG way.
  • In an ideal world, I would love the freedom to be able to transition my time and efforts full-time to ChiCoach. (I actually LOVE my 8-5 position, but my Fibromyalgia has made it very difficult to perform on strict schedules and stress tends to make my flare-ups worse. I'm hoping to take lemons and make lemonade, as I'd much rather help others and run a business than eventually reach the point I need to be on disability.)

​
Here's what you can get:

  • All Beta Team Members will receive a FREE electronic copy of The Book of CHI and their ACHIVment Challenge Workbook. 
  • Our contributors will be able to earn additional rewards such as an exclusive badge and title in our ChiCoach Community.
  • Access to a VIP Grop for our ChiCoach Advanced(+) Founders, which provides you with early access to limited quantity or special offers.
  • One-on-One Coaching Lesson with the creator of The CHI Method.
  • A printed copy of The Book of CHI.
  • A printed copy of the ACHIVment Challenge Workbook.
     

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Joining our Beta Team is completely FREE.  You can apply now!
  • I'm an introvert who could REALLY use your help with social media love.  Could you help me make some noise?
  • Please share the Beta Team opportunity with women you know! 


Thanks in advance for your support!

story:
It's no secret that private music lessons are the most effective form of music education.

That's why Practicing Musician created online music education that emulates the private lesson experience.  To make sure our service is as effective as possible, our software and teaching tools are accompanied by video tutorials taught by members of the Seattle Symphony, PNW Ballet Orchestra, and other world-class organizations.

Until May 24th at 11:59pm, pay what you want for lifetime access to 1 of the 14 instruments we teach.  We suggest a payment of $150, but we know times are tough right now and will provide lifetime access for any amount you want.  $15?  $50?  Back us by making a contribution and enter a valid email address so we can provide you with a lifetime full access coupon code!

Why are we raising money you may ask?  We will truly emulate the private lesson experience by licensing and implementing one last piece of software. This software will allow Practicing Musician to provide real-time assessment and feedback as if a private teacher is present.

To do so will cost only $30,000 and require about 1 week of development. These funds will also allow us to upload over 2,000 additional video tutorials and sheet music that we have already produced.

Learning to play a musical instrument is fun and provides incredible benefits for people of all ages, so tell all your friends and family about this great opportunity.  Hurry, this exclusive Indiegogo offer ends on May 24th at 11:59pm!

What Is Practicing Musician?

Why Is Practicing Musician’s Service World-Class?

Practicing Musician is a team of world-class music teachers and Emmy award winners, and we've created a service that will more easily and effectively teach you how to play an instrument than anything on the market.  Our world-class music teachers include:

Our production team includes director John Jacobsen and videographer Kevin Klar, both of whom won an Emmy for their show The Artist Toolbox.  Here they are on Practicing Musician's set with flute teacher Colleen McElroy:

Why Is Practicing Musician Effective?

It's no secret that private lessons are the most effective form of music education.  That's why the very first thing we did was to deconstruct the private lesson process:

Then we spent 3 years combining the process with the most recent data from research that studied human development, cognition, and learning technologies.  The result is that you can access the private lesson experience right from the comfort of your own home:

Here's how each step in the process works.

Teacher Interviews and Performances

Private teachers know that you will only learn if you are inspired and motivated to learn.  Our interviews and performances will inspire and motivate you, no matter how beginning or advanced of a player you are:

 

 

 

 

 

Video Tutorials

Learning with Practicing Musician is easy and effective, even if you have no musical background at all. Our video tutorials are organized into chapters and take you step by step through the process of learning how to play the instrument of your choice. Here are examples from some of the beginning courses we offer.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We have already produced about 15 chapters for each of the 14 instruments we teach and will continue to create increasingly more advanced content so that you can continue learning for the rest of your life.

Sheet Music

You will either play sheet music that has been previously demonstrated in video tutorials or sight read sheet music to practice recently learned concepts.  Here are examples from some of the beginning courses we offer:

From percussion chapter “Rhythm 101”

From alto saxophone chapter “Pitch 101”

From viola “Song Library 1”

From trumpet chapter “Pitch 102”

From flute chapter “Scales 101”

From trombone chapter “Rhythm 102”

What Will You Get If You Back Us Today?

You will immediately get access to all of the sequentially ordered world-class content and teaching tools we have already launched, including: 

About 1 week after we reach our funding goal, you will also get access to the world's leading assessment software.

How Does Assessment Software Work?

Assessment software gives you immediate feedback and post-playing assessment as if a private teacher had listened to you play.  Watch this video to see how assessment software works:

In addition, we have already developed a progress tracking feature that will be synced to the assessment software.  We call our progress tracking system an Achievements Showcase because you win medals when you achieve high scores:

Does Practicing Musician Produce Results?

Absolutely!

Students and educators in private and public schools love Practicing Musician, as do individuals between the ages of 8-70 who have used our service at home.  Here are some student and educator testimonials:

Click HERE to create a free account and try out the content we've already launched.

What Do We Need?

With $30,000, we can license and implement the world’s leading assessment software and upload 2,000+ additional video tutorials, exercises, and songs that we have already produced:

What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

If we do not reach our $30,000 goal, our first priority is to license and implement the world's leading assessment technology.  This way, the content we have already launched truly emulates the private lesson experience.

What If We Raise More Than Our Goal?

1. Producing new content will always be one of our highest priorities so that you can continue learning throughout your life.

2. Until now, our development team has been working on a project to project basis. Think about how quickly they can build features that you and our other students request when they begin working full time!

3. Single Throw is a Tier 1 Google Premier Partner, meaning their outstanding marketing results have earned them the highest partnership badge Google offers.  Faster growth means better service and more features for you.

Other than money, how can you help?

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family.
  • Share this campaign with K-12 music educators, K-12 arts/fine arts coordinators, and other district officials.
  • Share this campaign with local organizations such as Boys & Girls Club of America, YMCA, churches, veterans group, assisted living or retirement homes, Boy Scouts of America, Girl Scouts of the United States ofAmerica, etc.
  • Stay connected.  Follow Practicing Musician on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram

Works Cited

  • Sapega, Sally.  “Playing an Instrument: Better for Your Brain than Just Listening.”  Penn Medicine News, 30 Jan. 2017, https://www.pennmedicine.org/news/news-blog/2017/january/playing-an-instrument-better-for-your-brain-than-just-listening.
  • Zuk, Jennifer, et al. “Behavioral and Neural Correlates of Executive Functioning in Musicians and Non-Musicians.” PLOS ONE, 17 June 2014, doi:https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0099868.
  • Pellegrinelli, Lara.  “Music Education In Public Schools Gets A Passing Grade.”  NPR, 6 April 2012, https://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2012/04/06/150133858/music-education-in-public-schools-gets-a-passing-grade.
story_txt:
It's no secret that private music lessons are the most effective form of music education.That's why Practicing Musician created online music education that emulates the private lesson experience.  To make sure our service is as effective as possible, our software and teaching tools are accompanied by video tutorials taught by members of the Seattle Symphony, PNW Ballet Orchestra, and other world-class organizations.Until May 24th at 11:59pm, pay what you want for lifetime access to 1 of the 14 instruments we teach.  We suggest a payment of $150, but we know times are tough right now and will provide lifetime access for any amount you want.  $15?  $50?  Back us by making a contribution and enter a valid email address so we can provide you with a lifetime full access coupon code!Why are we raising money you may ask?  We will truly emulate the private lesson experience by licensing and implementing one last piece of software. This software will allow Practicing Musician to provide real-time assessment and feedback as if a private teacher is present.To do so will cost only $30,000 and require about 1 week of development. These funds will also allow us to upload over 2,000 additional video tutorials and sheet music that we have already produced.Learning to play a musical instrument is fun and provides incredible benefits for people of all ages, so tell all your friends and family about this great opportunity.  Hurry, this exclusive Indiegogo offer ends on May 24th at 11:59pm!What Is Practicing Musician?Why Is Practicing Musician’s Service World-Class?Practicing Musician is a team of world-class music teachers and Emmy award winners, and we've created a service that will more easily and effectively teach you how to play an instrument than anything on the market.  Our world-class music teachers include:Our production team includes director John Jacobsen and videographer Kevin Klar, both of whom won an Emmy for their show The Artist Toolbox.  Here they are on Practicing Musician's set with flute teacher Colleen McElroy:Why Is Practicing Musician Effective?It's no secret that private lessons are the most effective form of music education.  That's why the very first thing we did was to deconstruct the private lesson process:Then we spent 3 years combining the process with the most recent data from research that studied human development, cognition, and learning technologies.  The result is that you can access the private lesson experience right from the comfort of your own home:Here's how each step in the process works.Teacher Interviews and PerformancesPrivate teachers know that you will only learn if you are inspired and motivated to learn.  Our interviews and performances will inspire and motivate you, no matter how beginning or advanced of a player you are:     Video TutorialsLearning with Practicing Musician is easy and effective, even if you have no musical background at all. Our video tutorials are organized into chapters and take you step by step through the process of learning how to play the instrument of your choice. Here are examples from some of the beginning courses we offer.      We have already produced about 15 chapters for each of the 14 instruments we teach and will continue to create increasingly more advanced content so that you can continue learning for the rest of your life.Sheet MusicYou will either play sheet music that has been previously demonstrated in video tutorials or sight read sheet music to practice recently learned concepts.  Here are examples from some of the beginning courses we offer:From percussion chapter “Rhythm 101”From alto saxophone chapter “Pitch 101”From viola “Song Library 1”From trumpet chapter “Pitch 102”From flute chapter “Scales 101”From trombone chapter “Rhythm 102”What Will You Get If You Back Us Today?You will immediately get access to all of the sequentially ordered world-class content and teaching tools we have already launched, including: About 1 week after we reach our funding goal, you will also get access to the world's leading assessment software.How Does Assessment Software Work?Assessment software gives you immediate feedback and post-playing assessment as if a private teacher had listened to you play.  Watch this video to see how assessment software works:In addition, we have already developed a progress tracking feature that will be synced to the assessment software.  We call our progress tracking system an Achievements Showcase because you win medals when you achieve high scores:Does Practicing Musician Produce Results?Absolutely!Students and educators in private and public schools love Practicing Musician, as do individuals between the ages of 8-70 who have used our service at home.  Here are some student and educator testimonials:Click HERE to create a free account and try out the content we've already launched.What Do We Need?With $30,000, we can license and implement the world’s leading assessment software and upload 2,000+ additional video tutorials, exercises, and songs that we have already produced:What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?If we do not reach our $30,000 goal, our first priority is to license and implement the world's leading assessment technology.  This way, the content we have already launched truly emulates the private lesson experience.What If We Raise More Than Our Goal?1. Producing new content will always be one of our highest priorities so that you can continue learning throughout your life.2. Until now, our development team has been working on a project to project basis. Think about how quickly they can build features that you and our other students request when they begin working full time!3. Single Throw is a Tier 1 Google Premier Partner, meaning their outstanding marketing results have earned them the highest partnership badge Google offers.  Faster growth means better service and more features for you.Other than money, how can you help?

story:
Short Summary

  • Owner & Master Canner, Lyn Deardorff, has over 40 years of preserving experience plus more than six years of teaching various preserving classes in the Atlanta, North Georgia & Nashville areas — and years of retail management & financial management experience. 
  • The Atlanta area has very few choices for learning the various lost arts in food.  Our new Learning Kitchen will provide a complete space for learning, including an area with class-related supplies available for purchase.
  • Our pop-ups are designed to serve as an "incubator" for fledgling businesses and instructors to try out products and methods.  
  • We'll provide healthy, organic preserved foods for sale.
  • We'll be adding a host of Atlanta instructors in the various food arts that complement our class line-up, offering a way for knowledgeable cooks & crafters to share their skills while earning a competitive market fee.

What We Need 

  • We require funding to do our initial build out. We have identified a location for our business in a fun, market environment—the nearly 100-year-old Sweet Auburn Curb Market—located in a very accessible area of downtown Atlanta. (The unfinished space is shown above).  It has ample space to provide a full teaching kitchen plus space for pop-ups, demos and events.  Additionally, we'll have a retail section comprised of all the necessary preserving and related tools & supplies that we can personally recommend for the home preserver and related workshops. 
  • We are looking for funding for capital equipment purchases including cooktops & ovens, cabinetry, basic kitchen supplies and for our build-out with shelving and related construction. We already have sinks and a refrigerator in place. We would like to begin purchasing a small start-up inventory of retail items.
What You Get & The Impact

  • Your perks for contributions include class coupons & events offerings, jars of our organic preserved foods, a customized Preserving Class and a space at our Celebration Table!
  • Our community will gain students who learn food skills to prepare healthy & tasty meals for their family, to preserve their garden production and to take advantage of local farmers' markets seasonal food to preserve for year-around use.  It will enable them to avoid packaged, prepared foods that contain preservatives, chemicals, heavy sugars & salts, artificial colors and flavors, and so much more.
  • All our classes will be offered for reasonable fees.  We'll be offering low-cost classes & workshops as well as discounted and/or free classes for college students or those unable to afford the fees.  We'll also be offering intern possibilities for culinary and other students interested in learning these "lost arts".

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that not everyone can offer financial assistance, here is how you can help us achieve our goal.

  • Spread the word about Preserving Now's Learning Kitchen. 
  • Share this link with your friends 
  • Refer potential class students & customers back to our website, social media, and more. 
  • Indiegogo offers great tools to help you help us spread the word.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Owner & Master Canner, Lyn Deardorff, has over 40 years of preserving experience plus more than six years of teaching various preserving classes in the Atlanta, North Georgia & Nashville areas — and years of retail management & financial management experience. 

The Atlanta area has very few choices for learning the various lost arts in food.  Our new Learning Kitchen will provide a complete space for learning, including an area with class-related supplies available for purchase.

Our pop-ups are designed to serve as an "incubator" for fledgling businesses and instructors to try out products and methods.  

We'll provide healthy, organic preserved foods for sale.

We'll be adding a host of Atlanta instructors in the various food arts that complement our class line-up, offering a way for knowledgeable cooks & crafters to share their skills while earning a competitive market fee.
What We Need 
We require funding to do our initial build out. We have identified a location for our business in a fun, market environment—the nearly 100-year-old Sweet Auburn Curb Market—located in a very accessible area of downtown Atlanta. (The unfinished space is shown above).  It has ample space to provide a full teaching kitchen plus space for pop-ups, demos and events.  Additionally, we'll have a retail section comprised of all the necessary preserving and related tools & supplies that we can personally recommend for the home preserver and related workshops. 

We are looking for funding for capital equipment purchases including cooktops & ovens, cabinetry, basic kitchen supplies and for our build-out with shelving and related construction. We already have sinks and a refrigerator in place. We would like to begin purchasing a small start-up inventory of retail items.
What You Get & The Impact


Your perks for contributions include class coupons & events offerings, jars of our organic preserved foods, a customized Preserving Class and a space at our Celebration Table!

Our community will gain students who learn food skills to prepare healthy & tasty meals for their family, to preserve their garden production and to take advantage of local farmers' markets seasonal food to preserve for year-around use.  It will enable them to avoid packaged, prepared foods that contain preservatives, chemicals, heavy sugars & salts, artificial colors and flavors, and so much more.

All our classes will be offered for reasonable fees.  We'll be offering low-cost classes & workshops as well as discounted and/or free classes for college students or those unable to afford the fees.  We'll also be offering intern possibilities for culinary and other students interested in learning these "lost arts".



Other Ways You Can Help
We realize that not everyone can offer financial assistance, here is how you can help us achieve our goal.

Spread the word about Preserving Now's Learning Kitchen. 
Share this link with your friends 
Refer potential class students & customers back to our website, social media, and more. 
Indiegogo offers great tools to help you help us spread the word.

story:
Hello,  I am Alan Komrosky owner and founder of Hell Creek Relics LLC

Since 1993, I've been making my way out to the Badlands of North Dakota. Hiking private land in search of the perfect dig site. 

I have a passion for finding and recovering dinosaur bones to preserve for the future.  Most can be seen at the Museum of World Treasures in Wichita, Kansas where complete skeletons include a 42 foot T-Rex,  a 14 foot piranha-like Xiphactinus fish, and a giant mosasaur.  Each of these exhibits provided enough funding to keep us in the field for another year or two.  We currently have a triceratops skeleton ("Bob" pictured above) on display at Geo Décor in Tucson, Arizona that has completely exhausted our resources. 

Last year we had the good fortune to experience the thrill of discovery three separate times.  Unfortunately, the real work and expense to recover these fossils remain ahead of us. 

It is a race against time, and mother nature, as erosion can splinter the bones destroying them in just a couple of seasons. Reaching our goal would ensure these priceless fossils are here for the future, providing inspiration to children and educating us all about our distant past. 

Your contribution will provide direct expenses for fuel, small tools, glue, jacketing supplies, and backhoe fees.

Reaching our goal would certainly exhilarate and motivate us for the 2017 digging season.

                                                                                     Thank you so much,  Alan

story:
Last year saw the debut of Bare Lit 2016: a literary festival focused on the work of writers of colour. Together with your love and support we brought more than 30 writers together, making Bare Lit 2016 an unforgettable experience – both for you and for us!

And now we're ready to make Bare Lit 2017 happen - so get your tickets here!

While some of the money we need will be raised with support from our partners and a pending Arts Council application, we still need to sell tickets to make £8000 to cover the costs of paying writers, booking venues, promotion and festival administration.

This will help us to provide the best festival experience we can for attendees and affirm the importance of valuing writers of colour in the UK literary scene.

Buy your weekend & day festival tickets

Or if you can't attend but you want to contribute you can nab a Bare Lit 2017 tote bag

As well as giving your support, we hope you can join us for what promises to be yet another groundbreaking cultural event!

We will be updating this page with more info on panels and sessions for Bare Lit 2017 shortly.

Lots of love,

Team Bare Lit x

Additional notes

- If you really can't afford to buy tickets but would like to attend the festival, please send us an email so that we can try to help you.

- Our venue is accessible, but if you need any specific adjustments to attend then please email us.

Find us on 
Twitter: @BareLit
Website: www.barelitfestival.com
Email: barelitfestival[at]gmail[dot]com

story:
Felipe Femur

Felipe Femur is a free children’s website (www.felipefemur.com), designed and run by us— brothers David and Russell Dorn. Together, in our off time, we create stories, games, and activities for kids, featuring our ironic monster characters. Our characters include Felipe Femur the skeleton with a lot of heart, Sunny Stoker the sun-loving vampire, Gummy Garou the toothless werewolf, and many more. Our characters demonstrate the old adage “Don’t judge a book by its cover,” as well as encourage children to see the good in different people, resist seeing in stereotypes, and promote thinking outside the box.

We’d like to continue making fun content and characters, but it’s getting harder and harder to pay for development, web hosting, supplies, and everything else that goes into the website, books, and games, all of which we’ve been doing out of our own pockets. With your help, we can continue to put out free content for kids, as well as develop more educational activities, books, and games, and a new “humerus” animated web series. We also hope to expand the Toonstone universe and add even more relatable monster characters.

 

What Do We Need?

Money received will go into development tools including an iOS adaptor program so we can get our current and future apps on Apple devices instead of just Android; web hosting and website updates/upkeep; additional staff (editor), as well as voice acting talent fees; craft and recipe supplies; original music (theme) composition fee; advertisement; and research and development of educational content and new media outlets such as the planned web series. In addition, we want to produce physical copies of our children’s e-books, so we need help with ISBN fees and set up costs.

 

What Do You Get?

$1 (1) We will frame this first dollar and send you a picture of it via e-mail; Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage.

 

$5 - Pitch us a craft idea. We’ll choose our favorite five ideas from all those submitted and develop them into craft posts. Your concept must be appropriate for kids and affordable to create. Nominees will receive idea credits. Generalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you (.PNG format); Plus, your name will be added to the thank you webpage.

$10 – Rotten Recipes - Pitch us a spooky recipe idea. We’ll choose our favorite five ideas from all those submitted and develop them into recipe posts. Your concept must be appropriate for kids and affordable to create and preferably spooky. Nominees will receive recipe creator credits. Also, feel free to throw in a craft idea with conditions and perks described above. Generalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you (.PNG format); Plus, your name will be added to the thank you webpage.

 

$15 (500) – Copy (1) of our Android app, Scary Stories for Kids 2 (Full Edition); if you’d like, pitch us one craft and one recipe idea, subject to conditions mentioned above; Generalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you (.PNG format); Plus, your name will be added to the thank you webpage.

$20 - Your choice of any one of our eBooks. Also, pitch us one craft and one recipe idea, subject to conditions mentioned above;Generalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you (.PNG format); Plus, your name will be added to the thank you webpage.

 

$25 - Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Also, pitch us one craft and one recipe idea, subject to conditions mentioned above; Your choice of any one of our eBooks; Name added to thank you webpage.

 

$50 - Your choice of any two of our eBooks; Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Also, pitch us one craft and one recipe idea, subject to conditions mentioned above; Name added to thank you webpage.

 

$100 - Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur art; Your choice of any four of our eBooks; Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Also, pitch us one craft and one recipe idea, subject to conditions mentioned above; Name added to thank you webpage.

$200 - Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur artwork; Handmade bar (1) of soap from KAKE (“Frightful Fruit”); Copy of each of our Kindle eBooks (6); Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage.

$300 - Choice of Felipe Femur or Loch Ness T-shirt; Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur art, Copy of each of our Kindle eBooks(6);  Handmade bar (1) of soap from KAKE (“Frightful Fruit”); Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage.

 

$500 - David will turn you into a Toonstone background character; Choice of Felipe Femur or Loch Ness T-shirt; Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur art; plus first look at our future characters; Copy of each of our Kindle eBooks(6); KAKE soap bar (“Frightful Fruit”); Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage.

 

$1000 - Russell will write a children’s story with your given prompt or theme to be added to website (inspired by credits to you); Personalized thank you letter signed by Artist and writer; David will turn you into a Toonstone background character; Choice of Felipe Femur or Loch Ness T-shirt; Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur art; plus first look at our future characters; Copy of each of our Kindle eBooks(6); KAKE soap bar (“Frightful Fruit”); Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage. 

$2500+ - We will turn you into a Toonstone celebrity; Personalized thank you letter signed by Artist and writer; Russell will write a children’s story with your given prompt or theme to be added to website (inspired by credits to you); Felipe Femur and Loch Ness T-shirt; Signed print copy of original Felipe Femur art; plus first look at our future characters; Copy of each of our Kindle eBooks (6); KAKE soap bar (“Frightful Fruit”); Personalized Certificate of Contribution e-mailed to you with your name on it (.PNG format); Name added to thank you webpage.    

 

 

Risks & Challenges

Issues always arise, and there are always struggles when it comes to technology specifically, but we’re confident we can work through them.

 

David has been a professional graphic artist for nearly a decade and Russell is working on finishing up his masters in creative writing. Both of us have worked with children in after school programs, and David has taught children in South Korea English for several years and received a lot of great ideas of what kids will love from doing so. Together, we’re confident we can achieve our goals of creating original content for children.

 

We’ve done this much with just the two of us—imagine what we can all do together!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that sometimes you can’t financially contribute, but you can still help! You can help by getting the word out. Share this Indiegogo link, follow us on Twitter (Felipe Femur/ZebraFox) and Facebook, and/or take a look at our android games (all free) and Kindle e-books (usually one up for a free promotion).
